Reviews.Title: “Has Some Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the theater area of downtown Chicago, which is centrally located. It is a Kimpton property, which generally means it is in an older building that has had some cosmetic updating. The pros: nice people; wine reception, free coffee in the morning in the lobby; pretty nice fitness center; free internet if you join the Kimpton program (which is free, so just do it); pretty quiet. The cons; my room was TINY-tiny closet (clothes had to hang diagonally, had to move the iron board to make room); tiny bathroom; window facing wall; main areas and hallways rather drab. Overall, I would stay here for a night, but wouldn't stay here for longer or if I wanted my stay to center around my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value on New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: theycallmekacey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on NYE with a friend and we got an amazing deal of $144/nite for a total (including fees, taxes) of $167. This is a great boutique hotel and my second time at a Kimpton property. My impression of Kimpton hotels so far is stylish, great location, excellent service. The room was small but not tiny, and right in line with any other boutique hotel in the city. There are a lot of small details that make the rooms very comfy and sleek. Decor is very unique and the beds were luxurious. There were 2 very fluffy robes in our room which was a nice touch. Because it was New Year's Eve, they had a champagne hour in the lobby which was a nice surprise. In the morning, it was a hot chocolate bar. Both Kimpton hotels I've stayed at had i-pod docks in the room which is a big win for me. I love having music in the room when I'm getting ready. Wireless is free if you sign up for Kimpton loyalty program (which takes maybe 2 minutes and is free). One thing I will say which became a running joke is the tiny closet. We were only there 1 night so we just had coats to put in, but it is literally only 8 inches deep, so the coat hangers have to be hung at an angle. This would've bugged me if I stayed there multiple nights on a business trip, but in my case, it was just a funny detail. Great stay and I'd love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good find.”
Reviews.Author: Welsh39
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through "Hotwire" site, so had a good deal. Trip was a weekend off from a business trip. Plenty to eat and drink round about the hotel, walking distance to Millennium Park, Michigan Avenue, etc. Short Taxi rides to other attractions. Rooms OK but storage space for hanging anything is a bit tight. Friendly and helpful staff. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: GokceSezgin
Reviews.Content: If you need a very decent hotel in downtown, Allegro will just do it. I only spent one night, and was there for a business trip, therefore didn't see anything else in the hotel other than my room. The room was comfortable, despite its small size (which is the case for most downtown hotels). It was very quiet, and the bed was very comfy. The design/decoratino of the room was fun, as with most Kimpton hotels, and brings it apart from the boring and expected hotel room decoration of many standard, big name hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal.”
Reviews.Author: midwest_muser
Reviews.Content: Booked the Allegro on Hotwire for a weekend in Chicago. At the price we paid on Hotwire, it was a great deal. The rooms are small. Really small. The bathroom is really small. Our view was an office building. All that said, it's lovely. The staff are really wonderful. The room was spotless. The 5PM reception was nice. The location is OK. We werent theatre goers, which is the immediate area. We were still handy to most everything. Getting around downtown is easy. It's much safer than you would expect. We love Chicago! The Allegro is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Fun”
Reviews.Author: Flipflopgirl40503
Reviews.Content: Affordable luxury right next door to the Cadillac Palace theater. LOVED the free hot chocolate/coffee/tea in the lobby as well as the wine, etc. in the afternoon. Staff was very professional & accommodating of all requests. Will definitely be my 1st choice when returning to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: snowboarder155
Reviews.Content: The rooms were petite but very high standards. The location was fantastic and just a 15min walk from all the main sites. Staff were very helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kerbach
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with hotel staff, amenities and decor. Stayed 3 nights and enjoyed the free wine reception (from 5 - 6pm) in the large, modern lobby. Free tea and coffee offered each morning. I was recooping from a sinus infection and the front desk had a humidifier brought up at no cost! I highly recommend taking advantage of this even without a cold as hotel air can be quite dry. Flat screen tv, clean bathroom (bathtub was great), modern fixtures. Location was great - off the busy shopping streets but still walkable. Check out Block 37, only 3 blocks away from the hotel. Great shopping, lunch spots, and salon!

Reviews.Title: “Good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: aschwegm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. A very comfortable hotel bed. Nice design and pretty good location.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wistraveler09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next door to the Cadillac Palace theater which was very convenient. They have a wonderful bar and restaurant attached, so don't need to leave unless you want to. The lobby is wonderful, very large and full of comfy places to sit. The decor is modern and has clean lines. Our room was small and would not want to spend much time in it since the only place to sit was the bed. There was a desk but only one chair, the room was, however, spotlessly clean. We were located near the elevator and groups getting off were not always quiet which made it hard to fall asleep. I would stay again if I were going to a show in the theater district but ask for a room further down the hall. . If you want to enjoy the free wine hour, get downstairs early.....people lined up quickly!

Reviews.Title: “A Kimpton in Name Only”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: First off, we love Kimpton hotels. We absolutely adore them. We have given the Allegro two chances now to win our business and both visits have been less than stellar. Looking at our most recent stay, we chose their largest room, a King Suite with 2 person Jacuzzi. I had asked the concierge if they could assist with some champagne and chocolates in the room when we arrived and was assured it would be taken care of. I even offered to pay for them and Anthony assured me it was on the house. We arrived a little after 5 in the evening and proceeded to wait about 20 minutes to check in. It was a Friday evening and the hotel was quite busy, but they only had 1 individual working the check-in desk. We finally got checked in and went upstairs to the room. We walked in and though the room was nice, it was quite worn. The tabletops were full of scratches and water marks and the carpet had some stains. It was overall very clean though. One thing missing though, was the chocolates and champagne. I was assured they would be in the room for the surprise. Well I went downstairs and the concierge was nowhere to be found. I went to the front desk and waited through the line again and explained. She looked it up and said, "oh yes I see that amenity was added, I'm sorry they must be on their way, wait a bit and they should show up." I went back upstairs and we got changed for going out and still no amenity. I tried calling the concierge and finally got through. He apologized and said he would send them up right away. When they arrived we received 4 bon bons ina plastic container and a bottle of brut. OK, I get it, it was a free amenity, but I would have paid for something a little more extravagant, and if it would have been on time. Our next problem was they gave us an adjoining suite with the baseball weekend revelers from you-know-where. They were so loud and obnoxious we could hear every word of their vulgar conversations. Ultimately I decided to go say something at the front desk. They said they would send security up and that they had no other rooms, I would have to just wait and see if security could quiet them. We went out to dinner and came back to you guessed it, party central next door. I called the front desk again, and they said they woudl send a friendly reminder up to them. They quieted down for about 20 minutes then back at it again. Luckily our sleeping quarters were on the other side of the suite. The next morning we could hear every word of the housekeepers' inappropriate conversation next door. Think slurs and sexual innuendo... The next day the front desk manager sent a cheese and wine amenity up to make up for the hassle but again, I would have rather had a quiet night than cheese and bubbly. Alltogether, it would be ok for a business stay or quick overnight but I think we are done attempting the Allegro Chicago experience. We will take our business to Palomar or Monaco, or on further up to the Gold Coast hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We love Kimpton & Corie!”
Reviews.Author: Krisgrmi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times, the most out of any Kimpton hotel. Fantastic lobby hosts a great wine hour, from which to springboard your evening from in style. Decor is stylish, and the beds comfortable. The difference here is the staff - always top-notch, friendly and helpful. The last visit we had the pleasure of having Corie as our bellman both when we arrived and when we were leaving - not only did he remember me & our girls but he got them Shirley Temples for the road! You're not going to get THAT kind of service at a Holiday Inn... Not the best location for some tourist areas, but great for business travelers (my husband works for a company nearby). Plus, walking is the best way to see a city so I don't mind a few extra blocks. The pleasure of the property makes up for it and more.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay”
Reviews.Author: beccarette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for several nights of a business trip. This was my first stay in a Kimpton Hotel, and I was impressed by the brand. The furnishings of the lobby and room were very fun. I loved the wallpaper in my room. All of the furnishings were well done. The room was very small, but I think this is somewhat expected in the downtown of a large city. I thought they did well to make the most of the room. For instance, the double doors into the bathroom. My only complaint about the room was that the lighting was very blue - almost florescent in color. It wasn't very cozy. Oh, and the closet was extremely small. The location of the hotel was great for walking downtown. I will definitely look to stay at other Kimpton properties based on this stay. And, even though the room was smaller, I preferred this hotel to the Sheraton Towers where I have also stayed. The room was maintained and furnished much better.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Trendy Decor”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly, informative and accommodating. We received top of line service during our entire stay. I especially enjoyed cocktail hour featuring specialty drinks and hor'dourves. I selected this hotel largely based on pictures of rooms I saw on-line. The decor exceeded my expectations in person. I also enjoyed the fact this is a pet-friendly hotel. Overall, the Allegro provides a fresh, modern, unique experience and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Allegro, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tdoran
Reviews.Content: I once wrote a review of the Hotel Allegro, which somehow thanks to me, was truncated. I would like to expand a bit upon that review as I have just finished my 2011-2012 Lyric Opera Season and have spent six nights at the Allegro. First, the staff is just great, so friendly, so helpful. Once this year I had to arrive early for a luncheon at noon and was sure my room would not be ready until the usual 3:00 P.M. hour, but it was ready and I did not have to schlepp around luggage. The location is just fabulous as the Hotel is located on Randolph which is really alive these days as to musicals. The Restaurant 312 located in the Hotel has turned into an outstanding Italian locale and the pastas are really great, and not expensive as Chicago prices go. I certainly can recommend dining there once while one is in Chicago. The lobby of the hotel is so pleasant and though busy, it is almost always quiet. A nice place for a conversation and at 5:00 P.M. there is complimentary wine. The rooms are small as this Hotel was built in think in the 1920â€™s, but has been so beautifully renovated , but the rooms are impeccably clean and comfortable and though the bath is also small, the plumbing is modern and it has a great shower. Of course, if one wants larger rooms or even a suite, they are available, but I began my traveling around fifty years ago with Europe on Five Dollars a Day-now, an hour or less ,and so I seek out moderately priced places as long as I am pleased with the service, the room, etc. Chicago has some fabulously opulent Hotels, but one can always just pop in for a drink or whatever. Buen viaje. T. Doran

Reviews.Title: “Warm lobby , small guest room”
Reviews.Author: tsgbhalf
Reviews.Content: First time stay, two nights. The lobby feel was warm and lively. The guest room was small and a bit cramped. We will try again and see about room options.

Reviews.Title: “Neat ecclectic hotel. Would be great for theater nights. Worth a look/stay.”
Reviews.Author: PhilipL4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a college audition for my son. The building is very nice and the staff very helpful. The design is more modern, but very comfortable. I do enjoy the layout and amenities of the room. Look at these, which are more than most hotels. Including a humidifier free upon request, also an exercise kit to use, also free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nmbt211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Nice, but I would not go back. I have been to Chicago several times, rather stay on Michigan ave. They have cocktail hours & free drinks in the lobby around 5 pm. If you get a good deal & willing to walk, go ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackgreen
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in both Chicago and at the Hotel Allegro. We experienced very friendly service; the wine hour is definitely a good idea to leave satisfied customers. All facilities were to a high standard and worked efficiently. Any drawbacks? The location is great for business travellers, but if you're a tourist, it leaves you a little away from the evening action. The room wasn't fantastically large by American standards, although for someone coming from Europe, it was more than adequate. I suppose the fact that getting free Wi-Fi involves giving your email address, which then leaves you getting frequent Kimpton mails until you unsubscribe is a bit annoting.

Reviews.Title: “Angel checked me in and Jesus brought room service”
Reviews.Author: ElmCityAfficionado
Reviews.Content: I'm not kidding -- those are their names. Great staff, huge and stylish room (jacuzzi king suite), ridiculous value, good food, Aveda bath products, comfortable beds. I will admit i'm a loyal Kimpton customer and love earning those free nights. This is the second time I've stayed at the Allegro -- first time was several years ago. I'm enjoying this stay and will stay here again. But there is room for improvement. Housekeeping failed to remove the previous guest's used soap -- gross. I told woman at the front desk as i left for a meeting, expecting to come back to find some sort of apology gift -- nada. Don't they teach them the first rule of hospitality. Walls are a little thin, which did not affect my sleep at all because my bedroom was in a corner, but i felt i had to keep the TV volume low in the livingroom so as not to disturb my neighbor, since i could hear him. Fitness room is too small - every machine occupied at 6 am so a few of us left without our exercise. Nevertheless, if you want a rock star experience for the price you would pay for a regular room at a boring hotel, check out the Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: emehrer
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Hotel Allegro. This time was only for a single night but this will definitely be my hotel of choice for return trips to Chicago. The location is perfect, right in the Loop/Theatre District. It's classic, art deco styled hotel that, while upgraded, has retained that its character. The rooms are a little small, but typical of that older style hotel (so, if you're expecting something a little more modern and larger, you might be disappointed). In keeping with the spirit of the place, they have a cocktail hour in the hotel's grand lobby ... very cool and great way to meet people.

Reviews.Title: “Allegross”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: I would like to start this review by getting the theme of â€œThe Adams Familyâ€� in your head, complete with the timely finger snap. Are you with me? Okâ€¦here we goâ€¦ Da dun dun dun / snap snapâ€¦ Once out of the cab, a gruff bell man emerged. He didnâ€™t say 2 words to us and didnâ€™t look particularly happy to be working in general. He just started to take our things from the cab, without a word, and loaded them onto a rack to wheel off. He wasnâ€™t polite, or welcoming, but more abrupt and grumpy. Ok, Sir, fine. (â€œTheyâ€™re creepy and their cookeyâ€¦â€�) Once inside, the bellman took off, no where to be found or to be seen again. We stood inside of what looked EXACTLY like an old haunted house in this makeshift lobby area. Where do we go now? There was no reception area on the street level, and it is bit confusing. We both looked at each other unsure of where to go next. There was an eerie stairwell in the center of the room, and we were searching for the reception area so we could check in. We walked over to some bar / restaurant to the left, jiggled the door handle andâ€¦nothing. It was locked and no one inside. We just looked at each other, blankly. Suddenly, the elevator doors opened and a lurch-like, creepy elevator guy emerged. (â€œMysterious and spookeyâ€¦â€�) â€œHello, right this wayâ€¦â€� We hopped in with him, and once exited, THIS now looked a lot more like a Kimpton property that I am used to: trendy, swanky, and boutique-ie. We were going to be a little early for our reservation so I had called ahead early to get put down for an early check in to our suite. When we got there, a female manager, red headed with a strict-like personality retorted that the check in time is 3 PM and she canâ€™t get us in until then. Again, this employee wasnâ€™t particularly welcoming or accomodating. Ugh. I would have appreciated a call saying they canâ€™t meet this request, but can take us at 3 PM, so we could have planned accordingly. We were just at the absolutely STUNNING Park Hyatt Chicago and could have gotten a late check out at 2:30 PM, which would have timed us perfectly for our check in at the Allegro. We sat calmly and enjoyed the lemon flavored ice water in trendy containers in the lobby. This was a nice touch, and we relaxed while we waited for our room to be ready. It occurred to us that we needed to eat, so we made our way to the dining room that is connected to the lobby. (BTW, she could have suggested a meal in the dining area while we waited as by the time it occurred to us that one existed, they were close to their closing time.) When we entered the restaurant, there wasnâ€™t a soul upstairs, and certainly not a worker to direct us. Were they open? Were they closed? Not a peep. It was just empty inside andâ€¦eerie. We made our way downstairs where we had to negotiate with the staff for a cup of coffee. They told us that their brunch was about to end and they would be shutting down for a while. Nowâ€¦this is just a bit weird to me. Most hotels keep their restaurants open to accommodate their guests. This was sort of annoying. Looking around, half of the restaurant was abandoned and our waitress was very odd. (â€œTheyâ€™re all together ookyâ€¦â€�) Obviously, based on my description, this hotel property is just a little strange. The staff is pretty mixed in demeanor and just inconsistent all around. Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s good: The food here is excellent and well priced. This is one quality that I have come to count on and expect from Kimpton properties. The food here was REALLY good. We got the mushroom and goat cheese crostini and coffees. They ended up serving us and this was great. Unlike the killer, shockingly high breakfast prices that you may find at other Chicago hotels (like the Conrad, etc) you wonâ€™t find bad prices here. Instead, they are very fair priced, nice portions and amazing food. (Points for that.) You get more than what you pay for here, and I find that at most Kimpton properties. Finally checked into our 2 person Jacuzzi suite, it was quite underwhelming. The absolutely stunning professional pictures online is what lured us in, coupled with a rock bottom price on this room, the â€œbestâ€� they have there. Wow. Looking around the room, we were not blown away, I have to say. This hotel was built in the 1920â€™s and was renovated, but it still feels dark, dingy and cheap, no matter how â€œKimptonizedâ€� it was. It still just feels like a cheap, slapped together hotel. The dÃ©cor is old and the furnishings look like it was cobbled together from various garage sales. It wasnâ€™t the sleek, modern, cool vibe that you get with most Kimpton hotels. Fret not, you still get the amazing Kimpton amenities, like the animal printed robes (classic!) and the $10 in free minibar with your Kimpton rewards membership. Also, I did find the bathroom to be pretty cool, and well designed. This was probably the one area that felt like a true Kimpton property. We did enjoy the complementary wine hour, although we are not big wine drinkers in general. They were playing pleasant music and it had a more friendly vibe downstairs for the hour. I would say that the Jacuzzi was average and nothing too special; I wasnâ€™t impressed so much. The linens were cheap and not necessarily comfortable to sleep in. We longed for the plush and opulent linens and comforter of the Chicago Park Hyatt. Even the lighting in the room seemed low budge and inadequate. Maybe we are just not â€œoldâ€� hotel people and donâ€™t appreciate the history of the building, where other people will absolutely love it here. It just really wasnâ€™t for us and we would probably not come back. I did however, like the Kimpton Palomar in downtown Chicago, which I would recommend to anyone. I probably wouldn't come back to the Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: kaufma22
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Allegro three times now and it just keeps getting better and better! We brought our dog with us this time. Kimpton hotels are truly pet-friendly (i.e., NO additional charges for your dog's stay.) The location of the hotel is great--walking distance to plenty of restaurants and shopping. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to get to and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago for a meeting... Stayed here for the location and proximity to Wow Bao! Room was nice, clean and well designed. Employees were friendly and service was fast! Reasonable rates are the norm, it appears. Took the L to the station closest to State and Lake and popped in Wow Bao to grab some grub. Took it to he hotel, ate, watched TV' took a bath and got a great nights sleep. For someone on the road all the time, that's about as good as it gets! I will stay there again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time even better!”
Reviews.Author: Belle0242
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Allegro. We were here for a wedding room block this time (August 2011), all staff was fantastic, friendly and very helpful. Had a chance to go into their large suite (one with a pool table). Very spacious and great for a gathering of people. We will be back!! Only down side was it was Lalapalooza so the rate was higher than norm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnaka
Reviews.Content: Tge friendliness of the staff is great. They have a customer first Ttitude. The room was well kept and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Pleasure for A Great Price”
Reviews.Author: richard_traveler
Reviews.Content: This place is a class act. I'm amazed to have gotten a room for only $125 -- maybe because its in the depths of winter. In the center of The Loop. Nice, inventive rooms, well decorated. Historic place (1926) but no dinginess. Wine/beer reception every day at 5. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Erin R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing stay. The location is great, the staff is very friendly and the hotel itself is gorgeous. Our room was large and wonderfully appointed. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate room”
Reviews.Author: SoCalNative7
Reviews.Content: I have always liked Kimpton hotels, but the Allegro was a bit under-par. The room was very small, and the bathroom was miniscule. While I don't need a lot of space, I don't like to feel so cramped while brushing my teeth. That being said, $130/night for New Years weekend is a great deal, and the location made it very easy to get around town. It is within a couple of blocks from almost all of the major train lines and there are plenty of restaurants, bars, etc nearby. In my limited interactions with the hotel staff, they seemed very helpful and accommodating. No complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, comfy business hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeffantm
Reviews.Content: I've spent several weeks at the Allegro and, without fail, the beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The interior design is terrific and it's warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Dtwice
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip in Chicago. I am not a seasoned traveler so going to Chicago was intimidating to me. To top it all off I also got the stomach bug as we landed. April at the front desk was patient and understanding with my situation. I was booked for one night -two days. The day I arrived I was in my room ill...I ordered room service later that evening and they were helpful and prompt with the service. I plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Join the Club”
Reviews.Author: travelprinces
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kimpton hotel that I have stayed at, once in NYC and now in Chicago. I have always had good experiences when staying at the Kimpton hotels. This location was in the heart of downtown and right around the corner from a El Train station. It was further away from Magificent Mile, the Museums and the Navy Pier but we did not mind this as it was close to the theatre, great places to eat and close to public transportation. Since I am a Kimpton loyalty member I got a great deal on the hotel, plus they added a $10 credit to the Mini Bar. Added to this, every morning the hotel serves coffee, tea and hot chocolate with all the fixings- it was so nice because before I get started in the morning I need my coffee!!! From 5 to 6 they serve complimentary wine, beer ( a specific kind brewed in the Windy City) and hoti-toti's! We stayed over the New Years Eve weekend and were told the restaurant had a small NYE party- they serves specialty drinks made just for that night, they were a bit pricey but super fun! I would highly recommend staying at Hotel Allegro in Chicago and will stay there during our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Too hot or too cold”
Reviews.Author: WalktheCIty
Reviews.Content: Stayed there New Years Eve. Rates were good compared to other hotels in the area, but you got what you paid for. The heating system was hard to control due to the small size of the room. It was either too hot or too cold alternately. Bathroom very tiny as was room, but it is Chicago, where rooms are small. Bed comfortable, service at desk OK, enough towels, bring your own shampoo and conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zsazsaDetroit
Reviews.Content: We are huge fans of Kimpton Hotels but have a special fondness for the Hotel Allegro. Their staff is wonderful and very accommodating! We travel with our dog and it is always amazing to us how welcoming they are of pets. So many hotels claim to be dog friendly but the Hotel Allegro truly means it! We have always found the rooms well appointed, comfortable and clean. We love their hosted wine hour, which often includes not only wine but beers from a local Chicago brewery or a specialty drink depending on the season. On our last visit in December, they offered hot toddies that were delicious! The location is great with theaters nearby (one is right next door), millennium park a few short blocks away and shopping on state street. The hotel restaurant 312 is a great place to have breakfast, the omelets are so tasty and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the thought of pets put you off this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: itssmeeLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that when I found out that this hotel was 'pet friendly' I was really put off the idea of staying here as although I like animals and have pets myself the thought of staying in a room that may have a 'doggie' smell just didn't appeal to me. Well I need not have worried!! No doggie smells at the Allegro!!! I was allocated a room on the 14th floor (which is I understand is a pet free floor) which was fine for me, had I been sharing it, it may have been a little 'compact' but as I wasn't it was great. Whenever I stay in a hotel I always check the sheets etc to see if they look nice, white and clean and I wasn't disappointed. The bed and pillows are sooooooo comfortable I challenge you not to have a good nights sleep. The bathroom was clean and tidy with some lovely Aveda toiletries and the towels were clean, very white (I don't like greying / tired hotel towels - fussy I know!) and changed daily. The decor in the room was nice, some very unusual ' geometric' wallpaper, but modern, clean and tidy. Each morning there is complimentary tea, coffee etc in reception and there is always a member of staff on hand to answer a query / solve any issues. The hotel has a 'Happy Hour' every evening, again in reception which was an ideal place to meet up after a hectic day and relax. Staff are on hand to present you with a glass of wine, beer or a 'hot toddy/mulled wine' and nibbles are served which was all very civilised and relaxing! The Kimpton chain seem to realise that some guests like to remain active whilst away from home and so as well as the fitness suite in the hotel, there is a Yoga channel on the bedroom TVs and if you request at reception a mat and blocks etc will be supplied to you for the duration of your stay. There is also weekly Zumba class which unfortunately I couldn't attend but it looked like good fun. The hotel is lovely, the staff are friendly and efficient and I would not hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: tonestar24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2008 for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay that on my 2011 trip, I was definitely staying here again. I wasn't disappointed! The rooms are so nice, and for the price, you cant beat it. I am also a Kimpton member which also benefited me on my stay with free internet and $10 worth of goodies from the mini bar. The rooms are spacious, clean and very modern, you expect excellence and you get it here. Staff were very helpful and when my bath plug got stuck (i couldn't pull it out!) a maintenance guy was there in minutes and fixed it immediately so the service was above par and i've stayed at many different places. Wifi was fast which is a plus too! It was close to the river and right in the theater district so you couldn't get more central if you tried! Overall, this is a great hotel. It is beautiful, modern and convenient and i will most probably stay here everytime i visit Chicago, i enjoy it here that much! Don't stay anywhere else!!!! Always my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “100% kimpton”
Reviews.Author: EDLU
Reviews.Content: All you expect from Kimpton. Maybe it still needs to find its own identity like other kimpton properties have, large size doesn't help I guess, but overall impression is positive. Just one night in this facility but everything went smoothly. Discreet and quick service, kind front desk staff and attention in details while being pampered all around. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of 4th floor”
Reviews.Author: got2go
Reviews.Content: Let me start this off by saying that I love the Kimpton line of hotels, including this one, the Allegro. This review is more about a few items I thought hotel guests might want to be be aware of before booking here. First, if you want any kind of a view (besides the fire escape and brick wall of next building) ask not to be placed in room 419. The room itself is nice, you just wont get any light in your room even if there is a window. Secondly, the fourth floor is the same floor where pets are placed. I had no idea about this until I suddenly heard a loud howl outside my room. When I looked out I saw two more dogs in the hallway with their owners. Normally I wouldn't care about being on the same floor as dogs, but when you get an animal that barks and howls every time someone walks past the door it can be a problem. The hotel staff was very nice and tried to contact the owners but was unsuccessful. The hotel did offer to move us but since we had completely unpacked and were on our way out we didn't take them up on their offer. I realized that once the dog's owners returned to the room the problem would very likely disappear so I wasn't concerned about having my sleep disturbed. I will definitely stay at the Allegro again, I'll just be on another floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Allegro”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in December and had a wonderful stay. We've stayed here before as we travel for both business and pleasure and Hotel Allegro is always one of my top choices for Chicago. It is an older boutique hotel that has been nicely renovated with a modern look that retains some of it's historical Art Deco decor. We are big fans of the Kimpton chain and of all the Kimptons we've stayed at, the Allegro has one of the largest living rooms which is nice to enjoy their festive evening wine hour which can get crowded. Rooms are clean with comfortable beds and the hotel has a fun and relaxed atmosphere. Great location in the theater district, right next to Cadillac Palace. The front desk staff, congierge and door men are friendly, pleasant and helpful. We will stay here again because I always feel relaxed and comfortable here; so important as traveling is fun but can be stressful at times.

Reviews.Title: “Room far too small, otherwise almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Oz4
Reviews.Content: I have just come across some photos of this hotel from our stay last year. A review might now be a bit dated but I always find the traveller photos very useful, so I thought I would go ahead and post these anyway. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and the public areas to be beyond groovy, as you would expect. Our experience would have rated higher except the room was just way too small for our family. With 2 large suitcases and a pram, we could barely move in our double-double room. The furnishings were quite lovely though and I was particularly impressed with the bathroom; though again, very small. We didn't plan on spending all day in our room so we thought this room would be fine. In hindsight, I would say that if you're traveling with your family, spring for the suite. The service, services and location would make it worth paying the extra, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character in this retro styled hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliab26
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has updated retro styled rooms. The room itself is not huge and the bathroom is on the small side but it is extremely clean (it is not at all drab, dirty or dingy despite the age of the building), with very nice quality bedding and other amenities (large, flat screen tv, Aveda products in the bathroom, nice towels, etc.). It is a neat hotel because the woodwork and doors look to be original but the flooring, wallcoverings, etc. are all done in retro type prints...alot of character mixing the old with the new... The bathroom sink and fixtures are modern and fit in very nicely with the whole aesthetic of the room. We booked last minute as we were unexpectedly held over for the night after a business meeting went long...our rate was only $100/night--a huge steal for the value of the hotel. Staff (desk clerk, door man, etc) were all very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BOUTIQUE HOTEL IN DOWNTOWN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: Walter J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and have never been disappointed. The staff provides excellent, friendly service. The free evening Happy Hour is a delight. There are free newspapers and coffee available in the lobby in the morning. It is in the theater district and close to the opera house. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect way to celebrate any anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl E
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25 wedding anniversary and the Allegro staff was superb! From the time we checked in, the wonderful upgrade to a King Suite, the "went out of his way" bell-hop, to the bottle of champagne and chocolates waiting in our room when we got back, it couldnt have been any better. The room was clean, comfortable and chic! We will definately stay there again. A++

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Dinner and a Show”
Reviews.Author: dchotelguy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for one night to take in a Christmas Show and dinner. Great Staff, great room and a perfect location if you want to be close to the theaters and some incredible food.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Dec_25
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to the States and first time to Chicago. Its a very pleasant hotel to stay for someone like me. There are few convenient shop very near to the hotel such as 7-Eleven, CVS Pharmacy and Walsgreen. The hotel staffs have been very helpful and understanding. They have provided good services such as allocate the right things at the right place in my room :) They have done a very good job! There is a good thai restaurant just behind the hotel and cafes around such as Corner's Bakery and Dunkin Donuts..don't have to worry on finding food.A strategic location for walking around downtown especially State street-the shopping street.And its not far from the subway, I managed to take subway from O'Hare International airport to this hotel with a cheaper fare of $2.25 only :) Not to forget the complimentary wine during the evening time. And I am lucky to have a bigger room compare to my co-worker's room.Also not to forget their crab cake at Encore.Overall, this is the best hotel to stay in Chicago! downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelynn5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in November, 2011. The hotel has a very modern decor and was decked out nicely (albeit in a very modern style) for Christmas! The hotel is located in the theatre district, but is also right next to the "L"! We did hear it, but it wasn't so loud that it woke us up during the night. We were on the 9th floor, so I don't know what it would have been like on the floors much closer to it. The staff we worked with were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean, but I didn't love the decor--it looked to me like a cheap one-day room renovation you might see on a DIY home improvement show. That being said, it didn't matter too much since we only stayed one night. We stayed in a suite. The bedroom was small but certainly adequate. The living area had a couch, desk, tv and table and was spacious. The bathroom was small but we had whirlpool tub that was nice-sized. We enjoyed the cocktail hour in the lobby (as did many other guests--it was standing-room only). They had two wines to sample and a hot toddy of apple cider and bourbon. They also had plain hot cider. They butlered hot appetizers throughout the lobby as well. I would recommend it to others, and I would stay there again, except for the fact that if we do stay in Chicago again I'd probably try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Best anniversary EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinydiva76
Reviews.Content: when I first walked in the Decor was so friendly and beautiful with all of the christmas decorations,and I loved to see friendly faces at the front desk that greeted me . My room was not ready but I recieved a prompt call an hour or so later. check in was a breeze!!. I was upgraded for my anniversary to a beautiful suite that was very clean and so fresh! the bed was so comfy and the room decor was absolute best! I have recommended this hotel to many friends already, and my husband and I will be here for new years eve! A quick 2 night getaway was made spectacular by hotel allegro.

Reviews.Title: “A solid value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: altusmedia
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I recently stayed at the Hotel Allegro for 6 nights. And the overall experience was positive. The cleanliness of the rooms, friendliness of the staff, and bed comfort top my list. Yes, this is an older property and the rooms are small. And it's not a highrise. It's in the theater district and you're not going to get panoramic views of the river or skyline. This is a boutique hotel with attentive service, quality bath products and bed linens, in a hip but cozy setting. The Encore lounge next door is a great place for a cocktail and a light meal. Again, friendly staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “A "so-so" experience at the Hotel Allegro-Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Roy-14
Reviews.Content: We were assigned a room on the 4th level. We requested and received a queen-sized bed which was very comfortable and the room was very clean. The main issue we had was the size of the room; it was too small for the two of us. We also like to look out of the window at the highrise structures, especially at night, but we had no view at all-totally obstructed.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: jule3913
Reviews.Content: Came across this hotel on hotwire. Very contemporary hotel in the theater district of downtown. Withing walking distance to everything! Hotel was very clean and they have a happy hour wine/appetizer each evening from 5-6 pm in the lobby for their hotel guets at no additional charge. Room was very clean and they have a huge lobby to hang out in, a great concierge. Would stay here again. This is one of 4 hotels (kimpton chain) II believe in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Once again - flawless”
Reviews.Author: USAIndytravels
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay at the Allegro. Being from Chicago but living away - I enjoy returning for the holidays. The Allegro is in a great location. The staff was exceptionally friendly. The atmosphere was festive. The room was great. (Being a Kimpton Hotel member- they let us check-in at 10:30am and we were offered a handicapped room - which turned out to be great - with a HUGE bathroom. The evening wine reception (free) was fun as always. A guest had a friendly dog who was visiting everyone in the lobby. I can't wait to go back again!! I would definitely recommend staying here - and check their website for good deals. I pain $114 USD including tax. The Christmas Market down the street was fun too!! Happy Holidays!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago at Christmastime at the Allegro Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jecksr
Reviews.Content: Very comfy beds, super accomodating staff, modern and clean. But it's the location that really sells the place. It's right next to the Cadillac Theater in the theater district. There is a self park garage right across the street and you can walk a few blocks and be shopping at Macy's and taking lunch at the famous Walnut Room on the 7th floor of Macy's. You can walk a bit further and visit the Mercantile or Water Tower Plaza or the shops on Michigan Ave's Magnificent Mile. but the prices are more reasonable and the location better. Free coffe and hot chocolate in the mornings and free wine, beer, and cider at nights. We've stayed at dozens of hotels downtown in Chicago and the Allegro is by far the best value, the best location, and the nicest staff. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: KCtheChaser
Reviews.Content: My friends and I saw Straight No Chaser in concert at the Chicago Theatre on 12/3 and wanted to stay someplace close by. I booked a room at the Allegro without knowing much about it. We only stayed one night, but it was fabulous. Room was great, service was great. No disappointments. Would love to stay there again if I'm ever back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience, Great People”
Reviews.Author: wyantmw
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have a boutique hotel experience in Chicago to celebrate a milestone birthday for my wife, and made reservations with Allegro. Our experience was outstanding - we found from the first moment of arrival that it seemed we were expected. The hotel staff were incredibly welcoming and friendly - from the doormen, concierge, front desk staff and restaurant staff. Rooms were nice, and the location for us in the theatre district was perfect. We were easily able to see and do all we wanted to. For us, this was a 'home away from home' experience, and one that we would recommend to others. It is also one that we would repeat on future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A+++ Customer Service and Comfort at its BEST!”
Reviews.Author: leahbauer
Reviews.Content: From the Doorman who opened the door for us on arrival to the Receptionist who checked us out, Hotel Allegro absolutely exceeded our expectations with the finest of customer service. We shopped around on TripAdvisor, looking for a neat little place to stay and I was thrilled when I saw the pictures of Hotel Allegro's rooms (blue is my favorite color!). We decided to double-check on the price we found for Friday night on Cheapostay ($169/night) so we called the hotel's reservations and they offered us the room at $113! Wow! We booked it right away :) When we arrived, we were greeted at our car by the doorman who helped us decide whether the valet parking or self-park would be better for us. We opted to use the self-park right around the corner as we decided that it was going to be a relaxing weekend and we would prefer to have someone chauffeur us around :) we took taxis the whole time during our 2 day trip (it made perfect sense too. We paid $72 for 2 days of parking and probably paid about $70 for all of our cab rides, but parking in the city is expensive, depending on where you go. We just fig'd, "Hey, forget the stress, we're on vacation!"). After having the door opened for us with a smile, we were meet by a Bell Hop (do people still say that? haha) who asked us if we would like help with our bags. We took the elevator to the lobby and were met by Gianna (spelling?) at the front desk, who is an absolute asset to the hotel as far as customer service is concerned. She had a smile on her face the entire time and was as polite as if we were her friends, making us feel completely at home. As a former gate agent for an airline, I know what its like to deal with customers all day long and have to say, this girl does her job and she does it well :) We then went to our room and, as two 25-year-olds, were very pleased with the decor! The prints on the walls and the floor, the funky blue picture on the wall, and the...pillow. top. mattress...I can't even really think about it, we're back home now and I honestly don't sleep that good in my own bed. HAHA :) I read the other reviews on the smallness of the bathrooms and I have to say, even though I hate to, they are a little bit small, but CMON, Its a BATHROOM and $113 a night? IN THE CITY? If you can't handle that, you've got bigger problems, my friend ;) We had only booked Friday night, but after we went out to Spy Bar and Sound Bar (great electronic clubs, if that's what you're in to, GO), got back to our room at 4am on Saturday and feel into that bed, I knew we were staying another night. Dreading hearing how much booking the room for Saturday night at such short notice was going to be, I apprehensively called the front desk and spoke to _____ (hate that I didn't get everyone's name, they were all so nice) who booked the room for us at -wait for it- $113 again!!! Beside myself with joy and craving food at 4am, I instinctively picked up the pillow menu that was waiting for us when we had arrived and began scribbling down all sorts of delicacies that I would be happy to wake up to :) Eddie arrived promptly, with great customer service in tow, at the time that we indicated on our card (how would I know really, though, I was sleeping like a baby) and wheeled a cart into our room holding an array of delicious breakfast foods: French Toast with fresh-cut bananas, Hot Chai Tea with Soy milk, an Omelet with Sausage, Hot Coffee, fresh-cut cantaloupe, oranges and strawberries and crisp toast wrapped in a napkin with jam and jelly on the side. MMMMM, my mouth is watering just thinking about it :) We checked out the next day, sad to go, but feeling refreshed after a much-needed 2-day in the Windy City. The receptionist who checked us out (again, wish I had caught her name, very nice) suggested with a smile that we check out Yolk for breakfast, but it was so packed when we got there (darned Bears game haha) that we opted to hit up TripAdvisor again for some Breakfast Wisdom and were not disappointed to drive a little further and dine at The Breakfast Club (which I need to write another review on. GREAT Breakfast & service. Do not judge a book by its cover, this place is amazing) Hotel Allegro gets a 5-Star review from me. We will not only tell everyone we know about our experience, we will be back :) hasta la vista! And THANKS for making the Windy City a little less chilly in December for us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: azm3
Reviews.Content: I love the city of Chicago and am kind of picky about hotels. Hotel Allegro is a budget hotel but the management team gives you nice perks. They are very welcoming, friendly and accommodating. The only problem with this hotel really is that the bathrooms are sooooo small. For the price this hotel gives a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonerfully renovated older hotel with excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: stcolsp
Reviews.Content: This is an older property in the loop/theater district a few blocks from Michigan avenue which has been newly renovated in a modern style which features excellent service and is a very good value. I have stayed there four times and return for: value location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PBR-714
Reviews.Content: The Allegro was great, very laid back and fun, but with enough quality amenities. My family went on a Euro trip in the Spring, and got a chance to stay in some pretty nice suites. My kids commented that they liked the Allegro way better than any of the Euro hotels which included the Hilton Waldorf London, Swissotel Istanbul, and Westin Excelsior Rome. Pretty cool. Really beyond expectations based on how "depriciated" the property became in the final years of the Hotel Bismark era. The mattress/furniture were in good shape, the attitude of staff was superb, and gift bags for kids and dog was a nice touch. I just wish I visited Chicago more often...

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice time had - again!”
Reviews.Author: kek
Reviews.Content: Have stayed now at the Allegro Chicago twice now. The entire property is a mix of old world elegant and funky modern, it works! The staff was uniformly friendly and efficient from the front door, to check-in to room service. It seemed natural and genuine vs the forced smiles some establishments require of their staff. The rooms are spotless and ok sized. If you upgrade they are quite a bit larger and not a ton more $$. The Wine Hour each evening is a nice touch in the lobby. Encore bar on site, again service was great. Place was not exactly hopping either visit, but then again I am not quite the late night owl I used to be. Room service was amazingly quick! Will be back soon! Only two negatives of a small sort: The bathroom is super small. You can turn on the shower and the sink faucet while sitting on the toilet with out stretching at all. The closet is super small as well, to be expected with an older property. Neither issue was a big deal and for only one or two people for a night or two should not be a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel combining boutique charm and impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: Micheal84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic choice for Downtown Chicago. Little touches like the free wine reception each evening and the artwork in the rooms help it stand out above the competition. Staff ar incredibly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Nice Rooms. OK location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher14
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Chicago this past October for a wedding, and were pleasantly surprised by this funky hotel in Chicago. We visit Chicago once a year, as I am originally from the Chicago-land area, and are always tempted to try new hotels. Last year, we stayed at the Dana Spa (which was great). This year, after scoring a deal, we decided to try out the King Premiere room. The room is colorful, large, and modern. The bathroom, however, is TINY compared to the size of the room. The bed was big, comfy, and had soft pillows and luxurious sheets. I loved the wallpaper and the funky furniture (but this might not be for all). Overall, for what we were planning to do in the city (the architectural boat tour- a must and Second City) this hotel was a good location. We were able to walk to the boat tour (about 10 minutes on foot) and were just a short taxi ride away from Second City. During the day, the streets are busy and in the early evening you see many people headed to the theaters. However, once the theaters are done for the night, we found that the area was stranded and were accosted twice by strange men for money for the train, etc. Also, the proximity to the blue line was amazing! (A short 5 minute walk, which came in handy since we had a 6 AM flight to catch to NYC the next morning!) The only other disappointment I had was our view. Last year, the Dana, had floor to ceiling windows that allowed you to see breathtaking views of the city. The Kimpton, however, had views of the parking lot, and other buildings. So, if you're looking for a breathtaking view of the city, this may not cut it for you. Kimpton hotels, in general, are great. They cater to the tourist with their free coffee in the morning, and afternoon wine hours. They also are pet-friendly and even have treats and water on the street for when your dogs arrive! If you are look for a funky hotel, and you're not afraid of a little bit of color- then Hotel Allegro will be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Fairbanks142
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a number of Kimpton hotels across the U.S. Allegro lives up to what we've come to expect. Staff was excellent. Room was small but that's typical and fine with us. Otherwise the room was clean, comfortable and sylish. Lobby was very large and very cool -- the Allegro has by far the largest daily wine reception of any of the Kimptons that we've stayed in. Location was very convenient on foot to anything around the Loop and Magnificient Mile, and several subway lines are within a couple of blocks. We would definitely stay at the Allegro again.

Reviews.Title: “Well-situated for theater or museums”
Reviews.Author: chatto
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has a lot of style and provides real value in a hotel market that can sometimes offer poor rooms at astronomical prices. First, you must know that the staff are helpful, courteous, and kind. The check-in process is always efficient; I have stayed here on 4 separate occasions and whether I needed valet service or an extra pillow, everything has been done quickly and well. The rooms are a bit small, as this is an historic building, but they are well appointed and quirky. The bathroom is small, as well, but the shower is of great quality. The hotel is located within blocks of all sorts of food options, the theaters, shops, and public transport. It is not Ritz, but it is not the Holiday Inn Express, either. I really love this little hotel and always enjoy my stays here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the theater”
Reviews.Author: jimCincinnati_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The Allegro is reasonably priced for a hotel in Chicago's loop. It is walking distance from the Lyric Opera and all the theaters (next door to the Palace and just around the corner from the Goodman). The Art Institute and Symphony Hall are also within reach. The hotel is nicely decorated in a faintly hip style, the rooms are in good shape, the staff are friendly, there is free wi-fi for Kimpton in Touch members, free morning coffee and newspapers (including the NY Times and the WSJ) and a complimentary wine tasting between 5 and 6 every evening. This is a superior choice for theater goers.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookie418
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Chicago at the Hotel Allegro and loved it. Staff are helpful, room was tiny but spotless and comfy, bar was fully stocked and amazing, complimentary coffee and wine in the lobby, amazing decor, fabulous bathrobe (leopard print). Best of all, the location was superb; connected to Cadillac Theatre on Randolph, I walked through the theatre district every morning and evening on my way to my conference. Can't say enough about this cosy, lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “The little things”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hotel Allegro. I chose the hotel last year from a list the state sent me as approved for reimbursement at the state rate. It was closest to our meeting location. I had joined their club when I made my first reservation. I had forgotten that they ask your preferences when you join their club. I was delighted to have a room near the elevator on both stays (one of my preferences) and to find a local newspaper outside my door in the morning (another of my preferences). On my first stay they gave me a "Raid the Minibar" coupon at check-in for up to $10. I thought it was just a first visit perk so I was surprised to get one again on my second visit. I checked in at about 7:30 so I had missed their evening reception but Joseph gave me a token for a free glass of wine at Encore, the bar attached to the hotel. As a woman traveling alone I like that they have valet parking, a bar that serves food attached to the property and a nice restaurant for breakfast on property as well. I usually get there late and have a morning meeting so if it is cold or rainy I don't have to go outside for meals. I'm not a coffee drinker but in the morning they do have coffee, hot tea and hot chocolate in their lobby/lounge area. The room is great for one person and maybe a couple but definitely too small for a family. There is only room in the bathroom for one person. There is a self-park parking garage for $36/night just around the corner. The hotel is located in the Theater District but within walking distance of shopping and dining. I will stay there every time I go to Chicago for this meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean value for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MarkHazelbaker
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel Allegro because we had such a great experience at the Kimpton Vintage Park in Seattle. The service, decor and rooms in Chicago were similarly superb. The Allegro is a nicely remodeled hotel which presents a modernist face on a smartly refurnished building. The rooms have nice appointments and decorations. The bathroom is small but certainly functional. Very comfortable beds, quiet ambience. It's near the Lyric Opera if you're so inclined, next to the Cadillac Palace theater. The price, through Hotels.com, was very reasonable for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen5176
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Allegro for two nights recently and had a great experience. The room was adequate in size, the bed was very comfortable, and there was good use of space in the bathroom. The room was very clean and I liked the art deco feel. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed having coffee available in the lobby in the morning. A continental breakfast consisted of a large bowl of fresh fruit, a pastry, juice and coffee in the attached restaurant - 312. You could also order off the menu if you preferred. We also enjoyed the hotel's happy hour where they served wine and beer from 5-6p. There was popcorn and someone walked around serving flatbread pizza. It was a fun atmosphere and the lobby is good sized, but has lots of cozy seating areas. The hotel is conveniently located downtown in the theater district and is close to metro lines, which makes getting around very easy. The only negative is that our room was close to the elevator and we could hear it and the people getting on and off. It was not noticeable enough to keep us from getting a good night's sleep though. We would definitely stay again. Another perk - there is a fabulous specialty cupcake shop nearby called Crumbs. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a Chicago experience”
Reviews.Author: nrg4all
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Allegro was comfortable and pleasant. I was traveling solo, to visit my son, and found the hotel to be centrally located to public transit, which I used exclusively. I found the staff to be helpful , not overly solicitous, and the room clean and well appointed. Though I did not partake of the wine hour, I did appreciate the coffee in the lobby in the morning.The only drawback was the seemingly paper -thin walls. Luckily, my neighbors did not keep late hours. All in all, a friendly, comfortable stay .

Reviews.Title: “A nice boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: KandDinDC
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Hotel Allegro for three evenings in early November. My meetings were close to the Allegro, so I decided to try it for the first time. First, the kudos. The design of the hotel is very pleasing, a nice blend of art deco and contemporary. The staff of the hotel was very accommodating, happily responding to any requests. Common areas were also nicely kept, and everyone seemed to enjoy the evening happy hours (though I never made it in time to partake myself). The hotel is also very convenient to the local METRA train line, as well as offering a government per diem rate (both pluses for my travel needs). There were a few downsides as well. The primary one was the bathroom, which was TINY and almost unusable. The noise level was also higher than I like, requiring that I keep the air conditioner on all night for the background noise. Finally, the complimentary wi-fi service provided with my room package was slow and unreliable. Overall, the hotel is charming and welcoming hotel in an exceptionally-competitive city. While not the finest hotel in Chicago, it will appeal to guests that enjoy unique features over luxury amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Older Kimpton property, great location, Thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: Regnad
Reviews.Content: I really love the Kimptons. Friendly staff, right next to the Cadallac pallace. Walls are thinner than I'd like. Not begrudging the staff, cleanliness, or any others, but I'd recommend the Burnham (also a Kimpton) literally 3 blocks away.. Very nice bar downstairs (great bad food), and perfect if you are going to see something at the Cadillac Palace. Parking is expensive, you are about 6 blocks from Millennium Park Parking garage (typically $24 over night), not a bad walk if its not cold, snowing or raining.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: suomilainen
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend at this hotel and it was very enjoyable! The hotel from the entrance, to the lobby, to the common areas is very nice and beautifully decorated. The rooms were comfortable and clean with all of the updated amenties. All of the staff were very nice, helpful and professional. You can get complimentary wi-fi service if you join their Kimpton In Touch program (it's free to join, so why not?). The pillows on my bed were too firm for me so I left a note for the maid and asked for softer pillows. They were there when I returned to my room that evening! They really do believe in making their guests happy! They have a nightly cocktail reception with complimentary wine and beer. We received coupons for free appetizers and cocktails at their Encore Liquid Lounge located adjacent to the hotel. The prices were reasonable as well. This is a pet friendly hotel with no weight or size restriction and no additional charge!! You don't see that much in the city! The hotel is in a good location, just a short walk to State St. for shopping at Macy's, Nordstrom Rack and many other stores and restaurants. I felt very safe entering and leaving the hotel alone, as there was always the valet out on the sidewalk greeting guests. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! It was a very enjoyable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby but Tiny Loud Room”
Reviews.Author: cjc04
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very cool lobby, and the staff is great- very helpful and responsive. It has the usual Kimpton happy hour, which is always a hit with guests. Our room, however, was TINY and loud. As I have stated in other reviews, I am sensitive to noise issues at hotels- the walls at this hotel were paper thin, to the point where a person could hear drawers closing and hangers being hung. Also, there was no way to escape hall noise. Thank goodness our neighbors in the rooms were not loud guests. I would not go out of my way to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Allegro IS the Kimpton Experience”
Reviews.Author: CINDY T
Reviews.Content: Allegro Chicago. My husband and I stayed there in August and I still smile at the thought. We arrived frazzled after a very difficult day. Katie at the front desk greeted us with genuine warmth that made us feel as though we were the only people she had been waiting for all day long. Some of the details escape me since it is now November, but I do remember Katie took note of my husband's Navy service cap and without our even asking, provided us with a free upgrade to a suite! It was so spacious and comfortable--even had a jet tub. I had never been in a jet tub, but since I had suffered an injury while on vacation, within minutes I settled into the warm inviting water, and with the aroma therapy toiletries provided by Hotel Allegro, the cares of the day evaporated. Later I asked whether there was a shop on the premises where I could buy the same toiletries. There wasn't, but a bit later, housekeeping knocked on my door and brought me a whole bag of them. While I was enjoying the jet tub, my husband was equally enjoying the complimentary honor bar. Allegro does the hosted evening wine hour in their unique style also. There is the open reception area where hotel guests can mingle and greet, but there are also a couple of smaller, more intimate areas which were very welcome. I have to maintain a gluten-free diet. Dining at their 312 Chicago is a delight! There are always many choices available to me and the staff is well trained with regard to gluten sensitivity. A pleasure to dine Italian gluten-free!!Hotel Allegro is the definition of the Experience that is uniquely Kimpton. Can't wait to return. P.S. Allegro is one short walking block from the Alamo car rental return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good experience”
Reviews.Author: 2lilly2
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was very pleasant. The location is right in the theater district and walking distance from the restaurants we chose. The price was very reasonable compared to the hotels on the magnificiant mile! The staff was very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: MNMexicoFamily
Reviews.Content: Blast!We stayed here with 4 other couples for for a getaway weekend. Great place and within walking distance to the L, which can get you anywhere. Yes, the rooms are tiny... Why are you sitting in your room? Friendly service and clean. We got a great deal on room rate and had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: Mea412
Reviews.Content: The service, staff, and rooms are all excellent at this Kimpton. Last weekend's stay at the Allegro was my third and I will definitely return. The InTouch program benefits include room and bedding preferences, daily newspaper delivery, and even a bottle of chilled wine in the room the first evening. The attention to detail is impeccable, and the staff always friendly and welcoming. Thanks to Allegro for another great weekend in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “All good, except concierge...”
Reviews.Author: alldaytripper
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, great location, rooms old and small, but nothing you would not expect from a Kimpton. Front desk and bell service good, concierge had bad attitude and did not know what he was talking about. I tried to book a boat tour through him, he assured me I should go with a different boat company, even though it cost more and changed my dinner reservation because he was sure we would not make it in time. He reserved it, drew directions on a map that took me to the WRONG place to get the boat, we paid for and went on the boat that was there and had a great time, got to the restaurant at the time of our original reservation and had to wait. Got my money back from concierge but got no apology just comments like, "Oh, that was last night you booked it, ya, I don't know what happened"; and "Well, you took a different boat, that's the only reason you made it to dinner on time". Hotel was worth it because we got a great rate, wine hour done well but I won't ask for concierge help at a Kimpton again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hideaway in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gemdomer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend one night at the Hotel Allegro during a trip to visit family, so we could enjoy a little alone time and do some shopping on Michigan Avenue. We also love Kimpton Hotels and had previously stayed at the Hotel Monaco. We got a great price (pre-paid non-refundable) online, and even though we had to change our dates, there were no additional fees. There was some confusion as we had called ahead to change the dates but when we arrived, the front desk still had our old dates, regardless they accommodated us with no problems. The hotel is historic (read: old) and so the rooms are very small, the closet is tiny and there is no safe deposit box in the room. However, the bed is new and extremely comfortable, and the bathroom is modern and well-lit. I didn't find the bathroom small like some other reviewers have mentioned. We were only there one night but we enjoyed it, and felt we got a great value for the price, especially with the Kimpton In-Touch benefits (free internet and $10 minibar coupon). The coffee (really good coffee too!) was much appreciated in the morning, as we had an early flight. We would have liked to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels ANYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: kkjgas
Reviews.Content: Remember a time when travel was romantic and the journey was just as important, if not more so, than the destination? The Hotel Allegro will remind you of those times. It is elegant. No small detail has been missed or neglected. The decor is fabulous and timeless. The staff is amazing and goes out of their way to ensure your stay is comfortable and worry-free. No, these are not the biggest rooms out there, but they are sufficiently sized, cozy, and comfortable. They merge modern day conveniences (wireless Internet service, BIG screen flat TV) with old world charm (marble countertop and shower, ridiculously comfortable bedding, a glass covered desk, wallpapered walls). And the little things are included (cotton swabs, six outlets on the desk to charge all your devices at once). And so many things to make your visit comfortable (morning coffee and tea hour, evening wine reception, mini bar (with $10 of merchandise for free for Kimpton In Touch members), and room service from the amazing restaurant next door). And, it is all VERY reasonably priced, making it a terrific value on top of everything else. You simply can't go wrong staying here when you in Chicago. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Allegro”
Reviews.Author: ShawnandMatt
Reviews.Content: I'm not the first one to notice that the rooms are small, but an unexpected upgrade into a corner king suite was a nice surprise. The staff is accomodating, the bed is very comfortable and this is an excellent hotel for the price. Location is ideal as it is near shops, restaurants and my downtown office. Will stay here many times again!

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tina W
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago many times this was the first stay at the Allegro. I have stayed at the Monico and would say they are very similar. Very confused on the reviews that others state the lobby is hard to find, REALLY??? you take the elevator to the left of the entrance and hit lobby in the elevator, not sure what the problem is. We are reward members (which i free to sign up). We received free internet, 10 credit at the mini bar and free bottle of wine in the room. Loved the extra touchs this hotel offers the wine hour everynight at 5, and free coffee and tea from 6-10 daily. Location is a little off the beaten path but nice to be away from all the crowds. We walked to the ave and it only about a 20 min walk. The theater is litterally right next door. Thr room are very nice and newly decerated. Not sure about the others complaints with the size of the bathroom, sure they are not large but very nice and stocked with aveda products another bonus. Over all I would highly recommend you stay her, we had a fab time!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: I think this is a fantastic hotel, and am not really sure I understand the confusion from some other reviewers about the layout. In any event, there's just something about the little extra level of service that this hotel provides that will definitely have me coming back. The rooms are a little on the small side, but very comfortable and very clean. The location is great as well -- easy walking to either downtown locations or River North, with plenty of trains nearby for some of the surrounding neighborhoods. Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Chicago Theatre District Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: These folks are running a 1st class operation. Staff is awesome. I did a dumb thing and left a bag in the trunk of a cab when I arrived. The security guy tracked the cab company via their security camera and got my bag back. Everyone was very professional. Their associated restaurant, 312, was ridiculous....off the hook outstanding. Yes, the rooms are small but it was also very fairly priced for a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Kimo6229
Reviews.Content: We recently made our first visit to Chicago and found the Hotel Allegro conveniently located in the heart of the theater district and the loop. If you don't mind walking a few blocks you can easily be at Millenium Park, the Magnificient Mile, and other Chicago attractions. The hotel itself was very nice with a higly professional staff. They also have a quite nice complimentary wine recveption each day which makes for a pleasant start to an evening. The room was small but very clean. An 'el' station was only a block away and a great convenience once you learn the system.

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Melissa F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights late October 2011. We are Kimpton In Touch members (one of the benefits is $10 FREE from the mini-bar). We found the hotel quite nice. Gorgeous Art Deco decor. Our room was small, but definitely not too small. The bathroom was also small, but again not too small. If you've stayed in European hotels, this one seemed roomy. The staff was quick to accommodate our requests: a coffee maker in the room, extra toiletries (Aveda !, nice!!), and wine glasses. The location of the hotel is great if you're taking the South Shoreline in (approx 5 blocks from Millennium Station) or going to the theater. The 312 restaurant was delicious - fresh and noticeably homemade pasta! The menu in the encore Lounge looked better for lunch than for "dinner". We did however enjoy after theater drinks here. This hotel is pet-friendly, but we were pleased that we weren't disturbed by even one bark or meow. We would stay here again if we needed to be in the Loop.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Gem in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: psmeier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Allegro with a group for NeoCon during the summer. The hotel has lots of charm and fantastic design. The tagline of living like a 'rockstar' is the perfect description. The room I stayed in was decorated in bold colors, mirrored furniture and even a guitar art piece. The room overall was small but it suited my husband and me just fine. The bathroom was great - again a little tight - but the ammenities were nice. My time at Hotel Allegro was good from start to finish. The staff was helpful and friendly and the location was within walking distance of the Merchandise Mart, as well as restaurants and city attractions. I would definitely reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaHadz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while taking sailing lessons on the lake. It was bliss to return to the Allegro after a day on the lake, lovely service, wonderful wine reception and a red carpet was put out for our poodle!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Chicago hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiSeminole
Reviews.Content: Loved their wine hour and amazing staff!!!! Walking distance to Navy Pier and Riverwalk. Gorgeous Art Deco decor.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain weird...”
Reviews.Author: myexperiencematters
Reviews.Content: From the VERY awkward lobby location (they say up the stairs....but to what floor?), the the very small room/bathroom, this hotel was not for me. Upon arriving, I was told to head up the stairs to the lobby. Well, you walk up the flight up stairs directly in front of you. You arrive on the next level, with no clear sign or awareness that the lobby is there, so I continued up another flight (carrying my bags in the process).
