After getting to the 3rd floors which is conference rooms, I realized it must be down a level, so I took the elevator down to level 2 which is the lobby. After checking in, I got to my room to find a very small city room. I've stayed in rooms and bathrooms bigger in Europe. The bathroom specifically was so small, as a man, I had a hard time figuring out where to put the few items I had. I could not even imagine what it would be like for a woman with the added items. Additionally, the sound quality was pretty poor as well. I could hear by neighbor talking (not loudly) until 130AM. I kept hearing people say how much they love this hotel....for me, I simply didn't get it, nor did I feel the same. The staff were very helpful when you interacted with them (which was at checkin, and checkout only for me), and if there was a bright spot, this would be it. I've stayed at other downtown Chicago hotels (Charter Club, Renaissance, and more) and I will be sure to stay at another hotel next time I am downtime in this area.

Reviews.Title: “40th Bday surprise”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a blast at Allegro! The staff was very helpful and on our arrival they had a bottle of champagne and flowers waiting for my wife and I in our room. The rooms were beautiful and clean, the lobby gorgeous and very spacious. We took advantage of the wine/beer hour at 5pm and met some great people. The Theatre District is a great location and we will definitely be back. Thanks Hotel Allegro! Zack and Kimberly

Reviews.Title: “Loved the allegro”
Reviews.Author: playa4ever
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel allegro for one night in October. The hotel was in a perfect downtown location within walking distance of millenium park, the theater district and all of the major sights of the loop. Our room was spacious and included two large windows overlooking the el tracks. You could hardly hear the el go by and we had a nice view of some of the buildings I had signed up as a kimpton in touch member (free) and my kids were able to raid the mini bar for $10 of free items. This was great and a nice extra touch. There is a free evening wine hour and coffee in the morning. Again, nice touches. The room was nicely decorated and I enjoyed using the furnished robes while getting ready to go out in the evening. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. We left our luggage there for the day after check out and came back after doing some sightseeing.Loved everything about the allegro!

Reviews.Title: “Their staff...”
Reviews.Author: briqette
Reviews.Content: ....goes above & beyond to make you feel welcome & your stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location, stay for the location”
Reviews.Author: eyeman03
Reviews.Content: Proâ€™s/Cons review PROs: 1. Did I mention the location? Walking distance to the main Loop attractions. 2. Friendly, helpful staff 3. Very,close to the Orange Line (CTA)->Midway Airport access 4. Nice lobby (morning coffee from 6-10 am) and clean. 5. Free wireless internet (if you're a Kimpton member........which, if not, is easy to enroll in.) CON: 1. Very small bathroom (35 sq feet). I know people donâ€™t vacation to hang out in the bathroom, but it was damn smallâ€¦â€¦â€¦the sink might be able to fit a newborn. Overall, a very good place for the price (got it for under $130/night; and again, itâ€™s all about the prime location.

Reviews.Title: “So nearly a winner”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent. Staff - excellent. Room - nearly excellent. The bathroom was agitatingly small, and from what I gather, our bathroom size was indicative of the rest of the hotel. Not that one should ever book a hotel based on the bathroom, but even for 3 nights, the constant banging of elbows on walls whilst at the vanity drove me nuts. I would dearly love to stay here again, but I just couldn't cope with the bathroom again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Allegro!”
Reviews.Author: FLjumper
Reviews.Content: Great time in Chicago. Super comfortable bed! Very Clean in rooms and throughout the hotel. Great evening reception with local craft beer and wine. We really enjoyed staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Lynda056
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a nice location. Beds were great, rooms were small but clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Wine event at 5 was a great treat! One request...the hotel needs a sign directing you UP THE STAIRS to the lobby from the street level. I must have had 50 people ask me where the lobby was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel except they downgraded our room”
Reviews.Author: g4480
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through sniqueaway and scored a good deal on a King Premier room. After it was booked, I was able to extend my stay in Chicago and decided to arrive a day early and booked that night online on a regular room. I'm not sure what happened but the next day we lost our premier room and had to stay the remainder of our time in a tiny room. The front desk tried to make amends but I felt it was inadequate. That aside, the location was great and close to everything we wanted to see. The grand lobby was great for hanging out especially during the afternoon complimentary drink hour and in the morning when coffee is available. This, I thought was a nice touch and lets you meet up with fellow visitors. The vibe was friendly, like being at a house party where you don't know many people but everyone was friendly. Free wifi for Kimpton members (membership is free). Awesome Fast connection and no dead spots in my room. Room was very small with little space to put our stuff. This is expected with big city hotels but its really annoying when you booked something bigger in anticipation of typical city hotel rooms. The bed was very comfortable. Room was quiet and clean. Useful concierge in the lobby had great advice. Pet friendly. I'm an allergy sufferer but it wasn't a problem. Overall nice stay except for room downgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Allegro a number of times and am never disappointed with the hotel. The location is great--right in the Theatre District and a short walk to Michigan Avenue attractions like Millennium Park, The Art Institute, Riverwalk, etc. Price is reasonable for a downton hotel, staff is cheerful and accommodating, good restaurants(especially 312) and beautiful rooms. What more could you ask?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tntpdx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct. 15&16. We had a King premier room which was a corner room so the layout was a little funky (long skinny hall towards the bathroom, then sharp right to the sleeping area) but the room was spacious and very comfortable with windows on two sides though nothing especially great to look at. We could see the L tracks from our window and were afraid there would be a lot of noise, but were pleasantly suprised. The windows are double hung, so that probably helped. I'm a Kimpton InTouch member so the WiFi is free and we got a voucher for $10 worth of goodies from the mini-bar. As with most other Kimpton Hotels there is a hosted (yes, free!) manager's wine/beer reception every night in the lobby and that is one of the most awesome things about this hotel and others in the Kimpton group. Hotel Allegro's lobby is quite large and well arranged and it so fun to relax with fellow travelers. They also served some delicious small bites with the drinks. The staff was friendly and professional from the front desk to housekeeping to the bell service. The business center was convenient for printing boarding passes. Hotel Allegro's location can't be beat: we walked everywhere; Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Art Institute, John Hancock Observatory, Sears/Willis Tower and Millenium Park. Hotel is walking distance to the L Blue Line which is a $2.25 straight shot to O'Hare. Had such a great visit we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RLEC
Reviews.Content: We have been to Chicago before, but not stayed at Hotel Allegro. It was a welcome surprise! It was a convenient location, the staff was helpful and had "happy to help" attitudes! Our daughter had stayed here on a college trip,recommended it to us, and we are happy with our decision. Happy Hour in the lobby was a pleasant surprise. Bell Hops were good with directions and welcomed you back when you returned. Overall, a great hotel for a perfect weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to go wrong with Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: GamecockGirl
Reviews.Content: This Kimpton property seems a little different from its sister properties; it seems to offer a lower pricetag and higher value for the more budget conscious guest. But what it has in common with the other Kimpton properties keeps it hip, welcoming, and an attractive option for travelers -- free wi-fi for InTouch members (the rewards program for Kimpton that anyone can join); creative, cool decor; clean facilities; super friendly and accommodating staff; animal print robes in all rooms; and a prime location. I had an end-of-the-hall king room, room 601, and the view was not good -- all I could see was a big brick wall outside. But the room was sizable with a lot of open space. The bathroom was one of the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel (but not as small as the one I had at the Palmer House Hilton in Chicago). However, the bathroom was well lit, well decorated, and very clean. The marble shower had great water pressure. Being at the end of the hall and brick wall next door meant no noise and much peaceful sleeping. I ordered room service once and found it to be better than average room service food with exceptional customer service (from the person who answered the phone and the person who delivered it). The wi-fi speed was great. The location of the hotel, in Chicago's theatre district, was just perfect for me. It was close to train stops and an easy (and nice) walk to the shops on Michigan Ave. The front desk patiently talked me through how to get a train to Evanston (to Northwestern's campus) and back. The elevators were a bit slow at times, with occasional long waits for an elevator, but not the worst I've experienced while traveling, either. There was a problem with my reservation at check-in (the front desk staff couldn't find it), but after I looked up the confirmation number and shared it with the staff it was located. However, my InTouch # was not in the reservation, and I had to have it added later. There may have been a glitch with the Kimpton reservation system.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: ginam650
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I really don't have a negative thing to say about the place. I met a couple girlfriends in Chicago for a girls weekend and we stayed here for a couple of nights. Before I booked I went on the Kimpton website and signed up(for free) for the intouch program which is great! After making my reservation I became fans with the hotel on facebook and was promised a "goodie" when we checked in. So, once we checked in me and my guests were expecting a cookie, something small. No, since my friend drove they waived the ENTIRE charge for valet parking for 2 days. We were stunned and excited. Both nights we enjoyed the wine reception in the lobby and the coffee/tea in the mornings. We also used the concierge services during the wine reception one night to book an architectural boat tour. I have nothing but good things to say about the staff, and experience at this hotel. It's not just this hotel though, it's the Kimpton brand. I will definitely stay at a Kimpton hotel over any other hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and top-notch staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeff E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights on our first trip to Chicago, not really knowing the neighborhoods or preferred locales. To our surprise, the hotel is in a great location, walking distance to a lot of restaurants. If you need to go further out, a $5 cab ride will get you there. Encore Liquid Lounge was a perfect spot for us to unwind that first night, as well as a good starting point every night thereafter. This is a renovated hotel, so you need to come with proper expectations. You can tell this is a very old building, with rooms that are very small compared to newer hotels. But that's the way it was back then. Given all that, they've done an excellent job on the renovation. The rooms are clean and up-to-date. The bathrooms are beautiful. The lobby is done really well and makes a great place for the nightly wine-hour. The standout for us was the staff. From the front desk to the cleaning staff, everyone was incredibly considerate and polite. We always ask everyone besides the concierge on what to do and where to go. Julio gave us great recommendations and presented genuine thoughtfulness. Definitely seek this gentleman out. We would and have recommended this hotel to others with proper expectations in mind. For the price, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl709
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kimpton Allegro Chicago for a weekend, a little romantic getaway. What a beautiful spot! I loved everything from the crisp white bedding to the funky decor in the rooms, to the wine hour (complimentary for guests around the supper hour). The service was incredible and the food in the little in-house restaurant was to die for. We slept very comfortably there, the rooms were clean, the rates were extremely reasonable as well. I've been to boutique hotels where the rooms were uncomfortably small, and the rooms here weren't HUGE, but they certainly didn't feel uncomfortable. I would recommend this spot for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: luna340
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights for business and had a great experience. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. We asked for restaurant recommendations; walking & public transportation directions to various locations, and help making boat tour reservations, and always received top-notch service. The free beer/wine happy hour every evening was a nice bonus! The rooms are pretty small, but that's to be expected from a downtown hotel in a major city. The rooms were updated, very clean and well-maintained. The location is great, right in the heart of the theater district and close to a lot of major attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights before the Chicago marathon. The good- clean rooms and bathroom was very clean, also, extremely convenient to CTA and the start of the race. The room was small but adequate. The bad- thin walls- you can hear everything that is going on in the other rooms next to you as well as people walking down the halls having conversations. If you want to go to bed early bring your ear plugs. They also charge you to print out your boarding pass - $.49 a page and you have to sign up for Kimpton emails to use their internet. The signing up part is fine, but I didnt want to pay $.49 for my boarding pass and have to go through the sign up on our way checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TimT_10
Reviews.Content: For the money, this hotel offers a lot. The rooms are fairly big for the location, the bathroom has a tub, the TV was a 37 inch flat screen, the staff is helpful and it's right downtown. It's not one of the newer hotels as some reviewers have pointed out. But I found no signs of wear. In fact the overall quality of the place was quite nice. What I liked most was the extras. They had free newspapers you could take in the lobby, a small health club, and a free wine tasting every afternoon. And if you sign up for a free Kimpton membership, you get WiFi at no cost. That was quite helpful since my company doesn't pay for it. This isn't the fanciest hotel for business travelers but it's a good value for folks who are paying their own way and don't want to spend 200+ for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Almireta
Reviews.Content: All the hotel (entrance, lobby, corridors, rooms...) is super fashon. The room was clean but the window, cosy however the bathroom was a bit small, only space for one person. In the closet you had an iron,an ironboard, socks and a zebra petterned bathrobe which you could by. All front desk clerks were very kind, helpful and polite. Free wi-fi in all rooms. We had a very nice time at this hotel, we would definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place....only one minor gripe....”
Reviews.Author: jbwilkins
Reviews.Content: I only stayed there for a night and it was booked by someone else (I'm a Hilton Diamond member)â€¦â€¦Seems to be a nice placeâ€¦.they were having a wine tasting in the lobby when I arrived (5:30PM) and it was packedâ€¦..Desk agent was niceâ€¦..Rooms are what you expect from one of these â€˜oldâ€™ hotelsâ€¦..tiny with tiny bathrooms, but nicely appointedâ€¦..really appreciated the â€˜power stripâ€™ on the deskâ€¦â€¦Only one gripeâ€¦..seems the ice machines are only on 2 floorsâ€¦.and mine didnâ€™t happen to be one so I had to tramp down the hall, up one floor just to fill the ice bucketâ€¦â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Take it or leave it, no lasting impression”
Reviews.Author: smsg10
Reviews.Content: The concierge service and morning coffee here were very good. The bar at street level was nice and the bartender friendly. But... the elevators took forever. The breakfast (at my conference located in the hotel) was the same food every day for 4 days in a row. And the room itself was tiny. Much smaller than other Chicago hotel rooms. The bathroom was also very tight. I would not recommend these rooms for more than one person. And the view from my hotel room was of the top of the building next door. Not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dnaka
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a property in the Theater District of Chicago. Great room and amenities. Great bed that was a dream to sleep in. Service at checkout was slow, they should have had more staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and experience for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: The only criticism I can say about this hotel is that the room size is a bit small so don't expect to spread all your belongings out on the floor. Having said that, we only paid $119 per night to stay here. Service was helpful and friendly, the ambience and decor of the hotel was comfortable and the breakfast, while limited in choice, tasted good and was complimentary with our stay. The location is excellent too, as it's only a 5-minute walk to Millennium Park and about 10 minutes to the Magnificent Mile and deep-dish pizza restaurants. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great.”
Reviews.Author: ILBadgerFan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for a weekend 9/30-10/2 and we agree with many of the sentiments from other reviews that it is a ok to good hotel but not great. My wife and I agree that we will probably not return to this hotel in the future. Positives: good location, very nice staff, nice lobby/lounge area. Negatives: very small room, TINY bathroom. If not for the excellent staff here, I would have ranked this even lower. Definitely, better options in this area of Chicago including another Kimpton property the Hotel Monaco, which we would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: MurWI
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I was pleasantly surprised. It is a nice hotel. The rooms and bathroom are small, but it was fine for out needs. Busy lobby, busy place. The girls who check me both in and out were very accomodating. Location was nice, walking distance from Union station, walked to Navy Pier although it was a hike. Would stay again. Try the Billy Goat Bar at Navy Pier, the bartender Paul was Great!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bengal3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Allegro is so great! The only reason I didn't give it a five is because of the size of the rooms and bathrooms. They are small compared to those at five star luxury hotels. But that will not stop me from staying at the Allegro during my next visit to Chicago. It's really impossible not to love Kimpton Hotels. They know how to make a guest feel special and very welcome. Many of the other reviewers have noted the decor and special touches at the Allegro. I will just add that we immediately felt at home here and couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DDTSarasota
Reviews.Content: What I loved about the Hotel Allegro. Great location, near subway station, walking distance to awesome restaurants and shopping. Lovely happy hour at 5 in the beautiful lobby. We had an awesome corner room on the 14th floor, with comfortable bedding and pillows, large flat screen TV, and great Aveda products in the bathroom. The front desk staff and concierge were so helpful and friendly. I highly recommend the Hotel Allegro. I love Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: family5_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Allegro in September in a room with two double beds. Room and bathroom are small but perfectly outfitted and packed with fun amenities. Beds fine, though, as usual these days, with only a rather warm duvet. The staff were all very professional and courteous and helpful, and there was no shortage of them. Prompt service. In room dining menu was brief but adequate. Attractive, mod lobby in cool old building. All at a rate of 119/night through the Kimpton In Touch club--great deal. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cntrydancetwinmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend and the hotel itself was clean and nicely appointed. It is decorated in a Euro style and the lobby is very appealing with a lot of couches and seating areas for people to gather and socialize. The rooms are ok....clean at least. They are very small and the bathroom is extremely small but nicely updated. The bathroom doors are double doors that leave a space in the middle so they do not offer much privacy. Also, the walls are thin so if you are a light sleeper, bring your sleep machine or use your phone with a white noise app to block out the sounds from the hallway. Overall, it was a nice hotel that we will stay at again if we are not able to find something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in facilities”
Reviews.Author: TopCut
Reviews.Content: I elected to stay at the Allegro because of my fondness for Kimpton properties, but found this one lacking in originality and spaciousness. My room, especially the bathroom, was unusually small. I had elected a room with "double/double" beds; possibly if I had agreed to upgrade to a king room it would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate - Another Great Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: RenoSongman
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights last week at Allegro in Chicago. Great location, very near CTA stops, and all the usual and excellent Kimpton amenities. Rooms are small, but very comfortable. Always appreciate the wine hour, and the complimentary coffee to get the day going. We'll be back and kudos to Kimpton, a first rate hotelier.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but Kimpton has done a good job.”
Reviews.Author: thunderkitty_van
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel through a 3rd party booking site, and I was thrilled because I love Kimpton Hotels. Because I am a member of their loyalty program (free to join), I get free internet, and $10 towards the minibar. Reception is one level above street level, but there are elevators, so it is no problem. The lobby is nice and there is a lot of common seating for meeting friends. Check in was fast and easy, and the front desk could not have been friendlier. I had a Queen Standard room, which is a bit small, but I was expecting this. I couldn't find the closet at first, but after phoning the front desk, I was told that the door that looked like it was to a connecting room, is actually the closet. Smallest closet I have every seen. I was here for the weekend, so the room was fine for leisure, but it would have been too small for a business trip in my opinion.Also, the building is quite old so the plumbing and things were a bit noisy, In fact, there was a weird 'hum' sound that was loud enough that I knew I would not be able to sleep at night. No problem-the front desk was happy to give me another room which was a bit quieter. The hotel offers a complimentary wine hour in the evening, which is was very well attended and a nice touch, with passed hors d'oeuvres. The location is great - right near a few CTA stations, and a few blocks from Millennium park. The area is quite dead on the weekends, but still lots to do a very convenient. All in all, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel although some cons.”
Reviews.Author: ohart
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in the Allegro hotel during the 3rd week of September. The hotel is in a good central location in downtown perfect for walking anywhere. The entrance is on the ground level and the lobby is one floor up. The lobby is a kalediscope of color with lots of chairs (some quite unusual) to sit down and enjoy the ambience. Joseph at reception was professional and helpful. The hotel was built in 1926-1928 originally called the Bismark and lots of history. It underwent a large renovation approx 15 years ago. I had a room on the 8th floor that was not facing the street so just looking onto another building with no view. The room was okay size (not large by any standard but sufficient cpnsidering it is downown Chicago). The rooms I felt were a bit garish. The silver wallpaper with shapes, the cocoon shaped ceiling lamp, the large blue print of a guitar on the wall and the huge mirror across from the bed. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever been in - when you are standing at the sink the back of your leg is touching against the toilet bowl. The closet is also very small. The airconditioning unit was quiet which was great. The rooms come with a fridge and a safe. Every 20 mins or so the fan on the fridge would kick in and was quite loud. Insulation between the rooms is mediocre. I was fortunate to meet George the hotel electrician who was a wealth of knowledge and gave me lots of history on the hotel. There are some nice confernce rooms especially the Walnut room and ask about the history of the chandeliers. There is also an interesting old mail slot that runs vertically down through the building and still works. House cleaning was good and room was kept nice and clean with good lotions in the bathroom. It is worth joining the In Touch Kimpton rewards program - sign up free online before staying there and get $10 worth of items from the minfridge free during your stay. The hotel is very close to the CTA (train station) where Blue line runs to and from O Hare airport in 40 mins for $2.25. So all in all, it is a good hotel and will provide a comfortable stay for a few days despite the tiny bathroom. Personally though, I wouldn't stay again and will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Eloketh
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Allegro was an overwhelmingly positive experience. Much of that was due to the great location, and exceptional service from the concierge. The location is right in the heart of downtown Chicago, a short walk from the Sears Tower, Millennium Park, Union Station, and pretty central to anything downtown. It is also comfortably inside Chicago's theatre district. The Metro system was also very close by and easy to use. Seeing the sights was a dream. I pretty much just had to get up and go. The lobby is actually one level above ground level, and very handsomely decorated. Loved the lobby! My room was smaller than I expected, and a little less ornate than the lobby, but was quite sufficient for my needs. It was clean, and had all the amenities I require (accessible outlets, indoor safe, comfortable bed, etc). I believe it was at least reasonably quiet at night. I certainly slept well, in any case. During the day, however, I was able to hear sounds from other rooms. I never stayed long enough in my room for it to be an issue. The concierge was very accommodating, and was a great help in booking a Broadway show, as well as a dinner at a nearby restaurant. He truly went above and beyond. He always made sure that my experience was a positive one, and I greatly appreciate that. A bonus of this hotel is that there is a free wine tasting every evening at 5pm until 6pm. They even had a beer to sample as well while I was there. If that appeals to you, I highly recommend it. All in all, I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road.”
Reviews.Author: stltrvlr00
Reviews.Content: Check-in was painless and quick. We arrived at noon and room was ready-bonus. Room was a corner room so probably larger than a standard room. The bathroom was microscopic. Two people can not fit inside at the same time! I had read the reviews so I was prepared for that, but it was almost comical. Location was ok. We were a short cab ride to Michigan (although you can walk it). The happy hour is a nice gesture but you get what you pay for....it's free. We found a deal on Sniqueaway for $170 so for that price it was good. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzyhd
Reviews.Content: I chose The Allegro based on wonderful reviews and I was not disappointed. As others have mentioned, the location is convenient and there is a train station right around the corner so you can get virtually anywhere by walking or using public transportation. The Allegro's service was excellent. After mentioning that my wife and I were celebrating a wedding anniversary we were upgraded to a suite on an upper floor. Mind you, I never asked for an upgrade. The room was spotless and very comfortable. I agree with Hulagrub that Anthony, the concierge, was wonderful and always eager to help us with our plans. His recommendations are spot on. When we return to Chicago we will stay here again. We recommend you seriously consider The Allegro when you visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suesboys
Reviews.Content: A very brief stay - this time - at the Allegro in order to attend the Lyric Opera's Millennium Park Concert. The hotel is very convenient to Michigan Avenue, the Art Institute - great shopping as well. I've stayed before - and will certainly do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy lobby and free wine at 5pm”
Reviews.Author: czawardi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I liked this hotel very much,the location is very good cause you can reach almost any sights by feet,the decoration of the lobby made this hotel really special, for breakfast you can go to" the corner bakery" just around the corner from the hotel but if you want some "real" coffee there is a "lavazza" place just a bit farther from the hotel but on your way to the millenium park.We managed to hit the wine hour only once cause at 5pm we were usually still visiting the city but when we did it was really nice just seating around the lobby drinking wine, I would recommend this hotel to any friend!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: redoctober30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in Sept. Service was excellent, the room was spacious, clean and quiet. I was surprised I was in the middle of the city, because I did not hear a thing from my room! The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom and shower quite nice. I wasn't able to hit the wine hour because of business commitments but the front desk clerk was nice enough to offer a free glass of wine in the restaurant since I checked in after it ended. I thought that was a very nice touch. Great location in the city, close to the El and lots of shopping/restaurants/attractions. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michke199
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated lobby with a cocktail hour every day at 5 pm. Breakfast was very good and the rooms very comfortable. Easy walking distance to all the main sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JLS85
Reviews.Content: At the Hotel Allegro, the staff and service were impeccable. Entire staff were thoughtful and attentive to detail. The art deco style boutique hotel offers welcome wine (coffee in am) in the vibrantly decorated, spacious lobby. Our room (2 doubles) had a fun view of the L, was generous in size--nice space for 2 adults and 2 children--and decorated with sophisticated style. Located in The Loop, Hotel Allegro is accessible to many activities. As it is also within the theater district, the neighborhood is lively and exciting--near restaurants and roof-top bars. The hotel is only blocks from the Chicago river (accessible to the River Walk and river/lake tours), a 10 minute walk from Millennium Park where 'The Bean' is a big attraction and also walkable to the Magnificent Mile. Our only complaint--the beds are too soft! I would stay here again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alibuto
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Allegro is a beautifully decorated art deco hotel in the Chicago Theatre District. It is walkable to the the Magnificent Mile and the shoreline (including Navy Pier) but it will probably take about 20-30 minutes to get to Navy Pier - very pleasant if the weather is nice. We have stayed at Kimpton Hotels in 3 different cities now (Vancouver, Portland, Chicago) and the experience has always been pleasant. The staff are very friendly and professional, the rooms are clean with comfortable beds, and the cocktail hour in the lobby every day is a great touch. Kimpton hotels are quickly becoming my first choice in accomodation when I travel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: crochetcpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a girls weekend away at the Hotel Allegro and had a great time!! We especially enjoyed the daily happy hour, which included appetizers on Saturday night!! The rooms were comfortable, but small. You spend so little time there, anyway!! The hotel was in walking distance of everything...and we especially liked that it was only a block from the train to the airport (Orange Line). We had room service which was prompt and tasty!! Very reasonalbly priced!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, very customer oriented”
Reviews.Author: jaybob1023
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, rooms clean and roomy. Staff was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Stay!”
Reviews.Author: law1
Reviews.Content: This historic property is a lovely gem in the heart of the Loop. Walking in the front door, a gorgeous staircase leads you up to the second floor lobby, elegant and charming. Our suite was modern and pleasant, with a separate bedroom. Everything was very clean and spotless. It was great to have a sofa, as well as a small dining table and chairs in the living area. The bathroom is extremely small, with a jacuzzi tub. It is difficult to just take a shower, as the step up into the tub is quite high - - - certainly not recommended for elderly guests. The tiny sink was hard to use without splashing water all over the mirror and floor. However, the king sized bed was very comfy and we slept well. The hotel hosts an evening reception with complimentary drinks in the gorgeous lobby. The entire staff goes out of their way to ensure your stay is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Very Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: FlyaBonanza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights over Labor Day weekend with my husband and two young children (ages 4, 6). My sister, her husband and two children (ages 4, 18 months) stayed as well in a separate room. Check in was very fast and friendly. Our specific room requests, including rooms on the same floor were honored even though the hotel was sold out for that night. The children, including the baby were given a back pack with lots of toys and goodies, and we were given coupons for free kids breakfast both days. The lobby is located on the second floor of this hotel and is very comfortably laid out with plenty of couches and comfy chairs. There is a kid's program. which includes toys, games, wii, popcorn and lemonade located in the lobby from 4:00-5:00 each day. 5:00-6:00 is an adult hour with complimentary wine and hors'devours. Complimentary iced lemon water and a tea/apple juice blend are available in the lobby throughout the day. We stayed in a King Premier room which was quite spacious, except for the bathroom. The bathroom was very very tiny, but it met our basic needs so no specific complaints (the tiny bathroom is the only reason i rated this hotel with 4 stars instead of 5). The hotel itself is a historic renovated building so there is a lot of character and new charm blended together. Overall the hotel is very clean and well maintained despite its age. Overall, the best feature of this hotel is its staff. Everyone that we encountered from the front desk, to restaurant, conceirge, housekeeping ,etc were extremely friendly and courteous. Upon returning to our room the first night, we found a lovely welcome card with an invitation to the hotel's bar for a complimentary drink and appetizer, a bottle of wine and chocolate. It was an unexpected and delightful touch. Upon checkout, the bellman was outstanding. I wish i could remember his name to give him special recognition here. He was so prompt, courteous and went above and beyond to help my family and my sister with all of our luggage, baby supplies, etc. It can be very challenging traveling with small children, especially in the cramped quarters of a large city and we appreciated the outstanding attention and care that this hotel provided to us and the kids. It really made our stay enjoyable. As an aside, we popped into a neighboring hotel for a quick cocktail in the hotel's lounge. We had all taken a few sips of our drinks when we were asked to leave because the children were not behaving appropriately (they actually weren't behaving any differently than they did at the Allegro). We should have known better and certainly respected the hotel's wishes. However, it is truly a breath of fresh air when a hotel is considerate toward children as much as they are toward adult patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nicely located near to all major tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Gerry V
Reviews.Content: Overall very impressed with the hotel. Relatively older hotel that has been renovated and updated. The room has a small bathroom, however it was serviceable and water pressure for shower was outstanding. It was clean and generally the staff service was genarally outstanding. The only issue was a Sunday afternoon when my wife went to get a coffee and the staff member was rude sending my wife to the bar for coffee, however, the bar was closed. Otherwise, the staff were great and the concierge referrals to attractions and food were great. Easy to get to from O'Hare via the subway. I would defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganDiesel
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location in the Chicago theater district. We sure enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back.”
Reviews.Author: calgirl13
Reviews.Content: The bads outweighed the goods and I won't be staying here again. First, the goods. It's in a good location, within walking distance to Millennium Park, the shops on State Street and I walked to the Mag Mile although most people may want to cab it and/or take the train there instead. It is, however, not in a great location. If you really want to be centrally located, then you should stay closer to the Mag Mile. The lobby is beautiful and hotel has a purposefully old and retro feel to it that some may like. They have free HH every night bt 5 to 6 pm and the gym is pretty nice. The bed and pillows were comfy. Now, for the bads. The rooms are small, even by big city standards. I realize that hotel rooms in places like Chicago and NY are going to be on the small side, but it was a shoebox and the bathroom is the size of a very small closet. The walls are paper thin, I could hear everything that was going on next door and in the hallway, including a laugh fest at 2 am that woke me up. Clearly, this is an old hotel and they're trying hard to hide the shabbiness of the rooms but not quite doing enough. The paint is chipped and things just looked plain used and abused. Finally, and most annoyingly, I put in a request for a rollaway right when I checked in and when I checked again, I was told there wasn't any available. And that was it. I had to stare at the lady to even get an apology or explanation (I can't figure out why they can't set one aside when I put the request in and/or get more rollaway beds). Then I asked for late checkout and the front desk told me it wasn't a problem, but when I went to confirm it, the front desk said no such request had been made. I still got my late check out, but not before a staff member knocked on my door to see if I was still there. For people who are in the hospitality business, the staff wasn't particularly hospitable (except for the cleaning staff, those folks work hard and don't get paid enough). I can't fathom why anyone would want to pay full price for this place, I only booked it cuz I got a deal from sniqueaway. Chicago was great, the Allegro wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little gem!”
Reviews.Author: BensAdventures
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a couple of different hotels in the city, but this is easily the best hotel experience I've had. The hotel doesn't have a brand new/modern feel, but it feels warm and inviting. The rooms are well appointed, with a lovely comfortable bed, free Wi-Fi and a massive TV. The service from the staff was delightful, I was checked with one of the nicest smiles I'd seen for a long time! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, my boyfriend and I thought we were in for a real treat, but were unfortunately let down a little. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is decent and the rooms are comfortable and clean! We were just lead to believe the hotel would be a little bit more posh than it was. Perhaps if we stayed in a suite or something we would have been more impressed. Overall the service at the hotel is very nice. They have a daily complimentary wine hour, which is fun and a cool perk. The staff was very accomodating with any of our requests and provided complimentary umbrellas to use on rainy days. The lobby area and overall hotel looked more worn than expected and could maybe use some new carpets. Our room was a decent size. The decor was quirky, the shower pressure acceptable, and the bed comfortable. They also supply nice Aveda bath amenities. The hotel's location is optimal if you are looking to get around anywhere in the city. Just about everything was within walking distance (Millenium Park, Magnificent Mile, Willis Tower, etc.) and the subway stop was only a 5 minute walk away. You certainly can't beat that! So overall, this is a good hotel and I enjoyed my stay there! It's probably a little more 3 star verses 4 star, but is still worth staying at if the price is right (as with most hotels in large cities).

Reviews.Title: “Would not return again..”
Reviews.Author: Bunhun
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in the Allegro Hotel Chicago for 4 days 3 nights recently. We got a room with a king size bed.. Although the room is small, we got no problems with that as there was enough space for our luggages & all. However, we felt that the bed is not exactly comfortable, the bed sheets kinda feel rough to us. The walls are really thin and we could hear our neighbours talking and occasionally the flushing sound. 1 of the days, our room was not cleaned till afternoon and so we went to check with the front desk and was told that we got to request for our room to be cleaned which was a shock to us as we thought that like all hotels, rooms are cleaned except when you put on the no disturb sign. The worst is upon returning to the hotel at night, we found a bag of our garbage in the room and it was right next to our luggage. The housekeeping people must have forgotten to take it out after cleaning our bins. This is unacceptable to us. The hotel is in the theatre district and it is rather quiet at night. Although it is near the CTA trains, i would rec one to stay somewhere close to the magnificent mile where its lively at night or hotels near the chicago river so that you can get a great view. Am staying again at a Kimpton hotel in San Fran next month and i am contemplating if i should change! Overall, not a good experience and i wouldnt choose this hotel again if i were to head to Chicago again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay- reasonable price, pleasant service in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Traipsing
Reviews.Content: This is the third year my husband's organization had held a board retreat at the Allegro, and I have enjoyed each stay there. I particularly like the location, which is close to shopping and some excellent restaurants. The staff has been very attentive and helpful--seeming to have genuine smiles. The rooms do not offer coffee, but I like the morning coffee and afternoon wine in the lobby. Perhaps, more than any hotel where I have stayed, the lobby is the center of activity. Large numbers of people gather there to chat as they sit on interesting Art Deco chairs. The restaurant next door (312) is very good for a quick breakfast or lunch. We did not try dinner. Regular rooms are quite small, but they are very clean. The walls are a bit thin for my taste, and they have the smallest wash basins I have ever seen. However, I think this is a great place to stay- reasonable price, pleasant service in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel right in the heart of Chicago's theater district”
Reviews.Author: skohn
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Kimptons, so when this came up on SniqueAway, and coincided with a conversation I just had with one of my best friends about a trip to Chicago, I couldn't resist booking it! We got a great deal on a Junior Suite. The room was very nice- typical Kimpton decor-- but I wish we had booked a room with two beds instead of the suite. The 'living room' area went virtually unused. SniqueAway only offered the king-bed options however. We arrived from the airport very late to a warm welcome. I had signed up for the Kimpton frequent stay program InTouch (finally!) and was surprised to find out that part of that program includes a $10 credit to the mini-bar. We also had a fun laugh over the leopard and tiger-print bathrobes hanging in the closet. The next morning we worked out in the fitness room that was on our floor. (The founder is a strong believer in hula hoops so those were available for use!) We spent most of the day away from the hotel, with a quick stop before dinner to shower and change. Chicago was much colder (overcast & rainy) than we expected so we couldn't pile on enough clothes. The Loop location was central, but still felt like we weren't in the middle of anything. I'm sure it's much more hustle & bustle during theater season, but the streets directly surrounding the hotel were dead. (Great for sleeping!) You had to walk a few blocks in any direction to stumble upon some life. Overall I liked the location b/c it was nice to only be a short block from everything, it was just strange to exit the hotel to such quiet streets in the middle of a major city. Like most Kimptons, this hotel has the happy hour (free wine) from 5-6PM. Unfortunately we couldn't take advantage, but from the looks of it other guests had fun competing with each other on the Wii. Kimpton uses it as a way for people to get to know each other. On our last day we checked out, they held our luggage for us for the day. When we returned, they directed us to a bathroom where we could change before our flight. And then the subway stop for the airport line was only blocks away- very easy!! This hotel was on a larger side and had a thriving conference/wedding business so there was always a lot going on in the lobby. While the service was great, next trip to Chicago I'll probably try a hotel in a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Kimpton Experience”
Reviews.Author: cv529
Reviews.Content: We stay at Kimpton hotels whenever we can. The decor is always cool and the staff friendly. My daughter and I were in Chicago looking at Northwestern University and brought our Boston Terrier, Sullivan, along. The hotel was very pet friendly and he was given a goody bag that had poop bags, treats and a map of the local dog parks. The room was very small but quiet and comfortable. Great Downtown Loop location a block for the el. Tons of dining options if you walk to Michigan Ave. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Personal and Attentive service enhance the hip ambience”
Reviews.Author: margarey z
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Allegro Chicago far exceeded our expectations. From the quick and ease of the check in and out to the attentive staff who appeared as travel guides to better navigate our tour of the city, our vacation was truly enhanced due to our stay. Located in the heart of the city, every possible destination was a short distance from it's front door. In many ways, I had wished that we had no commitments so that we could stay in and better utilize the ambience of very chic boutique hotel. There is no doubt that I will seek out staying here again the next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great stay - good deal, no major issues.”
Reviews.Author: evilkitty510
Reviews.Content: Not my first time in a Kimpton and I canâ€™t complain because I booked 2 king rooms at $105 a night! Crazy deal in the summer in Chicago. This hotel was in a great location and we walked most everywhere or took cabs which were about $8 plus tip to most locations. Hotel Pros: Great Location Cool old building updated to modern features Really fun lobby Free wine at 5 (my favorite) Clean rooms Quiet location Great deal Kimpton Points and free internet with my rewards membership Good water pressure in shower Aveda products (donâ€™t have to lug shampoo) Free coffee Hotel Cons: Door lock broke and engineer had to come replace it (but gave us a $30 comp) Power blew with hairdryer use (took 30 mins to get power on â€“ building is old) Slow / busy elevators VERY small rooms (but we expected this in the city) THIN walls (you can hear your neighbors) Bar downstairs sucks â€“ tried to use our comp there and the cocktails were HORRIBLE (but they gave us something else b/c we told them so) In the Loop â€“ ideally would have liked to stay river north but this location was worth the price savings Restaurant ACROSS the street from the Cadillac theater is awesome â€“ but closed on Sat and Sun Hotel restaurant was overpriced and not that good for breakfast Would I stay here again? Probably if I got as good of a deal. Not necessarily a 4 star hotel though, more like 3 Â½. I still canâ€™t hate on Kimpton though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, convenience, food, entertainment...I keep coming back for more!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amid many things I enjoy in Chicago and handy to Union Station if you enjoy train travel. I booked the King Suite, which I thought was well arranged and well decorated. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly, they clearly wanted to go the extra mile for my comfort. I dined at both the 312 and Encore, the food exceeded my expectations, the bread really impressed me. I have met some very interesting people at the social hour in the evening, which I especially appreciate when I'm traveling alone. On this trip "West Side Story" was showing at the Palace Theater adjacent to the hotel and I caught another show at Strawdog Theater in Lincoln Park. It was fun to take in productions large and small!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff keep us coming back”
Reviews.Author: Gennine
Reviews.Content: We especially appreciate the friendly, welcoming and accomodating staff at the Allegro, from the front desk to housekeeping. We also like the comfortable rooms and the spacious "living room" on the lobby level, but it's the outstanding service that keeps us coming back.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jason06032
Reviews.Content: Never did I expect to have such an exceptional experience at the Hotel Allegro. I found the hotel online and booked it because it had the most reasonable rate at the time. I arrived at the hotel before 9:00 AM due to my early morning flight from CT. I asked the front desk staff about early check in. Within two hours, I received a call informing me they had a room prepared. This friendly, professional customer service continued throughout my entire four-day stay â€“ from front desk staff, concierge, restaurant, and housekeeping. Clearly, there is a commitment to exceed hotel guestsâ€™ expectations. One of the front desk staff, Gianna, was exceptional in her responsiveness, knowledge of Chicago, and willingness to assist me with my check-out requests. Tim was also very helpful with travel arrangements to the airport. The hotel provides coffee, including iced coffee, in the morning and then offers beer and wine each afternoon at 5:00 PM. Besides enjoying the beverages, itâ€™s so nice to see the lobby full of hotel guests and have an opportunity to talk to other people about the city. This was probably one of the most enjoyable hotel stays Iâ€™ve ever had, all because the employees were clearly committed to making it that way for all guests. While the actual stay was positive enough, upon completing the hotelâ€™s online survey (after I got home) I received a personal email from the general manager, Ryan Kunzer, who thanked me for my survey comments and offered to assist with my future reservations. I will gladly return to this hotel the next time I am in Chicago, all because people made an effort to let me know they cared about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: delawarecaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights while in town on business, combined with vacation. The room was modest in size but very well appointed, comfortable and very clean. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Fitness center featured top equipment in good condition but was very popular and could be larger. Free wine hour every evening was a hit and had the large lobby area full of guests and socializing. Parking was very expensive but to be expected downtown. Location is convenient to business district, interstate and shopping/dining on the north side of the river. We walked everywhere. We highly recommend Hotel Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: meryl c
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place. It's the best value for a great price! The design is so unique. It's exciting to explore the hotel - all the freebies - free coffee (ie, nice tea, iced coffee, hot coffee, milk, soymilk, etc.), summer drinks in the afternoon, cocktail hour every day are wonderful! The room itself is a little small, but the bed is wonderful, everyone is extremely helpful, you're right in the middle of the city, and you get a lot of other freebies! Tip - join the kimpton list to get free wifi and 2 free cocktails and an appetizer, and $10 off the minibar!

Reviews.Title: “Really, really nice”
Reviews.Author: traveler0706
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for our anniversary. It was very enjoyable. We told them of our anniversary and a bottle of sparkling wine with two glasses and 4 truffles were delivered to our room, totally unexpected. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was very clean and comfortable. The complimentary wine in the early evening was also a nice touch . We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: njguy4
Reviews.Content: Eclectic hotel, excellent service, friendly staff, good location

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap upgrade... overall, good.”
Reviews.Author: JamesFann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kimpton for the weekend, and had a normal room booked. In general, Chicago is an expensive city, so the hotel rate that we paid was decent with all things considered. We paid $50 for an upgrade which was worth the xtra square footage. The room decor is hit or miss, as it's seriously funky. However the animal print bathrobes are definately an excellent touch. As for location, it's ok. It's very close to transit which made it easy to get to the airport as it sits pretty much on the blue line. Noise wasn't an issue for us, but it definately could be if you were on a lower floor. It's pretty close to the Chicago theatre, but not close to some of the better dining in the city as it'd be better to be a bit further north. Rooms were kept clean, and the hotel in general was nice. Couldn't find an ice machine, as nothing in the hallways were clearly marked. We ate a the hotel bar below and the food was average at best. It's better to dine elsewhere. One weird thing is that the reception is on the 2nd floor, up the staircase so it's not the best. However, be aware of the slow (sometimes - super slow) elevators. All in a good hotel at the right price. Make sure you sign up to be a Kimpton Member for the free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I just had the best experience at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie T
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived at 9am into Chicago and it was pouring rain. We couldn't carry our bags around all day in the rain so we thought we'd just hang out in the hotel lobby for the morning until we were able to check in. When the staff saw us arrive they said we could pre-register and they would hold our bags for us until the room was ready. They also took my cell number so they could call me when the room was ready. They put our room on the "high priority list" so it would be prepared for us to check in very quickly. Not only did they hold our bags and let us pre-register, but they also gave us umbrellas to use so we could comfortably take a walk and explore a little while we waited for our room. When we came back to check in the staff remembered my name and had my bags waiting for me by the time I had the room key. They were very friendly and one of them even made me laugh. I was astounded by the help my friends received throughout our stay. We had dinner and breakfast at 312 Chicago and both meals were amazing! The concierge was helpful with questions about sending packages back to Australia and the front desk was able to answer so many questions about the activities, transportation and everything else during our stay. I am just really thankful that we chose to come to this hotel when there were so many in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay! Already booked future ones”
Reviews.Author: sockrebel
Reviews.Content: I've become a big fan of Kimpton's and wish they were everywhere I traveled. Like at the others, sign up (it's free) for their Kimpton InTouch (frequent stayer) program, and you get free internet and $10 off at the mini-bar. It's slightly annoying that the lobby is one floor up (not on the ground floor), but not that big a deal. A beautiful staircase and banister as you walk in, but I opted for the elevator since I had my luggage. For saying the promotional secret code, I was offered a dining credit at any of the hotel restaurants, which was cool. As an InnerCircle member, I was upgraded to a King Suite on a high floor. It was incredible! A nice bedroom, and a huge living area (with a table and chairs, couch and chair, TV and still lots of open space). It was a corner suite so lots of windows. The view was probably the best there was at the hotel, but not that great. The bathroom was a decent size, but the shallow bowl sink is kinda annoying because water easily and often splashes out. The Aveda products are a classic Kimpton touch that I appreciate. The manager left me a handwritten note and some snacks and drinks. Nice personal touch! I was gonna go check out the fitness center, but it was such a nice day out that I decided to go for a run along the lake. Really close and the rooms have a little card outlining jogging routes - very convenient. Overall, a great stay! I'll definitely be coming back. In fact, I've already booked stays here for my two upcoming trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great forward-thinking hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CmdrFun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Allegro while attending Lollapalooza in August 2011. We chose it based on price and location, as it's an easy walk to Grant Park and isn't ridiculously expensive. However, we were pleasantly surprised to find out that the Kimpton hotel chain is environmentally forward and pet friendly. The housekeeping service was extremely prompt and thorough, and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had brunch on Sunday morning in the adjoining 312 restaurant and found the service and food there excellent as well. We'll definitely be back to Hotel Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Allegro was an oasis on a fast and furious trip”
Reviews.Author: oferell1964
Reviews.Content: Had a brief and furiously busy business trip. Got to stay at the Allegro as a fluke (someone booked me into there by mistake)... but what a wonderful fluke it was. Like every other Kimpton hotel I've ever stayed at, the service was magnificent. Whether it was Bell Staff, Desk Staff, Bartender, Waitress, Housekeeping or Parking Valet, the service was outstanding. Sure the hotel is upscale, and so was my bill... but the level of service and the attentiveness of staff makes it all worthwhile. For example, housekeeping noticed that I drank all my regular coffeee and used up all the sugar... the next morning I had extra regular coffee and extra sugar in my room -- and I didn't have to say anything. They notice the little things. They get things right. By the second day out of four days with them, I was greeted by name. That was amazing. It was a whirlwind business trip with multiple meetings and extremely tight timelines. I felt like I'd hit the ground running the minute I got off the plane... but once I got to the hotel, even though my schedule was still crazy), things just didn't feel as bad. Kimpton hotels are like an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “I love Hotel Allegro!”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Hotel Allegro when I travel to Chicago because I love the hotel and the staff is great. The bell hop is quite friendly and very helpful. Upon check-in at the hotel, the front desk person asked if I was in Chicago for a special reason. I told her I was there to celebrate a birthday. I was quite surprised later that same evening when we returned to the room to find a bottle of champagne, two champagne glasses, a box of chocolates and a handwritten happy birthday note. It made our trip and celebration quite nice!

Reviews.Title: “Amenities give it the extra star”
Reviews.Author: Kristin880
Reviews.Content: I liked that it is an old hotel made trendy and modern. The evening wine/beer/soda and a "butlered" appetizer make for a great way to spend 5-6p. In the morning, there is coffee/iced coffee/tea available (since there aren't coffee pots in the rooms). During the day there is lemon water and maybe another beverage available. The staff was super friendly. Definitely sign up for Kimpton In Touch if staying here. It's free! And it gives you free wifi, a morning paper, and $10 to raid the mini bar with. The location is perfect, right next to the Cadillac Palace in the theater district. 15 minute walk to Michigan Avenue shopping, 5 to State Street. You can find cheaper parking (177 N Wells, less than 2 blocks away) than at the hotel, if you plan to not move the car. If you want in/out privileges, then parking at the hotel is a better option. The rooms are comfortable, but on the small side. The fridge is only a mini bar. There is a safe and a desk.The bathrooms are for one person getting ready at a time, but there's room to move around. The sink bowl is trendy and pretty tiny, so face washing was interesting. The bed and bedding were comfy, the lighting and a/c very good. Depending on finding a good rate I would stay here again, but it is on the pricier side normally.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Chicago and it was wonderful. Staff/accomodations were outstanding. Will definitely stay again when I re”
Reviews.Author: Kimo1965
Reviews.Content: Everyone was extremely courteous and professional. This was my first trip to Chicago and everyone made me feel at home. They answered all my questions and provided great details and information on places to go.

Reviews.Title: “another Kimpton gem”
Reviews.Author: RogerM4
Reviews.Content: I remembered this hotel as The Bismark from my childhood and youth. It has been thoroughly redone but they saved the classic Walnut Room. It is well located in the north loop area. Kimpton has four hotels in Chicago and I have stayed in three of them. The Burnham which is the old Reliance building on State street, The Monaco on the river and the Palomar on the near north side where I plan to stay on my next trip. I stay at Kimpton's hotels whenever possible the service is good and the afternoon wine is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Room Sizes Lottery”
Reviews.Author: fatbear2000
Reviews.Content: i stayed here as part of a group. Those of us with rooms on the 5th and 7th floors all complained about how small their rooms were. Those lucky enough to be on the 9th floor or above all seemed to have huge suites. I was a loser in the lottery...... My room had possibly the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, and also a tiny wardrobe in which all the space was taken by a hideous tiger-print type dressing gown. At least the bed was very comfortable but the room gave plenty of incentive to be out and about sight-seeing. Positive aspects to the hotel : - very helpful staff ( concierge provided free tickets to one of the popular bar/clubs ) - free refreshing drinks in the lobby in the afternoon, and tea/coffee in the morning - free happy hour drinks in the evening - free facility to print boarding passes ( although the internet access fee was laugh aloud expensive ) - spacious lobby - good central location

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base for Exploring the City”
Reviews.Author: jlc92
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent July 4th weekend here and got a SniqueAway rate (the hotel seems to be aggressively marketing flash sales recently). The Queen Deluxe room we had was small (220 sf) but comfortable, though the bathroom layout was not totally functional. The concierge staff, especially Joey, were always helpful in securing dinner reservations and helping me try to get tickets to the the Cubs-White Sox at Wrigley Field. There was no one in ground-floor bar/restaurant on Saturday night, and it seemed to be pretty sparsely populated the entire weekend. The hotel is well-located and close to a lot of great bars and restaurants. We ended up walking 10-15 minutes to a bunch of places but it's also an easy inexpensive cab ride to most places in the city and a couple blocks from the train.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckLLB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and pleasantly surprised by the quality of the overall hotel. My room, which was more of a suite, (Room 802) was very large and well appointed. Given the very modest price I paid, it seemed like an incredible value. Service at the hotel was friendly and very efficient. For those looking for in the area, I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Winecastle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel conveniently located near public transportation lines. Within walking distance of Millennium Park and The Art Institute of Chicago, and just a few blocks from popular retail clothing stores. The House of Blues is also located nearby. Hotel room was beautifully decorated, but both the room and bathroom were small - very nice, but small. Easy to overlook though since the hotel is one of the less expensive ones in the area. We enjoyed our stay and will stay here again on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor but not upto Kimpton Standards”
Reviews.Author: swg725
Reviews.Content: The Decor was fun, however the room size and furnishings were not up to Kimpton standards. The room was so small that I could not pass my wife unless we turned sideways. The bathroom sink was tiny as was the whole bathroom. The wifi was unreliable and when I went to the front desk to get a hrdwire bridge they first tried to tell me it must be my computer. Then when the person in the next room complained they admitted to "some problems" but couldn't provide me with the needed hardwire bridge because they did not have any left. They also had problems with the elevators. For a hotel that was just remodeled the 1 chair in the room was worn out, and I ususally expect 2 chairs and a small table in a room so my wife and I can sit and have a snack or meal together. The room was supposed to have a king bed, however it was only a queen.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; Great service”
Reviews.Author: Richard_from_Dallas
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by the Allegro - great value, great location, excellent service. The property is somewhat older and would benefit from a refurb- for which I delete one star - but everything else was top notch. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good except for the room decor”
Reviews.Author: brain1
Reviews.Content: The staff was as helpful as they could be. The lobby was a little noisy, but there was free, good coffee in the morning and lemonade in the afternoon. The room was comfortable, but the wallpaper was the ugliest I have seen in a long time. The ugly wallpaper was the only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in love with Allegro”
Reviews.Author: SheenaBeana
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Allegro for my birthday weeked. It was wonderful. Check-in was smooth and the clerk was very nice and accomodating. We had the standard king room but the bed felt more like a queen. There wasn't much of a view but the did have plently of sunlight. The rooms are so cute. They are small but there is a lot of detail put into them to make you feel like you are in a much bigger space. The bathroom is super small but the french style doors added a nice touch. While my boyfriend and I were getting settled in there was knock and the door. It was room service. The hotel sent us a bottle of champagne and a small box of chocolates as a birthday gift. That was a very nice touch. I joined the Kimpton InTouch program (which is free) before we arrived and for an added bonus we were given free wifi and $10 credit for the mini bar. The valet service was super fast. Everytime we called for the car they had it waiting for us when we arrived down stairs. Our stay was prefect and for an added touch we were given bottle of water for the trip home. All in all this is was a great stay and we can't to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahSmile1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights with some friends for a girls weekend. This place is amazing. Really nice, friendly staff. Huge and amazing lobby area-so much to look at and fun areas to sit and hang out. Complimentary beer/wine/app hour was a nice touch, met lots of other travelers and got to sample some local brews and snacks from the restaurant. We got a room with 2 double beds and we were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room, given that we were in the city we were prepared to be a bit cramped but that was not the case. The room had plenty of space and was decorated in a fun, contemporary way. Even the light fixture was cool. Nothing about this hotel is average. 2 huge windows gave us a great city view, another pleasant surprise. We had a lot of fun exploring this hotel and would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: ChiKitty24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Allegro during the weekend of 7/29-7/31 for our wedding. Overall, we found the hotel to be very nice and they definitely do try to make their guests stays more enjoyable. There is a wine reception daily, but we were not able to make it with the flurry of wedding activities going on this weekend. However, we were provided with chits (coupons) for free glasses of wine at the wine bar on the ground floor, Encore, which was a nice addition. The room was comfortable and well appointed, but the bathroom is very small (almost more of a closet that was transformed into a bathroom). Also, the walls are very thin - we found this out within 10 mins of checking in thanks to our neighbors frequent (and obnoxiously loud) shagging in the next room (Rm 1034). They made sure to remind us of the thin walls on all 3 days of our stay. The bed was comfortable, but the springs in it were creaky. In-room dining was fantastic - I looked forward to the American Breakfast both mornings of our stay. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and even surprised us in our room with champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries after our wedding. I would've given this boutique hotel 5 stars, except for the small bathroom, thin walls and also the lack of directions to the lobby (which is not on the ground floor, where one would expect it to be).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Usual Kimpton Nice Touches, Get a Curved Shower Rod!”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: Typical Kimpton panache and fun vibe with lots of little touches that make you know you've been someplace. The value-priced room ($179) was smallish but everything was well done and space was used well EXCEPT that the small bathroom shower rod was straight instead of curved outward, which meant that the shower curtain that had hugged so many before me was all over me, as well. Gross. I reported this upon checkout. Kimpton does so many things right - Aveda products, free wifi, room service menu that included healthy options, nice decor, manager's reception with wine (although then you have to deal with all the hoardes of people who can't resist a free glass of wine), nice staff that's well-trained. Valet parking was slow and undermanned sometimes, but I came and went during the height of theatre traffic, and this hotel is in the heart of the theatre district, so I don't hold it against them. Valet were very accomodating about tracking down my briefcase that I accidentally left in the back of the car. Great location to walk to just about everything. Rooms adequately soundproofed, everything was clean, a good place to stay for business if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not my favorite Kimpton.”
Reviews.Author: NYCityTravelers
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many other Kimpton properties, this was my least favorite. The lobby area is nice, but the dÃ©cor in my one-bedroom suite did not quite match the lobby theme. Ordered room service one night which came promptly. My room could not get completely dark due to the illuminated light switches which could not be covered. This is a good location for me for work, but I do not think I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: mjb358
Reviews.Content: Sought a hotel at the last minute for a quick weekend getaway, and found this hotel recommended on Tripadvisor. Excellent price, and a superb location in the theater district. Very good first impression with curbside staff. No-hassle check-in. 3(?) elevators for the facility. Not enough, but the infrastructure is what it is. The room was pleasant enough, but the carpet layers should be banned from the trade. The carpet was beginning to be pulled loose from under the baseboards in our room. One wonders if housekeeping ever reports this kind of thing. The bathroom had nice furnishings, and very nice linens, but was very small. The bed was first rate; comfortable, and nice sheets. The lack of a comfortable chair for lounging is a major bummer. The desk chair itself isn't particularly comfortable, and unsuitable for reading. It was very quiet at night. I was surprised, since it was quite easy to hear hallway noise. A superb location for out-of-towners going to the theater. Within easy walking distance of many fine restaurants north of the Chicago River. Overall, a decent choice based on location and price. And by the way, the several dogs in the room next door kept the barking to a minimum. Appreciated that...

Reviews.Title: “Art deco chic”
Reviews.Author: Canadian09876
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! Despite being in the Theater district, which is kinda dead, the hotel is close to the train, has a great atmosphere and really nice staff. They have really nice touches as well, like a fully stocked fridge of emergency supplies, huge bathroom, free wine, robes and high-end soap and shampoo etc etc etc. there is also a really nice "happy hour" where you get free drinks and can mingle with other guests! I would have expected to pay way more for everything we got. All hotels should be this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but quite pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: MrsL8281
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby and staircase! Felt like I was walking onto the Titanic! Hotel personnel were great and I thoroughly enjoyed "happy hour"! I enjoyed the "chill" music in the lobby. Felt like I was in a nice lounge. :) Our room, on the other hand, was a complete turn off. Extremely small, inconvenient, tacky decor overload. I guess I get the sizing of the room (ssssssssooooooo small - 220 sq. ft. says the website) since it is an old building but the decor was just fugly! Someone should've mentioned to the "designer" that the darker the paint, the smaller the room appears. A blue room? Seriously? Website states, "Design inspired by retro luxury cruise ships". If they were going for a scene from the 70's/80's classic "The Love Boat", I think they nailed it. The mirror in the room was useless since it had some dirt-like looking designs on them. I'm assuming the age of the building had to do with the fact that the bathroom had no exhaust fan. God forbid I took a hot shower! Waiting about 20 minutes after to use the bathroom mirror was annoying. Sink was small, useless, and you had to have the water running slowly otherwise it'd splash everywhere. Our iPod/clock didn't work but we brought small speakers so we didn't miss it much! The best thing about the room was that it made my husband and I NOT want to stay in there so we were out all day and night to avoid our roach motel of a room. I suggest you ask for anything BUT the Queen/King Deluxe Room unless you're by yourself and like to take cool showers. Obtaining Internet access is tedious. Have to enroll into some loyalty program before gaining access. Pretty dead in the area on weekends but thankful for the Dunkin' Donuts next door (hotel doesn't offer continental breakfast) and the transit system, a hop, skip and away!
