Loved seeing dogs in the hotel but thought it was a TAD much to allow dogs to sit on the couches. 5-10 min walk to Michigan Ave, 15 min walk to Millennium Park so no biggie!!! Hotel website states that self-park parking is $44 with in and out privileges. If you don't plan on driving (my husband and I took cabs), then it's $36 without in and out privileges. The hotel is a 7 out of 10, our room was a 2 out of 10 (our bed was comfy at least!). I think we got a good deal with the pricing of the hotel too so all in all, a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “I wanna live in room 1434.”
Reviews.Author: bradlamm
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. Half the month I'm in hotels - and I dig a Kimpton when I can find one. The first night in Chicago I was at my favorite hotel in the world, over at The Peninsula. When my trip was extended by a day, I called my agent and found out the Pen was sold out. "How about that Kimpton on Randolph?" I asked, and so I checked in and it was bliss. Big, roomy, great staff and comfy bed. I dig it. Thanks Kimpton Allegro for a great stay. Brad

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night when the Hyatt was overbooked. It has a lovely entrance and lobby area and when we arrived they had a happy hour going on with free beer/wine. Our room was very nice but overlooked an office block and there was only a double bed which felt a little tight for the two of us. The staff were all very polite also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: balancedliving
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro for 5 nights. ALL staff friendly and helpful. Hotel immaculately clean. Coffee/Tea in the morning is great, along with newspapers. Lobby/living room area is huge and comfortable. Evening wine reception is very lovely, would be great to expand the time by an hour or so. Afternoon ice water is a bonus! Public transportation across the street. Hotel has cabs waiting out front. We like to walk, many places within walking distance. Millenium Park about a 7 block walk. Good shopping on State St. about 4 blocks away. Greektown 1 mile away. Avec restaurant and Blackbird both highly recommended by others are within walking distance. Have cocktails at the top of the John Hancock building, river boat tour, and the neighborhood bike tour are must do's. In the summer Millenium Park has free orchestra concerts on Wed., Fri. and Sat. nights. Maxwell St. market on Sunday am. The BEST tortilla's at Rubi's. Nothing much to buy there, a typical outdoor flea market. Also some kind of water ice, not as sweet as we have in Phila. not like ice cream either. Very refreshing and delicious. Jose Garces from iron chef has a restaurant there. He has several in Phila, all are amazing. Did not get to this one, but I imagine it is as amazing as ones here.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: 888traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend in July. The location of the hotel is great, right in the loop, but during the weekends its pretty dead. All the shops nearby are closed, except for the 7 eleven or walgreens (even all the Starbucks were closed). The hotel itself feels somewhat old. The carpets are dark and drabby and one of the elevators stank of puke. Our room was very small. We booked a king bedroom for 2 adults and even the king bed seemed smaller than usual. the bathroom was tiny and could hardly fit 2 people in it at once. they had tiger print bathrobes (not the standard clean white bathrobes) and I was hesitant to use the robe because I couldn't tell if it was absolutely clean. They also did not offer slippers which I always like at hotel.The one nice thing was that all their toiletries were Aveda, which was a very nice. The towels were not great -very fibery and I would get all these little white fibers all over my face every time I wiped my faced. The one big tnegative was that they didn't offer free internet/wireless. You had to sign up to their kimpton "keep in touch" club to get internet and I counldn't tell if I had to pay or not to join. Needless to say, it was too much work just to figure out how to get free internet access. I would think that by now it should be standard for hotels to provide internet to their guests. However, one big plus was that they offered free cocktail hour everyday from 5-6pm. I think that's the hotel's saving grace. They offered white & red wine, strawberry sangria and beer which was really nice. And overall all the hotel staff were very very nice. But, would I stay at another kimpton hotel? Absolutely not until they upgrade their facilities and offer nicer extras for their guests. I'd rather spend my hard-earned money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to weekend in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: cessalee
Reviews.Content: This was only my second stay at a Kimpton property, the other being the Hotel Monaco, also in Chicago. The hotel Allegro was very nice and the staff was extremely accommodating and friendly! The hotel is very attractive on the inside and has several dining options attached, including ones that are open late in a otherwise desolate downtown area. The rooms are very small, but that's to be expected. If you're traveling with a family, I would go with the Monaco, but our romantic weekend getaway was perfect for the Hotel Allegro!

Reviews.Title: “Allegro made our anniversary getaway special”
Reviews.Author: almabalma
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Allegro for our one-night anniversary getaway because of its reputation and location. It was everything we hoped for and more. In addition to the free wine hour that helped me choose Allegro over some of its Chicago competition, we enjoyed the friendly staff, comfortable bed, flat screen in-room TV and a luxurious (if small) bathroom appointed with Aveda amenities. But what really made our stay special was the surprise waiting for us when we returned from our dinner out: there was a gift of Champagne and chocolate truffles awaiting us! I travel for work every month and stay in luxury hotels. Never before has one made me feel like such a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to major attractions!”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler50Plus
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise to be upgraded to a king suite! So I can't comment on the size of the regular rooms, but the suite was just gorgeous. Small-ish bathroom with very little counter space, but certainly workable and with great water pressure. Aveda products -- nice. Comfy bed, soft linens, more than enough fluffy pillows, complimentary robes, ironing board -- exceptionally well-equipped room. Really really really appreciated the desk with the multiple-outlet station -- didn't have to crawl around on the floor hunting for outlets for our netbook, cellphones, makeup mirror, etc. (I always travel with an extension cord since hotel rooms typically have electrical outlets in the most inconvenient places -- but not the Allegro!) Free coffee bar every morning 6-10 am -- again, very much appreciated, and with Starbucks-quality coffee. Free wifi and complimentary $10 in minibar goodies when you sign up for the free Kimpton rewards program. Boarding passes printed for free. The Allegro is in the more "business" section of The Loop, so lots of major attractions are well within walking distance. Willis Tower (nee Sears Tower), Macy's on State St, Millennium Park, bicycle rental at Wabash & Wacker, the Art Institute on Michigan -- we walked to them all. Very short cab ride to Adler Planetarium or Shedd Aquarium -- or better yet, rent bicycles for the day and you can reach them in minutes via the 10-mile long lakefront bike path (with NO car traffic to contend with). The immediate neighborhood: numerous 7-11's, a CVS Pharmacy (sells wine), Subway, Dunkin Donuts, a McDonald's 2 blocks east at Randolph & Dearborn. If you're like us and don't like to spend the time/money on sit-down restaurants, these fast-food/snack places are really handy. We loved the Allegro and can definitely recommend it to anyone. When we come back to Chicago, we'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The treated us like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: LKL-DC
Reviews.Content: The staff at hotel allegro were amazing. The day before our trip I received an email asking If there was anything the hotel could do to make our trip great. I responded by telling them that I planned a surprise trip for my fiancÃ©'s birthday and asked for early check-in. Not only did we have an early check in but they upgraded us to a king suite room and surprised us with s birthday card, chocolates and champagne in celebration of my fiancÃ©. On top of the superior customer service, the entire staff was wonderful, the hotel was hip and upscale and the location was walking distance to Chicago hot spots. Next time we are in Chicago we will absolutely return to Hotel Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: NNewJerseyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Allegro six or seven times now and and I love it. The room itself and the bathroom are actually on the small side. But they make up for it in comfort and amenities. The room was always spotless and fresh. The front desk staff always remembered me when I returned. The service is excellent. And they have a good frequent guest program. The gym it small, but it has excellent equipment. Overall it's one of my favroite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central, but a bit of a walk to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king room on the 5th floor for about 4 nights with a friend. Neither of us had been to Chicago, so we wanted a hotel that was centrally located. Transportation from O'Hare airport could not have been more simple - one of the metro lines close to the hotel ran 24 hrs/day and went directly to and from the airport. The room was a good size and had everything we needed. The bathroom was rather small, but okay for 2 people since we were only there for a couple of days. Unfortunately, our room was facing Randolph St. and we could hear the train go by all night. Luckily, there was some sound proofing on the windows, but if you're a really light sleeper, I would request a room away from that part of the hotel. We really enjoyed the complimentary wine reception in the lobby everyday. This was my first stay at a Kimpton hotel and that touch really stood out. In the morning they also provide complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby. All that being said, I was surprised to find that, though this hotel is located in the theatre area/downtown, there were not THAT many restaurant options in the direct vicinity to the hotel, only a handful. We found we had to walk north of the river to find more variety. The area was also very quiet at night which could be a positive or a negative depending on what you're looking for. It was negative for us, since nothing seemed to be open past 6pm. You couldn't even get a coffee anywhere (unless you went to McDonalds...). Perhaps our ages may have been a factor, as we are both in our mid to late 20s, so we would have preferred being closer to a bit of nightlife and having the option to walk somewhere closer to have a drink that was not in the hotel restaurant. It all depends what you are looking for. The hotel itself was lovely and very clean. The staff were always very friendly and helpful if you needed anything. I think this hotel is a great location for first time visitors, as we walked everywhere to see all the sights. However, next time I might be inclined to stay at a hotel north of the river in hopes of being a bit closer to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the Allegro were most helpful. The hotel was full when we arrived, but we never waited to get assistance. Our suite was very comfortable. The location is close to the river and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Few Complaints”
Reviews.Author: yagators
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the Fourth of July weekend. It was a nice hotel with a comfortable bed, nice coffee and wine hours and friendly staff. It was in a good location because it was in a less congested area of town but we could walk/take a cab everywhere. The bathrooms were small but had nice amenities. The room itself was pretty spacious. Unfortunately, I do have a few complaints. First, they advertise the restaurant 312 all over the hotel, yet on the two times we tried to grab some food it was closed (closed early on Sundays and closed on the 4th). The same was true for the bar in the hotel. Second, the walls in this hotel are thin. We had a room at the very end of the hallway but were awoken around midnight when the party next door came in and started talking loudly. This was a very nice hotel and I would definitely stay there again, I will just make sure the next time I come I do not come back to the room hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but incredibly noisy!”
Reviews.Author: sarahktsl
Reviews.Content: After having recently stayed in a Kimpton in NY, I was pretty surprised by the size of the rooms in their Chicago property. The NY rooms were huge by comparison. But they're pretty nice, and if you can squeeze yourself into the bathroom, you'll find that everything is there. The decor is modern and chic, and the service at the hotel was pretty great. They delivered a yoga bag to my room when I requested it, and their Kimpton program (free wi-fi and $10 for the mini bar) is always nice. The gym was nice as well - a good variety of machines, weights, and hula hoops (!) in case you are looking for something different. Though the hotel was nice, there was one thing that drove me nuts. The noise! The walls in the room are incredibly thin, and the second night I was there, I was literally able to hear every word of an argument that my neighbors were having. And though they were yelling at first, once they calmed down (therapy would probably be good for them...) I could still clearly hear their conversation. I felt like they were in my room. Both nights I woke up to bangs and clangs and noises from my neighbors (and the hall) - and since everything seems to close at 6pm in that part of the city, I couldn't get earplugs. I had to survive by sleeping with a pillow over my head... it was that bad. I spoke with another colleague that was staying at the hotel, and he had the same issue. But he got to listen to his neighbors TV at 4 am...yay...fun. If you need a hotel, this one isn't bad, but if you're a light sleeper, avoid it at all costs or get some serious earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Allegro and stay often”
Reviews.Author: tcolussi
Reviews.Content: I really like the Allegro. I go to Chicago on business often and stay there each time. The wine hour is great - gives you a chance to unwind by yourself or with colleagues after a long day at the office. In the summer, they also offer sangria and local beer. It's from 5-6 and appetizers are also served. The room size is typically small, but that's pretty standard in downtown Chicago. It's convenient anywhere downtown - local restaurants, businesses and parks. The people are friendly and check is quick and easy. Anytime I've needed something, I call and they come right up. The bar downstairs is fabulous too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Fabulous26
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight family stay @ the Hotel Allegro. I have to honestly say that this hotel has now become our favorite and we travel a lot! We originally were scheduled to stay as a couple, then plans changed and we brought our 2 children. They upgraded our room to a suite for just an additional $50. The kids were so excited when they received a kids bag with fun stuff inside. The complimentary popcorn, lemonade, wine hour really made us feel special (root beer for the kids). We were celebrating my husband's birthday and were surprised to find chocolates and a bottle of champagne in our room! The customer service was above and beyond in every aspect! So attentive to details! Also loved the ambiance--colorful couches, wall art and cozy living room. When you make your reservation make sure you sign up to become a Kimpton member (free). As a result of signing up we received a $25 voucher and kids-eat-free cards for the attached restaurant which had incredible food! We only had one complaint- the beds were too comfortable!!! We wanted to see the fireworks @ Navy Pier. We thought that we would take a short nap since the fireworks were very late. The beds were so comfortable that we never woke up in time to see them! We got a good laugh! Hotel Allegro we'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: First I have to say I've been staying at Kimptons for awhile now, and I've always had good experiences. This was my first time at Hotel Allegro and it didn't disappoint. I paid a little more for a King Premier room, and it was really nice. The bathroom wasn't huge, but I honestly don't expect that when I travel. The room was clean and I had plenty of space. And as a Kimpton InTouch member, I got free WiFi and $10 for the mini bar. The only thing I would've liked was just a litttttttle more lighting, but it wasn't a big deal at all. Oh, and the bed was so comfortable! The hotel is in a great location in the Theatre District -- not far from the L, and walking distance to plenty of restaurants, shops, etc. Everyone at Allegro was so nice and welcoming. Next time I'm in Chicago I'll definitely consider Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Great perks for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: JetSetFiend
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at this hotel, but found it to be very nice. I travel quite often for business and usually stay a certain chain of hotel. This time my first choice wasn't available so I decided to give the Hotel Allegro a shot as I have previously stayed at a Kimpton property and had a good experience. I was glad to hear when I checked in that since I was a KImpton Intouch member that I got a complimentary $10 mini bar check out, in room WIFI, and a continental breakfast next door at 312. I would definitely stay here again as the added perks were great. Location was good also; close to L, restaurants, entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “For business traveler's it's incredibly convenient; within walking distance of many restaurants and other attractions.”
Reviews.Author: KJS500
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very neat and clean; staff is extremely accommodating and very caring. I stay at the Allegro any time I'm in Chicago for business because it's right across the street from my office builing and I don't have to deal with cabs. In addition to convenience, it's also within walking distance of many of the attractions and restaurants Chicago is famous for. The only issue that may be a concern to some is the rooms and bathrooms are small, but for me it's not an issue. The positives by far outweigh the negatives for this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Suzkin2
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago to visit my son who made reservations for me to stay at this hotel which I prepaid 3 weeks in advance. Due to flight delays I didn't check in until after 9PM and was placed in a room across from the elevators on the 12th floor. I typically don't care to stay in such centrally located rooms due to elevator noise but I figured I would try and ignore that and not make a fuss. The room was small, which is fine, the bathroom was small which is fine, the closet?? was pretty much non-existent. It was about the size of a broom closet and I am not kidding! It had one curving bar about 4 feet off the ground and another one higher probably about 8 feet off the ground, clearly out of reach. I tried hanging a few of my items only to find that my pants were dragging on the floor on the lower bar and that there just wasn't sufficient room to hang anything. I closed the door and called downstairs only to be told rather dismissively that they had no rooms available. I then went to open the "closet" door only to find it was stuck! it never opened again. So I ended up draping my clothes all around the room. Hey I understand quaint and cute, I live in the Northeast and am familiar with all that. This was unfit to be called a hotel room IMHO. Then again there seemed to be several young men staying in the hotel and a number of them on my floor who were under the impression they were in a dorm and yelling down the hall while keeping the elevator doors open was appropriate behavior.. when I called downstairs I was told they could move me to another room at 11pm at night... I told them I was ready to go to bed and since I was checking out the next day that was not the solution I was looking for. So of course I got to wake up when they all returned from their night of partying at 4AM. I'm guessing they were not quiet walking in the door of the hotel either so perhaps someone could've reminded them that this was a hotel??? then again since these guys needed no closet space so perhaps this was a perfect fit for them.. Anyway, clearly if you arrive late in the day regardless of the fact that you prepaid for your room you get stuck where they want to stick you. Not cool.. I did not want to make my son feel bad so although I would change hotels under other circumstances I stayed there. When checking out the Rooms Manager was very apologetic about my experience and I hope they heard me.. I don't believe I will stay there again although they promise to offer me a much different experience next time. I just wish my first experience had been better then I know I'd be back there regularly since my son now lives in Chicago and I would recommend the place to friends and family. I'm sorry I can't make that recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “I love Chicago and I loved the Hotel Allegro”
Reviews.Author: sansan22
Reviews.Content: Chicago is one of America's great cities. The city is bright, friendly, tall and a great place to spend time with family. I spent two nights at the Hotel Allegro. The hotel was easy to get to on the El. I arrived early but was allowed to check-in. The room was clean, wi-fi and comfortable. I would stay there agin.

Reviews.Title: “It's home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: BerniceHalverson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Allegro at least five times in the last two and a half years. A colleague originally booked it through a consolidator for me along with a plane ticket and it's now my favorite place to be in Chicago. The desk people are consistently friendly and helpful. Their afternoon refreshments and evening wine bar are wonderful social times. They have never led me astray with a restaurant recommendation. I truly feel like I have "people" there even when I am in town on business solo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lini04
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the theater district of Chicago. It is very close to Millennium Park and several other attractions. The Allegro was consistent with the Kimpton brand- very friendly service, very clean, beautifully modern decor, and the feel of a small boutique hotel. They are pet friendly and have a complimentary wine services from 5-6. My husband was a big fan of the Starbucks coffee in the mornings. We also upgraded to a suite as apart of a promotion. It was worth it! Make sure to book through the hotel (the generally match other websites) in order to get their special deals like free parking. You can look on their website to see all the offers. It also pays to be a Kimpton InTouch member. You can get free wifi and other email offers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: The Allegro is in a great location downtown in the theater district (next to the Cadillac Palace Theater) and just south of State Street and Millennium Park (on Michigan Ave). The lobby/reception area is really nice and big and is a great location for their FREE wine tastings in the afternoon. They also give complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings. Check-in was easy and everyone was friendly. We had a King Premier room and we were a little disappointed paying extra for this room. The room is very large and very clean/nice, but the bathroom is small. The sink area has very little counter space which is a rarity in downtown Chicago hotels. The toilet and sink are also very close together. Also, we faced a brick wall and had absolutely no view out of our windows. Again, for a King Premier that was disappointing. Overall, I would recommend the hotel, but I'd suggest not upgrading to the supposedly nicer rooms. Granted, I don't know how small the bathrooms are in the less expensive rooms, but it's hard to imagine that they could be much smaller. There is a parking lot for $36 for 24 hours on the corner of Randolph and Wells (just west of the hotel). I'm not sure how much valet parking costs at the hotel, but $36/night is a pretty good price in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better everytime!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonNNH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Allegro a number of times, and every time I visit, it surpasses my expectations. From the warm greeting by the bell staff at the door, to the friendly professionalism of the front desk team, I feel welcomed at this hotel. It doesn't hurt that I almost always arrive during the evening social hour when they are serving free wine! The rooms here are very comfortable and well laid out. I have been in large rooms and small rooms but I have never had a bad room. The beds are very comfy and I love the linens. The bathrooms are older but well-equipped. The desk area is also well-equipped with extra electrical outlets for all my gizmos, and there was an i-Home type unit that I could plug my iPhone into. Best thing about the Allegro (and all Kimptons) is the marvelous "In Touch" program. Do not stay there withouth signing up. Also, consider following Kimpton on Twitter to learn about special promos. They announce some really good ones only through that channel. The Allegro is fun and whimsical. I know that this does not appeal to everyone, but if you are looking for something that is not "corporate" (ie: not beige or gray), you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: akvanwagner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary. The staff was very helpful and friendly upon our arrival and during our stay. They helped me in surprising him with the top layer of our wedding cake and set it up in our room while we were out to dinner as well as surprising us with a bottle of champagne. The room was wonderful & clean! Loved the modern feel! We had a wonderful time and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: irbflyfish
Reviews.Content: Nothing special to report. I would prefer to stay at the Fairmont, but it was booked, so I stayed here. Not a bad location, but not the best. Not the best room, but OK. What can I say, just an average hotel, but in downtown Chicago for under $200 it was, like I said, OK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Belle0242
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smaller due to being in an older building, the bathrooms are tiny too (more of a European style). For two tall individuals it was tricky, but we dealt with it. All staff that we ran into was very nice and helpful with advice. Right in the heart of the theater district! Room service was delicious and timely. Already booked our reservation for the first week of August.

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay was a success”
Reviews.Author: Charmaine5
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an overnight stay in the city for my birthday that was not overly expensive. We were extremely happy with our stay at Hotel Allegro; especially, after checking out I realized that I had left something behind. Their security staff could not have been more helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: EthelN
Reviews.Content: The rooms are exactly what is shown in the pictures and the decor makes we want to wallpaper my whole house. Decor aside, the staff were friendly, the hotel was clean, the wine reception was great (lounge areas are well designed and have lots of comfortable seating). The bed was the most comfortable bed, I missed it when I got home. We walked everywhere from this hotel and places to eat are in abundance. Also great access to the pedway system (underground tunnel) which came in handy because it was a very cold May weekend when I stayed. I would stay here again. Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at a Kimpton hotel...”
Reviews.Author: srhbluerain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We were in town for a concert so we were only in Chicago for about 24 hours. The hotel is boutique style. Our room was comfortable. On the small side and we had a view of a rooftop of the building next door, but we were hardly in the room. We also checked in early so that was the room that was ready for us. And the bed was comfortable and that's what matters most to me. The customer service was excellent as usual with Kimpton hotels. They let us check in early and greeted us with champagne and a personal note since they knew we were getting married at a Kimpton the following November. The bar was cool looking, it had a trendy feel to it. We had a late night drink there. We had room service for breakfast and that was delicious. Very comfortable boutique hotel and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I can sum it up with GREAT”
Reviews.Author: heartmomma
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline, great price, great location. I drove to Chicago for a family vacation with my husband 3 kids (ages 11months, 5, and 7) they were disappointed there wasn't a pool, but they had a great time! The staff gave the kids a "gift bag", it was a little backpack with stickers, yo yo, toothbrush, just little things to make them feel special :) Our trip also ran through my anniversary, and the concierge had a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries sent to our room and later slid a note under the door telling us happy anniversary. So they were able to make every one of us feel special on our trip. My then 5 year old STILL remembers the name of your hotel and wants to go back to Chicago. Register online with Kimpton InTouch! It's free to do and gets you free wifi. Also join them on Facebook to find out the "secret password" during the summer, we did and got to choose from a roomupgrade or $50 room service credit!

Reviews.Title: “Was very impressed and would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: tripledec
Reviews.Content: The thing that impressed me the most was the genuine super-friendliness of all the staff I encountered. Had a short (2 night) stay and it was very enjoyable. Liked the decor of the common areas and room. Had a nice modern feel that complimented the historic building well. Had a very good room service meal that was quickly delivered and hot. Room rates were also excellent and very good value. Liked the window coverings - daylight usually wakes me and they blocked out light well. The complimentary wine bar was great and the lobby had a very nice inviting feel. Artwork in the hotel was very cool. A couple of very minor things: Valet parking is pricy but that's the norm in downtown Chicago; less expensive self parks are close by. The room was a little small but very efficient and not unreasonably so. Internet wasn't free but it was a nominal charge. For the price, it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “REFRESHING....”
Reviews.Author: WURA_THA_EXPLORER
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that I truly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Allegro. I chose the hotel after reading TA reviews and seeing that management actually read and replied to comments. And I really respected that. The staff was extremely professional and friendly. The rooms were tidy and neat for the most part. I did visualize a bit of red Serratia marcescens in the corner of the bathtub. Just a small bit though. And i didnt really understand, what was going on with the bathroom floor. The flooring is like black tile accented with white streaks, but there were alot of water spots/stains on the floor. I thought the floor was actually dirty, but when I tried to wipe at it, it didnt come off. NONETHELESS...the hotel was great...I just can be reaally weird.. when it comes to cleanliness...and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully remodeled older hotel”
Reviews.Author: KNUCCI
Reviews.Content: Located in an older building in the Theater District, the Kimpton has don a beautiful art deco themed remodeled. Their service is great as well, including morning coffee and tea, afternoon wine hour from 5-6 pm, Avede bath products, and a great consierge named Anthony. The donwside is that the rooms have small bathrooms, the art deco chairs are very uncomfortable and they charge extra for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of small problems add up to a negative.”
Reviews.Author: shyLawGal
Reviews.Content: I was very optimistic about this trendy hotel but I won't be back because there were too many issues to be ignored. There was a very small leak in my bathroom ceiling when the person above me showered. I had a salad with fresh mozzarella balls, but the cheese was actually sour an inedible. The first night I ordered room service. They said it would come in 20 minutes. Two hours later it still had not arrived so I called. When it finally arrived, the salmon was fine but the mashed potatoes were cold, and there was no water or bread served with dinner. They did not charge me for the dinner but I would have rather paid for food served in a timely manner. The closets in my room were not deep enough for a coat hanger, so I had to arrange my clothes sideways. The service staff (especially the gentleman who summoned my taxi each morning) were very pleasant and welcoming. My room was small but clean and serviceable. I do not expect perfection and I am tolerant to a point, but next time I visit Chicago I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: amysurb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Allegro several times, and it has always been a pleasant experience. The rooms are clean and stylish (don't forget to ask for a bathrobe--they are plush and come in fun animal prints), and the service is always friendly. The Kimpton Hotels have a good loyalty program, and they have an OUTSTANDING pet policy. I will choose a Kimpton Hotel at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great service, nice location....all around great.”
Reviews.Author: thedevine1
Reviews.Content: So, me and my wife celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary in Chicago and stayed at the Hotel Allegro. We couldn't have been happier with the hotel. First off, we priceline'd the hotel and got a great rate, but in the mean-time my wife broke her foot and was on crutches. The hotel happily made sure we had a ADA king room (#1425) which was very nice and spacious. Everyone that worked there seemed to be very happy and helpful. They even surprised us by giving us a bottle of champagne and 6 chocolate covered strawberries! Check in as well as check out took maybe a minute. Very quick. The decor was very modernized and cool. The location was pretty good for us (it's right in the theater district, so it's great for that. It might be a bit of a walk (or cab ride) to get to some shopping.) Like i said, my wife had a broken foot, so we had to take a taxi everywhere. It's only a block or so from an EL station, so it should be easy enough to take that around the city. Overall, we had a GREAT stay here and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in chicago”
Reviews.Author: nrajk757
Reviews.Content: Great staff with very cozy and welcoming rooms. I love kimpton hotels and have to say this is one of their unique and amazing ones yet!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kimpton Hotels, best concept ever!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoNative41011
Reviews.Content: I'm traveling for business from Indianapolis and really enjoy this hotel. Everything they do, from concept to completion is incredible. I stayed at the Muse in Manhattan a few years ago and really loved the Kimpton committment to service. I had the opportunity to work in Chicago this weekend and am very happy to say it's consistent in Chicago as well (a friend says that San Fransico, Argonaut is the same). The Kimpton company does an excellent job of making each persons stay the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay during the summer”
Reviews.Author: hgreen11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro for 5 nights last August during Lollapalooza. Hotel was very modern. Loved everything about it, from the wine/cheese hour during the afternoon, to the comfortable beds and even the free wifi. It's no secret that some of the rooms are a little small, but it's not as if you're trying to run laps in your rooms... Great location, close to the subways, and an easy walk to Grant Park. Would gladly stay here year after year for Lollapalooza.

Reviews.Title: “An amazingly wonderful hotel that cares about their guests!”
Reviews.Author: LRenee85
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Allegro Hotel in downtown Chicago, and the entire staff were AMAZING!!!!!!! From accommodating me with my early check-in (flight landed at 10am, so I was there well before the 2-3pm check-in times at most hotels, but not a problem for me at Allegro) to making sure I got to the airport on a busy Wednesday rush hour afternoon (and everything in between)... Let me first start by saying the staff were wonderful, Anthony, Erica, Chuck, Corey, Demond, all made me feel very welcomed every morning, afternoon, evening, and any other part of the day I saw them. Anthony is very knowledgeable about places in the area (and anywhere in Chicago really) so if you are undecided where to go on the town don't hesitate to ask. The wine hour is just so wonderful too! (Complementary wine hour from 5pm-6pm everyday.... Yes everyday!) I especailly like the art-deco theme of the hotel very posh and welcoming. If you are a walker like I am (New York City girl, so I have no problem walking tons of blocks) then you will enjoy the mile long stroll to Magnificent Mile, but if you prefer cabs then they're easily available too. You are located in the middle of the theatre district, so if you like plays, or tours of these historic places this is the place for you. The blue line "EL" train is close by as well (as soon as you leave the hotel make a left turn and it's at most 750 feet away, how lovely is that? You could take it straight O'Hare airport for $2.25 and arrive in no time, most major cities don't have the subway this accessible to downtown areas but this worked out great for me). Overall this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at in Chicago, and I will definitely stay again, as well as recommend to a friend. There truly is not one bad thing I can say about this hotel at all. Five stars across the board!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Nanaland3
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night to celebrate my birthday, and once I mentioned that occasion, it was upgrades and freebies from there on! Our room was upgraded to a suite, my husband ordered champagne and chocolate and after he put the order in and hung up , he received a call back explaining that it was on the house. That night we enjoyed a free bottle of champagne and chocolate! I would definitely stay here again, they offered many amenities and made us feel comfortable and welcome. We've stayed at Hotel Burnham in the past and the service far better here at the Allegro. My only reason I didn't give 5 stars on the location was that it was a little further from State St and Mich Ave , but we certainly didn't mind the walk and little bit of exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: teejay1111
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting trip to three different states. I was turned on to the Kimpton Allegro in Chicago by a very good friend of mine. I arrived fairly late in the evening and was greeted by a very nice young lady at the desk. I came back down after I saw how small my room was and she gave me another larger room with no hassle. I stayed at the hotel for 2 days, and it seemed every time I came to the lobby this SAME lady was on duty. I was kidding around when I asked her if she ever got a day off, then she joked right back with me. Turns out she is HILARIOUS, and very efficient. The hotel is beautiful, the service is great, the food is delicious, and the front desk lady is a regular comedian. I will stay here every time I am in Chicago. I felt very relaxed, the rooms were extremely tidy, and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: njocovic
Reviews.Content: This is by far the coolest place I have ever stayed. It has the same vibe as the Hard Rock, but with more personal flare. The staff are kind and welcoming. The happy hour is a nice way to start your evening. The tea and coffee is a fantastic way to start the day. Lounging in the lobby sipping on tea is a wonerful way to enjoy a cold, windy day in Chicago. I look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with our stay at Hotel Allegro Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mary397
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet, good location, excellent service, very reasonable, clean, and very pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Lindsloo22
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Allegro. The meet & greet wine happy hour was a great treat! I forgot toothpaste (okay I didn't have a travel size through the airport). I called the front desk and within 5 minutes someone came to deliver me toothpaste! The rooms are small (this is the only time I've been to Chicago so I'm not sure), but wow they were neat. Modern decor, but has the charm of an older hotel. You can still see the old bronze mail drops in the hallways. I'm not sure on the price, as someone else booked my trip for me, but if it fit within our budget constraints, the rate must be pretty darn reasonable! They had coffee out in the morning. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but everything was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay for a girls weekend of theater and fun in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: YaYaPQ
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff is super friendly, unique and comfortable decor and priced very reasonably. We'll definitely go back and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Out of 5, I'd give this hotel a 6”
Reviews.Author: TaylorCross
Reviews.Content: In an effort to balance cost with location, I stumbled upon this boutique gem of a hotel in downtown Chicago. As a avid traveller for both business and leisure, I must say that Hotel Allegro, and Kimpton Hotels in general, makes the list of my top 3 favourite hotels I've ever stayed in. Upon entering the hotel, you are immediately charmed by the lobby, which is filled with rich colours and textured patterns. Each item in the room has been carefully chosen to meet the needs of both style and function. The rooms are also a pleasure to the eye, with different patterns and fabrics that make you wish your room could be that cool everyday. But what sold it for me was ultimately the staff. Upon making the reservation, I noted in the online comments section that it was a special anniversary. Thinking no one would notice, I was suprised to arrive and find that, not only had our room been upgraded to a delux suite, but the staff had also left a box of chocolates and a bottle of champagne with a note wishing us a happy anniversary in Chicago! I have never encountered a hotel with so much attention to detail - from my favourite newspaper to the type of pillow I preferred for my bed. I truly felt like this boutique hotel has mastered the idea of luxury while maintaining a reasonable price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a hotel with both character and class.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Chouinards
Reviews.Content: We (my college-age daughter and I) arrived at the Allegro on 3/5/11 and were warmly welcomed. We were able to have an early check-in which was very much appreciated. The room was "cute" (ok, small), but was completely perfect. Everything was clean and well appointed. We did not eat in the restaurants, but we did enjoy the wine gathering each evening. The concierge recommended the BEST Chicago pizza place a few blocks away. Our stay was very enjoyable, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: kstaudt
Reviews.Content: The Allegro Hotel is a great place to stay while in Chicago. It's close to everything a business traveler needs including the financial district and good places to eat. The hotel itself is hip but not too hip for this past-middle aged traveler. Joining the InTouch program allows you to have free wireless and for an iPad user that's key. I loved the room service menu which included a healthy menu which was really good. Good workout facilities and good coffee in the morning which was just as good as my usual Starbucks just like the bellman said! Although I wasn't able to take part in the wine in the evening, I am looking forward to it my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: rara1324
Reviews.Content: I attended an event at the hotel and spent the night. My room was a little small, but for one person for one night it was fine. The closet was crazy small, but worked for me. The service was great. The staff went above and beyond all around. Chuck at the front door was amazing. He even helped us unload stuff at the loading dock for the event I was attending. Thanks Chuck! Everyone in the catering staff was extremely helpful. The front dest was great. Since I live in the Chicago area I don't stay in hotels here often, but would definitely consider the Allegro if needed, and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Wabash_Sphinx
Reviews.Content: I'm on the Kimpton Hotels email list and got an ad for Chicago stays booked before the end of January and completed before sometime in March. The rate was good but the kicker was free parking. Rates in downtown Chicago can easily be double the sale price, so we booked for a visit to a daughter attending college at Loyola. The hotel in in the Loop, right next to one of the restored theaters in that area. The lobby was elegant, and, while our room was small, it was beautifully appointed and clean. Lighting, electrical outlets, internet were all easily within reach. In the morning, there was coffee in the lobby. We had a late evening snack from room service, along with an order of margaritas. They served the latter with a bottle of Patron, which exceeded our expectations. I titled this review "surprise" in part for the level of service but also for a personal reason. When my wife and I were first dating 30 years ago, we enjoyed several weekends in Chicago at the Bismark Hotel, which became our practical and sentimental favorite. We knew it had closed, and, in raising 4 daughters, we hadn't stayed in the Loop in many years. We didn't know exactly where the Bismark had been. A couple of weeks after our stay at the Allegro, we had occasion to visit their website and noticed a hotel timeline. The Allegro was the Bismark reborn! My wife and I were shocked that we had not recognized it. Among the things that had changed, the theater had been closed 30 years ago, and the marquee lights give the street a very different feel. Chalk the rest up to the difference between and aging hotel in its last years and a Kimpton Hotel in 2011 and you have the rest of the story.

Reviews.Title: “The entire experience at the Hotel Allegro in Chicago is exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Beth2380
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel. It was remodeled from my last stay here, and is even better than I remember. The hotel lobby is a lovely, comfortable spot. It's cozy and friendly. The beautiful decor is matched by the fabulous customer service. Each hotel guest gets personal attention. I am a Kimpton In Touch member. They present me with a small gift each visit. Just a nice personal touch. Each evening they have a wine reception in the lobby... which is filled with warmth by the lovely fireplace (candles, not burning wood!). I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere but the Hotel Allegro in downtown Chicago when business brings me to this city.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous room, great service, funky decor”
Reviews.Author: LMS23
Reviews.Content: First time at the Allegro. Join their rewards program before arriving and get free wireless and other perks. They left me a welcoming bottle of wine and water plus honor bar credit. Suite was huge and nicely appointed. Room was incredibly quiet. Staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Location was good for the business I was doing. Great fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Walked in wearing blue jeans and was treated like a rock star”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity2day
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, our stay at Hotel Allegro was first-class! We stayed there for our anniversary with plans to attend a play at the conveniently located Cadillac Palace Theatre next door. We walked in wearing blue jeans and fleece, but were treated as though we were wearing Armani or D&G. Received a free upgrade to a King Suite, which was HUGE and absolutely beautiful, decorated in geometric/retro patterns. The bed was so comfortable, you could just sink right into it. A few hours after check-in, complimentary champagne and chocolates were sent up, which was a pleasant surprise. For dinner, we had been unable to secure reservations at a restaurant within walking distance, but after asking one of the staff members during cocktail hour for a recommendation, he suggested we speak to the concierge. The concierge was busy right then with another guest, so we found an empty seat on the other side of the room and enjoyed our drinks while waiting. The next thing we knew, the concierge actually crossed the room to approach us and discuss our potential dinner options. Yes, he came to us! He gave us some great ideas, and then got reservations for us at the restaurant we decided to try, Sullivan's Steakhouse (Phenomenal food, btw!). The only aspects of our stay that were less than first class were the restaurant (Chicago 312) and bar (Encore) that are attached to the hotel. They were okay, but nothing special. The hotel though is fabulous, amazing, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: ElkeGelke
Reviews.Content: I don't know when I have been as delighted with a hotel stay as I was with Hotel Allegro in Chicago. The colors, the fabrics, the furniture, the glass and mirrors, the wall art and window coverings, everything about the design appears to have been chosen to delight and surprise the guest. This is a hotel that is as accessible as it is affordable. I am a business traveler and need a room that works so I can work in it. This one has excellent lighting, internet access, comfort and style. I am reminded, in staying there, of what I enjoy in European hotels... efficient, smart use of space. A closet only as big as you need it to be (although it could be bit snug for a family of big coats).

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: MajorVoid
Reviews.Content: Booked the stay through British Airways and got an excellent rate included in the price of my return trip. This is one of the better Chicago places I've stayed - staff are really friendly and helpful, and the decor is quirky but fun. It's an older style hotel - right next to City Hall and it used to be the Bismarck apparently - the home of Chicago's smoke filled rooms! no longer, just an all round good place to hang out. Great Aveda toiletries in the bathroom, comfy bed, loads of nice touches and details including a very well stocked minibar in the room; the wine hour is a nice touch and there's free wifi throughout the hotel if you sign up to their guest program. Overall a very good choice if you can get a decent rate - I'll certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Fresh Take”
Reviews.Author: kmachonis
Reviews.Content: The furnishings and decor had me immediately..... So, fun and hip - I found myself taking pictures with my iPhone on the curvy blue velvet sofa and the stand-out green sofa! It was all so refined, yet very warm and inviting. I was pleasantly surprised to discover they are a pet-friendly hotel. too! Who knew? The staff was superb - from the bellman to front desk to waiters in restaurant! Breakfast at '312' was first class. The gym was so clean and accessible and we loved the exercise hula hoops! Special touch, the fully stocked mini bar with 'cool' water bottles. Lovely Aveda products in the bath. Location perfect. Amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: jiemeigeng
Reviews.Content: The staff at Kimpton was very accomodating and attentive to my every need. I had actually reserved a room at the Westin on Michigan Avenue, and given flight delays was checking in to the Westin around midnight. The front desk representative did not excuse herself when she was helping me to aid another customer, and actually checked me into a dirty room. There were used towels and leftover food everywhere. When I called the front desk, she did not appear to be very apologetic, and did not offer me any real compensation in terms of a room upgrade, etc. After going to my second room, I noticed that the air was incredibly smoky and I had requested a smoke free room. Devastated and overly annoyed, I checked out and went to the Allegro. The front desk representative not only gave me my company rate despite the untimeliness of my checkin, but apologized for the lack of a king room. The space at the Kimpton is not as vast as the Westin, but the decor and the ambience is very chic. The fitness room esp. is very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: inezsson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Allegro far surpassed my expectations. The staff was extremely professional and very nice. The two restaurants/lounges in the hotel , 312 and Encore, are top quality. The food was exceptional and reasonably priced for Chicago. One waiter at the 312 named Luis was super. He absolutely made the experience a joy. The room was cozy and the bed was great. The hotel common areas are beautiful. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Allegro”
Reviews.Author: Gaelicmom3
Reviews.Content: My son lives in Chicago so we travel there often and I usually stick with my two favorite brands of hotels, while still trying new places to stay. This visit was to see Les Mis at the Cadillac Palace Theater for my birthday in February. My husband is in a leg cast and on crutches from surgery so I was very concerned with location as we did not want to have to walk far nor constantly grab a cab for the 5 of us. I was looking at Goggle maps at the theater and noticed the Allegro right next door. Perfect!! I joined their "In Touch" program and starting researching the reviews, etc. I called the hotel directly with questions which were answered quickly by a very friendly young lady who then switched me to the reservations desk. That staff person also was wonderful and helped me with my concerns with the room location, etc. I was thrilled with my rate, etc. A few days later I learned that my son would be able to stay with us so I booked another room and again had great satisfaction with the staff member that helped me. Before our trip I got an email that allowed me to request an upgraded room for a lower amount if one was available. It was. Everything was wonderful with our rooms except the bathroom has very little counter space and we had to run to Dunkin Donuts to get a cup of afternoon coffee. Before the play, we attended the "wine social hour" and enjoyed a glass of wine while sitting in the cozy lounge. We had intended to eat at Encore but the restaurant is closed on Sunday. I do not remember seeing that information anywhere on the website. But my husband and sons enjoyed watching the super bowl in the lobby. After the play we ordered pizza and had a great evening. We enjoyed great coffee in the lobby the following morning before checkout and my son was able to relax a few hours before heading to work since he was already downtown for Monday morning. I know being there on a Sunday to Monday it may have been less crowded but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Allegro and the location was fabulous. We are now fans of Kimpton Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a VIP guest”
Reviews.Author: jod21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary here and the staff treated us wonderfully! Our room was upgraded and they sent us up a bottle of champagne and strawberries. We had a wonderful dinner at 312 which was right in the hotel and never had to weather the cold. The meal was delicious and had several organic dishes, which we loved. We saw Les Miserables right next door, and it was so nice not to have to hail a cab in the cold with all the other people. We just had a drink in the lounge and then right up to our room. It was a last minute stay and it couldn't have been any nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: tjaus
Reviews.Content: Every time we come to Chicago from Australia we stay at the Allegro. Great location, great rooms and the service is first class. I highly recommend this place, you wont be dissapointed.. Well done and im sure we will back next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: Reblecka
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for work, staying at the Monaco and a good friend was also in town at the same time. We had dinner and drinks and then I took a cab back to the Allegro. I stupidly left my cell phone AND wallet in the cab and realized this as soon as I got into the hotel elevator. The front desk person (wish I could remember his name) at the hotel was super helpful. He did everything he could do...had the security tape checked to see if it was possible to discern the cab info. (no such luck), called the police station to figure out when they were open and what I would need to do so that I'd be able to get on a plane without my ID, and he had all the hotel staff down by the front door on alert to ask cab drivers about my lost phone and wallet. He was very helpful and calming. In the end my friend called my cell phone which was answered by the VERY good Samaritan who had gotten into the cab after me. I also used the cell phone of one of the guys at the door to call the good Samaritan, which was helpful. Good Samaritan came to the Allegro and I had my phone and ID back within an hour of losing them!!! Had room service the next morning, which was delicious, and a great meeting the next day in the conference rooms.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay in the Theater District”
Reviews.Author: pennylsu
Reviews.Content: A warm, cozy room, the only drawback being the small bathroom with little shelf space or hanging room (but stlll clean and well appointed). Up-to-date thoughtful furnishings. Staff friendly and helpful; enjoyed the hot cider/chocolate/wine in the afternoon reception and the coffee in the lobby in the morning. Concierge very helpful. Though located next to the el, our room was quiet. Convenient to the theater district. We came for the Chicago Lyric Opera, and though there is a hotel that's closer to that, it's still only a four-block walk (which we did in 20 degrees) from the Allegro. Drawbacks: the small bathroom; room service and restaurants very expensive. We are Louisianians and like our coffee and ordered an expensive pot of coffee before we realized it was free in the lobby!; in-room snack/drink tray expensive. Plusses: good location, reasonable price, clean, comfortable; friendly staff, plenty of good eateries close by. We'd gladly stay here again. Hint: join the Kimpton In-touch program; this gets you free in-room wifi, a free newspaper, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A warm and friendly home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DenverJack
Reviews.Content: Great, friendly service. Comfortable room. Excellent location, right in the Loop. Great restaurants, theaters clos by. Do use the concierge for directions and tips. He really knows Chicago. Take the CTA Orange line in from Midway Airport to the Washington Street station, just a block from the Allegro. No need for a car.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anneck11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Hotel Allegro in Chicago for a fun overnight trip. As always, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was comfortable and clean, the amenities exceptional and the staff friendly and helpful. We had breakfast at 312 and it was delicious. We have stayed here in the past and always have a great time. I always feel very welcome when I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Style Hotel at Affordable Rate”
Reviews.Author: mothlady
Reviews.Content: Very stylish yet affordable hotel in downtown Chicago. Exceptional service, range of restaurants and welcoming staff. And pet friendly. Will definatley return.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay!”
Reviews.Author: mbuck220
Reviews.Content: First of all, after having stayed at dozens of hotels in downtown Chicago...this is one hotel I will come back to again and again. My wife and I spent only one night at this hotel, but it was incredible. We were in a King Size suite. Beautiful rooms, great 2 person whirlpool tub, incredible decor and very helpful staff. Upon our arrival on a very cold January, we entered the lobby which had a hot chocolate bar. Very tasty. At 5:00 pm this bar went from hot chocolate to an adult wine bar and appetizers. The restaurant 312 can be entered directly from the hotel's lobby and Cadillac Palace Theatre is 10 steps from the hotel. If you are looking for a great hotel, show and dinner and not wanting to jump from cab to cab, this is the place to stay. We will stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Allegro Rocks Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KShaev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allegro on New Years Eve and all I can say is "are you kidding me"? It was the best value of any hotel I have ever stayed at in Chi-town. And it was New Year's Eve, so you would expect it was maybe more expensive than the usual rates, I don't think it could have been. It was around $150 per night, but that included the free wine hour (which by the way includes some tasty snacks). Since it was NYE, they even had sparkling wine. There is a $10 credit on the mini bar in your room (you may have to sign up for the preferred guest club for that, not sure, but do it because its free to join). The hotel itself is an older hotel that they completely re-did recently. It has that great old hotel charm, stunning staircase, wood paneld walls, great doors and mouldings from the old days paired with a funky modern new look in paint, furniture and wallpaper. All I can say is if you are a young hip city person (or a 40 year old person who wishes you were a young hip city person such as myself) this is THE BEST PLACE! I will stay there again, after I try out all the Kimpton's in Chi town, which is totally my plan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: rlvcjr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Allegro is a great place to stay. It is conveniently in walking distance to all the theaters, Marshal Fields (Macy's) & Millennium Park . It's close to the L and has valet parking. It was my first stay at a Kimpton Hotel and I was impressed. They are very pet friendly. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: prycehudson
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I realized one person's good was another person's poor. I chose to give it a try and with the best overnight rate with valet - it was a steal for Chicago. It was what I have come to expect from a Kimpton property. The bed was comfortable (we were on a high floor) and the staff was excellent. Ordered room service the first night and the food was fine. I've had better but I wasn't staying in a hotel that I expected a high quality meal. Things you should know: they allow pets; have thin walls, don't have a vending machine, ice machines are on even floors, and yes, the rooms are small and the closets are tiny. If you order a queen, you are going to get the most space in a room (they run about 220 sq. ft.) for your money and don't even touch the mini bar unless you have unlimited funds (they give you a key to lock it, especially necessary if you have kids). Oh - their coffee (in the lobby every morning) was not the best which was truly a disappointment. I chose to wait it out and head to Metropolis (on Granville). It was pleasant enough and even though it was remodeled/renovated - remember it is still an old building in the heart of the city and very near the 'L' - so yes, you will hear some rumblings. It didnt' bother me personally, but I could see where it would irritate others. On the plus side - great staff, great rates, Aveno products, near to everything imaginable, walk to stores, theater, restaurants, museums, parks, and near to the 'L' (a plus for me). Two restaurants in house - complimentary coffee and tea in the a.m., hot chocolate in the afternoon and wine at early evening. Do yourself a favor and sign up with the Kimpton and you will even get wi-fi for free. A definite stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was prefect!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingfamily9799
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on a friends recommendation. It was literally next door to the theatre we saw a play at, around the corner from the Kringle village and just a short walk to Macy's. Even with cold weather this one was in the perfect spot. The hotel has snazzy drinks in the lobby at all hours, hot chocolate in afternoon, tea in AM, wine hour, etc. Although we did not bring our dog, there were several there and they even put dog dishes of water in the lobby. We thought the hotel was very chic, very quiet and very cute! We would stay again if we stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Shoppingfoodie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and wish it could have been longer. We have not been to the Allegro in a few years. We're all a bit older now, kids are teenagers, but we all felt the sameway that this visit was better than ever. The hotel is always beautifully decorated and is especially nice this time of year as it is decorated for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnaichele
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with six other couples stayed here for a night in December...we all were very pleased with this hotel. The staff were very polite and helpful...the rooms were nice as well. We stayed in a King Premier with was quite roomy. I only have two complaints...the elevators were painfully slow...if you are in a hurry...you should take the stairs. Second...since the hotel is located in the theater district...getting a taxi is almost impossible if a show is letting out. Outside of those two things...everything else was perfect...the wine reception is also a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Just to get away”
Reviews.Author: kd55wood
Reviews.Content: My husband & I love to visit Chicago whenever we can. We found the Allegro easy to drive to from the interstate. The room was on the small side but lovely and accommodating. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. It is a splendid location for shopping, seeing a play, or visiting a museum. The wine happy hour is delightful. It is a nice way to meet and greet some of the other guests. We ate breakfast at the 312 restaurant. The food & service were excellent. We simply had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Boutique Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Allegro Chicago one night recently for business and pleasure. The lobby which is actually a floor up from the street is very warm and elegant. The front desk staff was friendly and courteous. The King Premiere room was actually large. The bathroom with the toilet, however, was one of the tiniest hotel bathrooms I had ever seen. The room strangely had another bathroom with a large tub and shower without a toilet on the other side of the room that was much larger. The bed easily fit my 6'2" frame and was comfortable. Not a bad view out the two large windows. There was a nice flat screen and an Ipod alarm clock. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “There was room at this Inn”
Reviews.Author: rjcaldwell
Reviews.Content: After being sent here from the Best Western River North after they overbooked, I arrived here just shy of midnight. The lady at the front desk was very pleasant and offered me a free continental breakfast. My room was on the top floor, was clean with no bedbugs found, but was small. I was unable to adjust the temperature (thermostat broken?) but slept very well in the comfy bed. Alarm did not go off for some reason (a tad complicated to set correctly when zonked from travelling/meetings), so had to shoot down for breakfast. Restaurant was very nice with good staff and very tasty and quick. Coffee service in lobby was handy. Found the art deco a little off-putting personally, but "favorite movie" name tags and atmosphere were kinda fun given this is the theatre district and a great locale. I've stayed here before and would again.

Reviews.Title: “For a Kimpton Hotel, It Was Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: David49b
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many, many Kimpton Hotels and know their 'concept' well. I've always been pleased. That said, this particular hotel, The Allegro, just misses on so many levels. I don't know why or how to explain it exactly, but the stylishness, coziness, warmth, staff friendliness and 'bonhomie' of other Kimpton Hotels is sadly lacking here. Maybe it's the cavernous, cold lobby itself or the fact that you have to take an elevator or stairs from street level to the lobby? Maybe it's the cheesy way the lobby is decorated with a mish-mash of furniture, styles, colors and ugly carpeting. Frankly, it's depressing. Its dark brown color scheme is off-putting. And, now that the tone of the hotel is set, one gets to the room floors and finds a more cheerful color scheme (green,) but once again, a somewhat dowdy hallway leading to the rooms. There's no doubt that the Allegro is an old, old hotel, that was never completely renovated and it shows. The rooms were redone, but not the walls or ceilings of the hallways. While the rooms are large for an urban hotel, once again, like the lobby, they're cold and austere. Ours had 1960s style silver wallpaper with a pattern of huge rounded squares and absolutely no art work on the walls, flimsy cotton roman type shades and oversized, unattractive black cabinets for the TV, mini-bar, bedside consoles and desk. While the bathroom had new fixtures and a nice Speakman shower head, it was tiny. In fact, the sink was one of those tiny little ones that you occasionally see in miniscule powder rooms! Only one person could fit into the bathroom at anytime... So, would I recommend the Allegro? No. Only if you got an incredible 'deal' on a room there, would I recommend it. Otherwise, stay elsewhere until Kimpton does a top-down renovation and re-decoration, which it sorely needs.

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxious Music Playing Constantly”
Reviews.Author: Murkey1960
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough, but they have this LOUD, obnoxious music playing nonstop throughout the lobby. This is the second Klimpton Hotel I've stayed at this year and it was the same loud music playing at both. In fact, at the NYC hotel I stayed at this summer, the music in the lobby was so loud, I couldn't hear the clerk when checking in. I travel often for my work and all I want when checking in is something soothing and not too loud, but then perhaps I'm not the clientele you're after.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but rooms are for Lilliputians”
Reviews.Author: MadTownTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good choice for a single traveler in Chicago, but the rooms are tiny. Sure, hotel rooms in major cities often resemble telephone booths, but the bathroom in this place makes a telephone booth look positively roomy. Staff were excellent. Very friendly and helpful in all respects. Bellmen were wonderful in giving directions and recommendations. The bar next door was nice, with decent bar food and great servers. The bed was as tiny as well. I am 6'1" and my feet hung off the end. Sheets were not fitted and did not stay on. Bed was not particularly comfortable, and the walls were thin enough to hear the TV in the next room. Overall, a decent place to stay, but not without its faults.

Reviews.Title: “A fun, hip, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: EAKTravels
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for one night on business, and since it was a Sunday and that meant I was away from home on a weekend, decided to treat myself to a night at a Kimpton. The front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming, and checked me in very quickly. My room was small but beautifully decorated, with a comfortable bed and great TV. Room service brought up dinner quickly and was very friendly as well. The food could have been better but was by no means bad. I really like Kimpton hotels -- they are modern, cool, and unique without sacrificing comfort or good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “This is the location for Chicago's Theater Visitors”
Reviews.Author: SEE1981
Reviews.Content: Good location for theater, Art Institute, Mass transit. This is a small older building that has been freshened up with a charming, retro style, but take note everything is small,especially the bathrooms. The service is excellent. The prices are high for a 3 to 4 star category, but it is chicago. Also the hotel staff took rapid and satisfactory care of an Expedia booking mistake. Overall we had a lovely weekly in the beautiful fall weather

Reviews.Title: “Service Makes It Worth It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bauerstl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Allegro for 1 night before running the Chicago Marathon. Although a suggested hotel for the race, they didn't take their status with the race for granted. Very service oriented hotel. Upon arrival they provided us with information specific to the race (closest location to catch the shuttle to get race packets etc). Also, morning of the race they had fresh fruit, hot water (for oatmeal we'd brought...a pre-race must) and bottles of water available. Rooms were very small but clean and in good shape. Only problem I could foresee is the walls seem to be a bit thin. Although, not a problem for us since many of our neighbors were also runners (everyone went to bed early and were up early)...could see this being a problem if you had a noisy neighbor coming back late. Although pricey...they have great customer service so the extra cost was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Allegro- Great location”
Reviews.Author: carlabella16
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Allegro was short- only 3 days but it was very nice. I attended a conference right at the hotel also so I'll review both the hotel as a place to stay and as a conference center. My room was very clean, contemporary and neat. The hotel itself has been renovated but the building is old so the rooms are very small. The lobby is really nicely decorated and they serve wine and appetizers in the evening for all guests- a great bonus. If you join the Kimpton club you can get internet access for free. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. One of the elevators was broken so there were only 2 operating for all of the floors. I waited over 20 minutes with my luggage to to get the elevator to catch my plane. If I was traveling with lighter luggage I would have taken the stairs. I don't suspect this is a common problem so hopefully no one else will have to wait as long as I did. The location of the hotel is perfect- it's right across from the train line and only a few blocks from great shopping and restaurants. While there, I took a quick train ride to US Cellular Field for a Whitesox game. Overall, I had a nice stay. The conference room was large and modern. The food for lunch was exceptional!! There were many options and each thing I had was better than the last. They had an excellent selection of teas, coffees and juice. The logistics of the room were also ideal. I would certainly attend another conference at this hotel- very nicely done!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sightsnsounds
Reviews.Content: Hotel Allegro is a great Kimpton hotel located in the theater district of Chicago and is next to the Palace Theater. The hotel is located about a block and a half to two blocks from the Washington/Wells train station. If you are flying to Chicago this station is a straight shot from Midway airport on the orange line which makes it very convenient and also affordable at just 2.25 per person. Travel time from Midway via the L train is approximately 30-40 minutes but it doesn't feel very long at all. Everyone we interacted with at the hotel from the bell staff, front desk staff, and restaurant staff were warm, friendly, and more than willing to answer any questions we have. I've come to expect great service from Kimpton hotels and this one did not disappoint. We had a double double room that faced the train station. While the room was not all that large it did not feel cramped at all. You could hear the train going by but it was not distracting and did not effect us when we slept - in fact, I quite enjoyed knowing the train was right outside our window. The decor was modern, geometric, and a bit more sparse compared to other Kimpton's I've stayed at. The beds were incredibly comfortable and both my mom and I slept great during our 2 night stay here. The bathroom was a bit smaller than other properties I've stayed at; however, it is nicely decorated and served it's purpose. We ate at the restaurant - 312 - for breakfast. While expensive (4.00 just for a glass of orange juice) the food was good - I had the french toast with bananas and it was delicious. I would have made a few different choices if I had it to over again but considering we were on a schedule our first full day in the city this option worked well for us. The servers were attentive though not overly friendly. Encore - the liquid lounge just off the ground level near the elevators was great. We enjoyed a couple drinks and split a margherita pizza our first night in town - all of which was very good. The staff was very friendly, engaged us in conversation on more than one occasion, and were very attentive while still allowing us a chance to relax, enjoy the atmosphere, and chat. Hotel Allegro, like other Kimpton properties, hosts a complimentary evening wine hour and has coffee/tea set up in mornings in the lobby. We attended one of the wine hours and enjoyed the coffee every morning. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Allegro to anyone traveling to Chicago. The location to the train, the theater district, and other great sites (we walked from the Sears/Willis tower back to the hotel) can not be beat.
