Not to mention the staff was very friendly and always makes you feel welcome. I would have rated this hotel a 5 but due to my lack of interest in the decor, smallish bathroom, and high prices in 312 I have rated it a 4; however, even these items were not, and would not be, deal breakers.

Reviews.Title: “Great happy hour and vibe at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sylvialee
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor and funky vibe of this place. it was also centrally located to lots of attractions and easily walked to the el train. The rooms are teeny but is to be expected as this hotel is a renovated heritage hotel. The bar downstairs was a bit grungier than the photos show on their site. Also not to be missed is their nightly happy hour. Lots of wine is poured every night. Lots of lounge seating on which to enjoy the people watching and the wine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ianmon
Reviews.Content: The location was great-right in the loop-near a bunch of el lines. I wish it was a little further east-but it is really close to the river and the beautiful river walk. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was helpful, even moving us when we needed a room with a full sized closet. The rooms were fine, small, but comfortable. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice but small, beds extremely comfy!”
Reviews.Author: ajo123
Reviews.Content: Nice location downtown , short walk to Macy's, Millenium Park. Had stayed off Magnificent Mile last time- this was a change.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: My mom and I traveled to Chicago for a mini-vacation, and we were pleased with the Allegro. My mother had stayed there before and enjoyed it, so we stayed there during a Labor Day weekend trip. I'd highly recommend it. It's in the heart of the theater district, and we were able to walk to plays and restaurants. It's a few blocks from shopping (Filene's Basement, Miracle Mile), the Art Institute, and Millennium Park. It was easy to catch a cab to Lincoln Park for another play and restaurants. (If you haven't seen "Million Dollar Quartet," go, and eat at Lou Malnoti's pizza across the street.) There are upscale restaurants near the theater, but there's also a Corner Bakery (very good) and a McDonald's if you don't want to spend a lot. The hotel itself is beautiful, very art deco. The rooms are spacious, the staff is friendly and will go out of their way to help you. There's lemonade and tea in the afternoon, a nice touch. The hotel bills itself as pet-friendly, and it is. There are bowls of water outside for the dogs, and the staff will help you find nearby parks and places to play with your dog. The hotel is near El stops, but it's easy to catch a cab if you want to explore. If you want a vacation that involves great theater and museums and excellent food, Chicago is a good place to go, and the Allegro is a good play to stay to see it all.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: jbillin
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel because it was very close to a business meeting we had to attend early in the morning. Our reservations were made last-minute, and it was a good thing I brought the printed confirmation because the hotel had no records of the 3 rooms we had reserved. I was the first of our party to check in, and had less than 1/2 hour to make it to another meeting 5 blocks away. Although the two ladies at the front desk couldn't find the reservation, they did give me a room and promised to contact the travel agent to clear up the confusion. It appears that the problem was resolved because the other two travelers had no problems when they checked in a few hours later. The rooms are small, and we (I was with my husband) were given a room with one full-size bed. The bathroom was tiny and the floor had water spots - at least I hope it was water given the close proximately to the toilet (the spots were very easy to see on the black tile). Otherwise, it was clean and nicely maintained. It did have an unusual square sink that was set slighty above the countertop, which was an unexpected change from the normal "hotel" bathroom sink. The stopper in the sink was closed and refused to open without being pried up. There was no lever to lift it and if it was the "pop-up" type (where you push down and it pops up), the pop-up function had ceased to work. Luckily I figured that out before I brushed my teeth and or I would have had to pry it up through a sink full of water and spit. After my meeting, I was dying of hunger and wanted to order some food, but found that we were missing the book with the room service menu. It was quickly delivered after a call to the front desk. Room service was right on time and the food was above average. We had to make a second call to the front desk because the TV refused to work. A maintenance man appeared shortly thereafter and was able to fix the problem. The bed was uncomfortable with a hump in the middle, which caused me to roll towards the edge of the bed all night. I definitely did not have a good nightâ€™s sleep. However, the other travelers in our group did not have an issue with their bed, so it may have been just my bed. Overall, I have stayed in far worse hotels. It was clean and was not over-priced. It would have been nicer not to have the three issues (no record of the reservation, no room service menu, TV not working), but all of the staff members we dealt with were courteous and the problems were quickly resolved. The biggest negative was the uncomfortable bed, and since I was the only one with that problem, it appears that not all beds in this hotel were created equally.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ResortManager36
Reviews.Content: Always a great place to stay. The team is on top of it and having fun. One of the valet/bellman (younger guy, sorry can't remember his name) is always personable, but only just stands out compared to the rest of the staff on the property as they are all great. I have recommended to many colleagues and friends...all have enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but forget about the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Afribee
Reviews.Content: We stood in the Hotel Allegro for two nights. Its appearance is modern and a little bit 'brittle', but clean and with a friendly service. The hotel is perfectly fine located just in the city center - I went running in the Millenium / Grant Park just a few blocks away. I do not reccomend the continental breakfast at the Allegro - it costs 16$ and really is a joke. The service is very inattentive , and you need to wait endlessly until your bagel is coming out of the toaster (it is only one toaster for two bagels for all the guests - that does not work at all!). Anyway, they serve fresh fruit :-).

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: esud8
Reviews.Content: I must say that it was a pleasant stay, and even though the room was small, i still think that it was worth the money, considering that Hotel Allegro was more like a boutique hotel. The bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. I was a little surprised that they didn't provide any coffee maker in the room, but after I asked if they have one or not, they gladly sent someone to bring the coffee maker to my room, together with all the coffee, tea, sugar, and milk. The service was fast and the staffs were all friendly. They have a happy hour at 5-6 pm, and they serve coffee and tea in the morning until 10 am too. The parking, just like any other hotel parking in this area in Chicago was pricey, but you can easily find a cheaper one, one block away from the hotel. I parked my car for $10 per day in another building - a good deal. Location was also a good one too! Close to Millenium Park and shopping stores at State St. It was a good stay! Thanks Hotel Allegro

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: torchonrouge
Reviews.Content: my partner booked it through his firm and gushed about a "chic, luxurious hotel". i had focused on sth else but had to give in. located NE in the loop it has good cta acess and walking distance to chicago river. the room was quite small and over the year's renovations were obvious (see picture1). there was a spot on the white bathroom door of some brownish liquid (see picture2) which EVERY roomservice should have been able to see and eliminate! room's decor was exaggeratedly modern including some vintage mirror covered desk and night stand. although we switched off the A/C at night there was still a displeasing sound of ventilation. staff was kind and helpful at any time. complementary wine tasting hour was great though we tried it only once.

Reviews.Title: “Great job”
Reviews.Author: mikeswt
Reviews.Content: Rooms aren't huge, but comfortable & clean. Wireless worked OK. 312 bar was good. Rooms are modern. Good hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkTX13
Reviews.Content: Quite satisfactory hotel; I don't have alot to compare it to, this being the first time in a dowtown Chicago hotel, but it was well located to be able to get to the trains, the river, and Grant Park, which was a little less than a mile for us, and our main destination for Lollapalooza. Room was fairly small, but as I've read that's to be expected in the area. Room/hotel was clean and neat, and the free wine hour seems nice (although in our 6 days there we never were able to take advantage!) Everyone was very friendly, and I think every employee we saw during the entire stay gave us a smile and greeting.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid hotel for the money, nice option in place of Palmer House.”
Reviews.Author: Explorehappily
Reviews.Content: In the Loop, near to theaters including Ford Center for the Performing Arts and Palace, and close enough to walk to downtown shopping and Millenium Park. Rooms are not huge by any means but adequate. Very clean, comfortable beds and clean, modern bathrooms. Excellent soundproofing, no street noise could be heard at all. Atrium at the Mall shops right across the street, Corner Bakery Cafe within a block, many other eateries and pharmacies within two blocks. Valet staff attentive and polite. 24 hour onsite fitness center was very popular. Bring your laptop; use of business center involves a fee. Pet friendly hotel. This is a nice option at or a bit less than the cost of Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Employees Made a Great Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sfjam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline and I thought I was in for second rate service since I paid for the cheap seats. I joined the Kimpton Club online before flying in order to get the perks of a free newspaper delivered daily to my door, free wifi, and $10.00 minibar credit although I had my doubts about being eligible due to my discount price. I also went during Lollapalooza weekend although I was going to Lolla I was worried about late night partying at the hotel since is was being used by the Lolla promoters in the Lolla package deal and I knew ahead of time the hotel was sold out. I arrived on Thursday and was allowed to check in early. I asked for a room on an upper level away from the elevators and the ice machine. I never heard any noise in the hallway or from the surrounding rooms. I got the NY Times delivered to my door daily, free wifi and the minibar credit. The Allegro is 1 block from the blue line train station that comes directly from the airport for $2.25 or you can buy a multiday pass which can save lots of money if you plan on using public transport. The trains are clean and comfortable if you don't go on at rush hour which can be very crowded and hot. The room was a good size for two of us. It had a queen bed, a desk with a comfy chair, a minibar, a large flat screen and a couple of bedside tables. The carpets looked very clean and the bed and linens were clean and very comfortable. The ac was wonderful, with no bad odors. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. I have stayed in much smaller rooms in Europe and Manhattan so I wouldn't call the room uncomfortably small. The lobby was beautiful and had several large areas to sit and relax with complimentary lemon ice water, ice tea, lemonade, coffee and ice coffee. Alas, there is no coffee maker in the room, but I didn't find it to be a hardship to go to the lobby for some of delicious coffee that was brewed up for the guests. On my first morning I didn't realize that the coffee dissappeared at 10 am so one of the desk people went to the back and brought me a wonderful cup of coffee. The complimentary wine hour from 5 to 6 pm daily is a pleasant way to wind down the day. Wonderful little morsels are provided to snack on during the wine hour. We loved the location in the theatre district. We did go to a Billy Elliott matinee and loved it. HotTix, a discount ticket seller is at the corner of Randolph and Michigan and they said they do get discount Billy Elliott tickets on Tuesday and Wednesday. We paid full price for balcony and it was well worth the price. The little tea shop next door to the theatre, the Argo, has wonderful before theatre quiche and salad plates that are very affordable. Although we had Lolla tix we spent a lot of time away from the Grant Park site. We were able to tour around on foot from the Allegro very easily. Millenium Park is a straight walk down Randolph, Riverwalk just about the same amount of time, a little longer to Mag Mile. We did take the bus to Devon Road, the largest Indian/Pakistani settlement in the USA I was told. It was like leaving the USA. I recommend it for daytime only. One place I do not recommend is The Navy Pier. Go only if you have little children since there is a ferris wheel, but even then it is a travesty of McDonalds, a large and awful Bubba Gump restaurant, several large trinket stores and a couple of other artery clogging fast food places. While on the subject of food, we did eat one dinner at the 312 Restaurant that is conncted to the hotel and it was a wonderful meal. I had halibut baked with a very good sauce and and we had the calamari, scallop and shrimp fritte appetizer with spicy marinara sauce. The martinis and wine were also delicious and the service was excellent. We had another wonderful meal at Gage Restaurant on Michigan Ave. across from Millenium Park. It was a little pricey, but memorable food, service, ambience and location. Okay, back to the hotel. What made this hotel so great besides all of the above mentioned, was the level of service and attitudes of every employee we encountered. Everyone was more than pleasant and at the same time so professional and efficient. Thank you desk staff, I wish I knew your names. Thank you Cori and Fidel who took such good care of our bags. Thanks to the housekeepers and thanks to the concierge who provided us with lots of directions and maps. I found this friendly pleasant attitude across the board of almost everyone I encounterd in Chicago. I have never been in any large city like it. People went out of their way to help if I was lost, or needed any kind of direction or help. Allegro Hotel and Chicago you rock!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fab city”
Reviews.Author: en111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when on our honeymoon and the rooms were small but clean & sufficient. The bar was a little bit expensive but they did have a drink reception at 5pm every evening that was free for guests, which was nice! This hotel is in the theatre district and is about a 10 minute walk from the magnificent mile, when all the shops are and all where Millenium park is. It is about 20 minutes to Navy Pier. It is about 2 minutes from an 'El' station, which is the elevated railway round the city. Chicago is a fantastic city, with lots of good restaurants and touristy things to do. The architecture is very good, we went to the Hancock Tower as opposed to the more obvious Sears Tower, as the Hancock Tower is in the city centre and had better views.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was okay, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: jenre1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Allegro not to long ago and didn't really like it too much. The sheets looked dirty on arrival. The bathrooms are very very small, so don't expect to take any time in them. Even with just two people in the room, it was hard to get around because the room is so small. Also, the parking is way over priced. Make sure you have plans to park somewhere else, even the garages near by were like 36 bucks a day. The hotel is packed with people, so the elevator rides are long. The location is great, it's located in the middle of everything which was useful. The Staff did do a nice favor for me and brought wine to my room to surprise my boyfriend. Overall, I would probably not stay there again, but it's fine if your just staying a night or two, anything more than that, I would recommend somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in beautiful older building”
Reviews.Author: Statstjenestemannen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro for two nights, after spending one night at their partner hotel, the Palomar - the Palomar was fully booked for the two additional nights we wanted in Chicago. The Allegro is a grand, old building, with many beautiful architectual details. Especially the glass letter-box, running through all the floors by the elevators, is a nice detail, and it is good that such details are preserved. The lobby area is also beautiful and grand. The rooms are spacius, maybe a little bit under-furnished, I missed a sofa or a little table other than the oligatory desk. The bathrooms are very small, almost like closets. I guess this is difficult to change, as the building is old... The staff is friendly and service minded. There is also a good valet-service, if you bring your car. All in all, it's a good hotel; i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: familyofsix094
Reviews.Content: I just finished five nights at the Allegro in Chicago. The rate was very good and the Hotel was a 4 star property. The staff was incredible as was the location I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Thal
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Allegro is fantastic. They were caring, solicitous, and went above and beyond in helping me. I arrived flustered, tired, and slightly disoriented. (I was fine-just a rough flight and trip from O'Hare.) The front desk clerk immediately gave me iced water and offered to call a doctor. She followed up and sent someone up to make sure I was settled into my room. All the staff was very friendly and unstuffy. The rooms were quirky but interesting. Sort of an op illusion theme to disguise irregularities in the old structure. The bathrooms are teeny, but very clean. The beds are comfy and there is a good sized desk. Internet was free-perhaps because I signed up for the Klimpton's on-line club? The wine hour looked nice, and the piano is a nice touch. The only thing I can find fault with is that the walls are paper thin. I could hear normal conversations in the next room. The noise from the hallways was as bad. All in all, the wonderful staff, cleanliness, and ambiance more than made up for the occasional free entertainment from my neighbors. I have stayed in several hotels in Chi-town-the staff at the Allegro is unparallelled.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not amazing, but good rate”
Reviews.Author: Schmeath
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for a weekend getaway to visit friends. The hotel was prettily decorated and very modern, but the rooms were small and the bathroom minute. I did find some gunk in our tub upon showering, which was unfortunate and the walls are a bit thin (we could hear a dog barking EVERY time we left our room) but other than that our stay was fine. For the high costs found in Chicago, we did get a deal and the location was good for us. The beds were very comfortable and as I am a light sleeper myself, I was pleasantly surprised not to even notice the train that went by every few minutes. Maybe it was the air running that muted it, but we really did not hear anything. My biggest complaint would be that there was no option for in-room check-out. You had to wait forever for an empty elevator and stand in line in the lobby as everyone is checking out at the same time which made things more then a little crowded and hectic. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvplaya62
Reviews.Content: I found Allegro to be a nice hotel. Traveled to Chicago for business and the location was fantastic. In walking distance to everywhere I needed to go downtown. The hotel is very modern and they have a 5 O'Clock Happy Hour where they serve complimentary wine and hors d'oeuvres. The rooms were a bit small. They had a very nice flat screen TV and a desk you can work from. Chicago's a big city so I wasn't looking for the room to be huge. I traveled solo, so there was no problem. I believe the room rate was 239.00 a night. The one small problem I had was that internet access was not free. I'd rather them charge 249 and have it be "complimentary". I wasn't in my room very often, so it was not a big deal. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kevinm77
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and usually book a hotel last minute, and I was pleasantly surprised on the price of the room. GREAT value. Two restaurants and bars attached to the hotel, both had nice decor and good menus. The lobby was modern and classy. The rooms were clean, new looking, and had large TV's. I would stay there again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mom2BAH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Chicago for rest and relaxation for 4 days and 3 nights over the 4th of July. I had never stayed at the Allegro but was very pleasantly surprised. I had read review on Trip Advisor and many had warned about the small rooms but I decided to try the hotel anyway. Yes, the room was small. Probably the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in...and the bath was small also, however, we did not come to Chicago to spend all our time in our hotel room. If there was a drawback to our stay, the size of the rooms would be the only thing worth mentioning. But again, we didn't spend much time in the room. Pros: ALL staff was MORE than accomodating and more than friendly. The decor....which I would call funky/trendy/mod was very cool and different. I typically like to stay in a hotel which offers a breakfast, but I didn't seem to mind that the Allegro didn't. They did have coffee and tea each morning in the lobby and tea and lemonade in the afternoon. I loved the tea with fresh mint! If you are a wine drinker (I'm not), they offered complimentary wine around 5 p.m. I saw where someone complained about the expensive parking. ALL parking is expensive in Chicago.... We did not park at the hotel...we had done some research online and found a garage a couple blocks away that was cheaper. Hotel and room were CLEAN!!!! Plush linens, plush bed. I can put up with a lot of things but I cannot stand a hotel room that isn't clean....and our room was pristine! The concierge was more than helpful with dining ideas and did an amazing job of recommending outstanding restaurants. I called her multiple times when I was out and about asking questions and she never seemed to mind even when I called her 3x in a 10 minute window. I loved the Aveda products and at one point needed more shampoo and conditioner. I called the front desk and I had more than I had asked for w/n minutes. I also had a problem with my remote (I thought it needed new batteries) and maintenance was very quick to bring me another one. However, when I opened the door to get the other remote, he saw that I had a bottle of water in front of the "eye" on the t.v. and suggested that might be the problem. It was...I felt like an idiot and gave him the remote that he'd just brought me back to him. Hotel was very close to State street shopping and Millenium and Grant parks...as well as the lake. Free wi-fi in room (if you join the Kimpton club online...which is free). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Allegro and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not without problems but very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: alex1012hearts
Reviews.Content: Pros Very cute hotel, nice interior, very stylish front desk and lounge area. Great location downtown, you are within walking distance of many bars and restaurants. If you don't feel like walking there are always plenty of cabs. Clean. Great customer service. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Very good. Cons The walls are paper thin. Unfortunately for us the couple next door decided to "enjoy themselves" for quite an extensive period of time, so I would not recommend coming here with your kids. Very awkward. This hotel does not have many rooms with 2 beds so I think it is better suited for couples. The parking is extremely expensive. We had somewhat of a disappointing experience with the concierge who sent us on a wild goose chase to find a dueling piano bar, which turned out to be some retro bar full of old people and no piano in sight. We decided to then go to a sports bar also recommended by the concierge to watch the fight. The bar was quite a bit out of the way and did not have the fight on. The front desk was very understanding and gracious enough to credit our cab fare. Unfortunately we were only in Chicago for 2 nights and felt that this one was a bit of a waste. Tips: They have free coffee in the lounge in the morning. Bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Walking Distance to Attractions In the Loop”
Reviews.Author: amber11122
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this stylish hotel. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. We also enjoyed the daily happy hour! The hotel was within walking distance to almost everything that we did and was very close to the train station. The only downside is that the walls are very thin- one night we were able to hear the conversations of the people in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights on a business trip to Chicago. Have tried many different hotels in Chicago and generally have not been impressed except with the super-luxury places, which I don't use when I'm on business. So I had pretty low expectations for the Allegro, especially since I was only paying $139/night. I was therefore very pleasantly surprised to find that the Allegro is really very nice! There were a couple of downers - on arrival, there was only one person on reception, which seems to double as concierge so despite the fact there were three of us waiting to check in, the receptionist had to deal with a guest that wanted to talk and talk about restaurant options in the area. Annoying and a bit selfish, if you ask me. At check-in they reminded me that I have a $10 mini-bar credit as a regular Kimpton client which was nice, because not all the hotels bother to tell you this. Room was very nice - in fact the decor throughout the hotel was pretty good - very fresh, not overwelmingly hip or anything. Bed comfortable, bathroom decent size. Another pleasant surprise was the restaurant - again, I don't generally have positive experiences of hotel restaurants but we were hungry and didn't want to go far. 312 was very nice - my colleague said it was probably the best bit of swordfish he'd ever had! Nothing else to report - checkout was straightforward and staff were generally helpful. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “JUST LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Spalljrfam
Reviews.Content: We took an impromptu trip for Father's Day weekend. I booked our room online through Kimpton.com. Still not sure what happened, but the staff was SO nice and accommodating! The desk clerk even upgraded us to a King Suite. The beds were VERY comfy and our rooms were clean. The location was super, with plenty of overnight parking in a very short walking distance, as well as the subway and a variety of places to eat! We were very pleased and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, stylish, great value hotel in excellent Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: NY_biz_traveler_10
Reviews.Content: I needed a cost efficient hotel for a brief stay in Chicago while attending a nearby conference. The Allegro was excellent on all counts: the price was astoundingly good, around $150, and it included contintental breakfast and a complimentary wine hour from 5 to 6. The bed was super comfortable, and the location of the hotel was terrific. The Kimpton design was spectacular, as always, and the people were very friendly and accommodating. Criticisms? Well, the downstairs eatery was surprisingly understaffed and the waitstaff overworked and indifferent to the needs of the patrons. This was frustrating, but not a reflection on the rest of the service of the hotel, which was superb. The hotel was fully booked when we were the, which may be a reflection of a local convention, but it also seems to be a repeat experience for many of the guests we spoke with during the unique complimentary wine hour. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and chic hotel - LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: chellebinlouisville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Allegro in Chicago for 3 nights (Sunday thru Wednesday) in June 2010. I was traveling for business with another colleague and the hotel room was $175/night (special rate for conference). I had a deluxe queen room on the 7th floor. We arrived at 8:30 PM and there was no line and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The room is small, but I didn't have a problem with it. I was in the room by myself, but the size of the room would have been perfect even for a couple. The room appeared to be recently renovated in a modern chic decor. The bathroom is small and would not be ideal for two people in the bathroom at the same time. However, I had no problem with it - it is just enough room. The bathroom was equipped with a makeup mirror (big plus) and Aveda bath products (great touch, by the way). The cleaning staff are not stingy with the Aveda products. They were restocked each day even if I had not finished the prior day's stock. Loved that! The bed was really, really comfortable and I slept like a baby - very quiet. An iPod/alarm clock was in the room. Wireless internet was free if you signed up on the Kimpton loyalty program (free). There was a big screen flat TV and a desk with chair also in the room. Mini-bar available if you requested a key. I'm a clean freak. Staying in hotels can sometimes be very stressful for me. This is possibly the cleanest hotel room I've ever seen. Liked best - cleanliness and Aveda bath products! Liked least - room service food (although I've never had good room service!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisalisa77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allegro last weekend with husband and friends. The hotel was very charming, trendy and the decor was beautiful, especially the lobby. Hotel had a wine & cheese reception in the lobby every evening which was a great touch after a day of shopping and sight seeing. Rooms were decorated very nicely, they were a bit small but what do you really need all that space for anyway? The beds were super comfy! Free Wireless internet too. Concierge was OUTSTANDING, super helpful and always a smile! The location was good, just a few blocks from the action, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here, the room was very clean and comfortable and the location is great. The Internet service worked well and the complimentary morning coffee was excellent. Yes, the building is old and the rooms are small. That's the way it is in Chicago. The walls are thin, but it didn't cause me any big problems. The only thing that was a little disappointing was that there was no dresser, not even a few drawers for clothes underneath the TV. I don't think I should have to fish my clothes out of my suitcase every day at a 4-star hotel. But very nice overall, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jalpotz
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights and 4 days here this past weekend, and we were really impressed. The hotel is old, rooms are small....but I loved the decoration. Staff members were extremely friendly and helpful. Immaculate snowy white linens, comfortable bed and a wonderfully accessible location. We walked to the theatre, and to restaurants. It brought to mind our stays at the Algonquin in Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, and surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: BG_STL
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference which was held in the hotel meeting area. Decor is a little "funky" for my tastes, but the basics were handled very well. Reception, room service and door staff were all pleasant andThe room was sparse, but very comfortable. Bathroom was generous in size, and well stocked with necessary products [shampoo, conditioner etc]. Bed was fine, coverings were immaculately white and very comfortable. Suggestion if you stay here - request a room high in the tower as the train runs directly next to it. I was on the 16th floor, and it was just fine. The restaurant that is connected to the hotel, I believe that it's called "312", was fine for both breakfast and dinner. We decided to stay close to home when eating, and we were both satisfied with the quality and presentation of the meals. The service at breakfast was a bit sparse, and it appeared to us that they were under-staffed on that particular morning.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: windycityaj
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here over the weekend and it was fabulous!! The room was a little small but the bed was sooooo comfy!! The location was great too. Wihin walking distance to everything. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OKAY - Good Location - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: cowtown10
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at a Kimpton hotel. The rooms were quite small, the bathrooms were so-so, the beds were lumpy, and the decor was odd. However the staff service is very good and the location is great. If you can get a deal on the room, then its worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TDC2
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay at another kimpton hotel, but left disappointed. We liked the free wifi (with free kimpton in touch membership), location in the loop near public transit, contemporary furnishings, late check-out, and early check-in. We were frustrated by a broken tv, spotty newspaper delivery, the random size of the rooms, and the lack of soundproofing. We were first given a room on the 17th floor next to the housekeeping storage area. In the morning there was a constant slamming of the door and talking amongst the staff around 8-9 am. When we expressed concern we were moved to another room. Rather than move, I would have preferred they address the specific concern, but we didn't want to be annoying so we moved without comment. Our new location was across from the fitness center and the room was much smaller. Punishment? Well, as long as it was quiet we were happy. However, each evening there were howling and whimpering dogs around 11/12 at night. Definitely not as annoying as slamming doors, but still, Really? We told the front desk, they said they would send security, but that solved nothing - I didn't expect it to. We lived with it. We do like dogs anyhow. We just wondered why we were moved from the door slamming floor to the dog level. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and comfort for a "hip" hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kipwingerjr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pet friendly - a massiv plus for me. For those scared of pets/smell/noise, do NOT worry. My dog didn't even stress about smells, and there was absolutely no clue that there was wear/noise/etc from pets. They took my pooch's picture for the front desk, and gave little treats (leash, baggies for walks, treats, etc). Hotel was well-maintaned and very clean with modern appointments. NOTICE - JOIN Kimpton's InTouch frequent traveler club before your stay. You will receive $10 towards the minibar, free wireless, etc. The room itself was indeed small, but fitting a King size bed in an average size room makes it seem worse. No matter - there was plenty of room for 2 adults, a dog and her large crate, clothing, etc. Desk and large armoire are in the room. The bathroom is well appointed, but also small. Not cramped though, just perfect for one person at a time. We faced the el train and had NO NOISE, so that was fantastic. Overall, great place and will stay again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Parties, Terrible for Business”
Reviews.Author: keshet3
Reviews.Content: This would be a good hotel if you were spending one night in the city to see a play and you didn't care much about having a quiet, relaxing, comfortable night. Otherwise, there are far better hotels in the area that are infinitely better than Hotel Allegro. The best things about this hotel are the fantastic bell hops and room service. And the art deco theme is wonderfully done. Otherwise, its a fairly dismal, low-class hotel. The "quiet room" we requested may actually be quiet when the only noise you would have to deal with is the usual hall noise, but we could hear every word (and everything) the people next door were up to until 11:30 pm, by which time we called the front desk and security asked our love bird neighbors to be a bit quieter. Perhaps these people were just exceptionally loud? But even without the noise, the King bed in our room was simply awful- it was rock hard and actually slanted towards the floor. The room itself, as so many others have pointed out, is very small (especially with a king bed) and the bathroom tiny, but clean and well designed. Overall, the hotel worked for us because it was in walking distance to the building where we were giving a presentation, but I would never recommend it to out-of-town friends and we will definitely not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great over-all Experience !”
Reviews.Author: RoyalsFan60
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Hotel Allegro. The front desk staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful, and the doormen were very pro-active in seeing if I needed directions to wherever I was going. The bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in . . .. certainly the most comfortable of any hotel bed. Everything looked clean and updated, and it was very quiet (I requested a room not facing street noise). The location is great if you're going to see shows, such as "Shrek" or "Billy Elliot." You can walk to many restaurants including "restaurant row" up on Ontario Street in about 10 or 15 minutes. Or if you want to take the L train, there's a station a block away around the corner of the hotel (at Washington St. & Wells). There are 3 computers in a little room next to the front desk in case you need to check e-mail. It would be nice if they didn't charge extra for that (my only constructive criticism). There was also a wine tasting deal that they seem to have on a regular basis which seemed to be very popular.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel! From the service, the...”
Reviews.Author: Bumpkinbombs
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! From the service, the decor, the coffee and free cocktails..I love it. What a great place to stay in Chicago. A perfect 10!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Allegro in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tedferrer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently-located downtown so almost every thing you would like to see or go is accessible by foot. The hotel itself provides extra amenities like complimentary breakfast and free wine in the lobby from 5-7 pm. The rooms are okay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice style, solid all around, but a rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged33
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with only few days notice. Location good in theater district. Close to where I had some meetings and close to freeway entrance. Good feel inside typical of Kimpton hotel. Service friendly. Older, renovated building. I slept well and room clean. The main negative was the King room that I got was smaller than the rooms from New York City. The sink was the size of a laptop computer and water kept going onto the floor. However, the price for a 4 star was the least expensive, so on a relative value basis, it was acceptable. Overall, I'd stay there again as a single traveler, but space is small. Everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stylish Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kooltraveler84
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time in Chicago and the Hotel was Absolutely great. Kimpton Knows what they are doing. From the moment we arrived Miguel the doorman greeted us and took our luggage. We went up the very elegant but still cool stairs. Sort of felt like we were back in time but in a good way.I really like stairs by the way. The Lobby was HUGE! Stylish, colorful, fun but still sophisticated. Was really cool. Vanessa was very friendly and she checked us in, and the other girl I later learned her name was Katie and she was very friendly also. Chris our bellman took our luggage and he was super friendly. EVeryone here is VERY friendly. Samella at the front desk is also super friendly. SHe was at the front but she was just as good as any Cheif Concierge out there. She pointed us to great places to eat and gave us a little list. There are also maps at the front desk and you should ask for some cuz they are really usefull. She put all her attention on us and was very nice. Pros -Hotel itself is a pro - its cool, its sophisticated and its really really nice. just underwent a renovation. -Beds- those Kimpton beds are like sleepin on heaven -Location - close to everything and walking distance to everything. only $6 sumthing to the John Hancock building by Taxi. Macys on State is only like 3 blocks away. There is also a Dunkin DOnuts(which we dont have here in Los Angeles) and a 24 hour CVS around the corner. really usefull. -Wine Hour - really good all u can drink wine hour from 5-6 in the lobby. good cheese and good bread but ooooo dont try the brown one. It was like whole grain or sumthing. not the business. -The rooms are so cool. bed already mentioned and the TV was nice, Mini bar was nice and if your a Kimpton InTouch member, which is free to join you get free wireless and a $10 credit to the mini bar. -SERVICE!!!!!! Most importantly the service was awesome. Not stuffy but so friendly and personable. Absolutely everyone. The Room Attendants were also super friendly and helpfull. They gave us soap and towels when we saw them in the hall and they are very polite and professional. -Free 24 hour Fitness Center Cons- -Rooms are a little small but then again were in downtown CHicago. Bathrooms were small but they had MARBLE finishes which looked nice and the towles were very absorbent. But yea, I did wish the bathroom was bigger and that the doors to the bathroom would close completely because they were like these weird closet looking doors and even when they are close you can kinda see whats ont he inside which can be embarassing. -Parking Cost - $36 overnight but its across the street and apparrantly thats not so bad in Downtown CHicago. its $44 if you do valet. All in all I loved the hotel. I would come back again and I would most def reccomennd it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Service on board this cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: VikingCph
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff - and helpfull with whatever ? you may have. Don't miss the wine bar and the hot chocolate bar. Spacious rooms. Perfect for business and for theatre guests. A little quiet area during weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value, great location”
Reviews.Author: annielou82
Reviews.Content: Hotel Allegro is a great value choice central to the theatre district and multiple lines of the L. I've had good experiences before with Kimpton Hotels, and this was no exception. Very clean, good in-room amenities including free wifi and a very comfortable bed, good location (including extremely convenient access to O'Hare), and with a great restaurant attached. Easily 5 stars for the combination of both quality AND price.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls, Small Bathroom and Long Walk for Pet”
Reviews.Author: Czerniawski
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel was clean, cheap, in a good location and had a very friendly staff, nice gym and pet policy. However, beware that the walls are paper thin. Our neighbor was talking on his phone in the hallway and I could almost hear the person on the other end. Understand that the bed is not next to the door but separated by the **tiny** bathroom that fits one, and has a sink only big enough for brushing your teeth. Don't plan on washing your face if you don't want to get water all over the place. Lastly, beware that while the site is honest in telling you that the nearest green space for pets is four blocks away, those four blocks include a trip across Wacker, the river, and a trip down stairs to the river whereupon you will find a very narrow strip of green. I would not advise the walk in the winter. Finally, this part of the city is DEAD on the weekend so expect a train wide or walk to get to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: LS88
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel allegro in chicago illinois, while the hotel was nice please take my advice and do not stay here. I payed cash for the room and handed over my credit card for incedentals ($50.00) the next day my debit card was charged $200 clearly this had to be a mistake...i called the hotel manager who was the rudest person i have ever spoken with about the charge and was told that it was my fault i paid cash and that i could give him my bank account, routing, SS # and authorization code and he could call my bank and take care of it. Clearly i am smart enough not to give this information to anyone yet alone someone who had already taken more then should have been charged. I then called corporate to complain and let them know about the situation the only thing corporate could tell me is that they had already credited my account and that they were sorry and it was clearly my mistake. I then questioned them about the manager asking for all my information if they had already credited my account and they told me they didnt have an answer for me. So for your bank accounts sake do not stay here they are many other options in chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Perks, Staff needs help though”
Reviews.Author: masAndrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Chicago near all the theaters with easy access to everything the city has to offer. Hotel itself is great, I loved the funky style and the rooms were great though small but that is too be expected in the city. Only gripe about this place were the front desk staff. We booked our hotel online with a promotion for complimentary valet and when we got there of course they did not honor it. I had my printed confirmation, and they made me login to their web site where it still showed it as included... They still did not believe it. Hello?? Your own reservation system said parking was included, yet you don't honor it? I spoke to a manager the next day and the issue was resolved, but front desk staff needs some serious lessons in customer service. Extremely stuck up and rude. Not a way to treat anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Allegro has a LOT to Like”
Reviews.Author: calebindiana
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Allegro. This was our second time, our fourth at a Kimpton property. Overall, this hotel is very good value. Let's start with the upsides. The place is extremely clean and the staff is over-the-top courteous and helpful. There was free hot chocolate and hot cider and cookies from 2-4pm, served in a beautiful lobby, that just made it all seem fun. Then there's the traditional 5pm wine reception. And FREE wireless internet. And an "L" station is right around the corner. Location: a lot of people think they want to stay on North Michigan and pay a premium to be nearer the "shopping". But the big Macy's is downtown. Moreover, many of the best restaurants are in the west loop; in fact, many are on West Randolph, same as Allegro. And we went to the Cadillac Palace for a show, and it's attached to the hotel. So don't pick North Michigan without thinking. We decided better to take one cab (or train) to North Michigan one day rather than take a cab to the loop for dinner and shows. There were a few downsides. The rooms are really very small. There is no way this could be more than a 3 to 3.5 star hotel because of room size and configuration. Fancy hotels have bathrooms 2-3 times the size of the Allegro's. Our bellman had to go to the front desk TWICE with our room keys til we got one that worked. And front desk said they'd have a Tribune sent to my room in the morning, but they didn't. These are mostly trifles, but they remind you this is not a Ritz Carlton or Oberoi. We like Kimptons: like the glitz, the deco feel, the friendly staff, even the pets. And I got this hotel on Expedia for really cheap--$87 per room--during the holiday week. It was well, well worth that tariff. Might have got something even cheaper on Priceline, but I wanted this hotel and I wanted two rooms (which they gave me adjoining). I would always recommend considering Kimpton as a good value choice that is nicer and cooler than Embassy Suites or Sheraton or even Hyatt but much less expensive than Conrad or Ritz or Trump. And they tend to extremely well-located urban locations. Allegro fits the bill on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzslayer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Hotel Allegro for three nights early in December. We loved it from the moment we arrived. We were able to check in early which was great, and we had a late check-out. Althought the room was not huge, it was more than adequate, and the decor was adorable. Everything worked as it should- great water pressure and good hot and cold. People in other reviews had complained about the size of the bathroom and the french-style doors, but we thought it was fine. The bathroom was really cute with black marble floors, and carrera marble counter and subway tile in the shower. The Aveda toiletries were lovely. Everything was spotlessly clean. There was also a great magnifiying makeup mirror. We had two closets which while a little shallow, had ample room. The evening wine reception from 5-6 in the lobby was wonderful. Several choices of wine and delicious canapes each night. You don't need to dress up, and it was fun to chat with other guests. We had the package with free cocktails in their lounge, which was very nice. Drinks and food were excellent. Quite a popular place. The entire hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas and we loved the decor in the lobby and public rooms.The front desk couldn't have been more helpful. They gave us directions to every place we wanted to go, including a Google map for a place they weren't familiar with. Everyone was so nice, especially Samellia and Fidel. We were also given a $15 voucher to use anywhere in the hotel when I discovered that they no longer offer free coffee in the morning. We used it for a lovely Continental breakfast at their Cameo. The location was very close to all the theatres, and it was easy to get around by bus. It was also easy to take the blue line train to and from O'Hare for $2.25. We bought the 3-day CTA pass at the airport, and it's good for trains and busses. There is not much around the hotel for buying snacks or wine, etc. The CVS around the corner carries lots of everything, including alcoholic beverages, but it closes at 7pm on Saturdays. The hotel is in a very safe neighborhood- we walked five blocks from where a friend is staying on Michigan Ave at 2:30 am, and had no problems. We can't say enough good things about this hotel. The room rate and amenities were fantastic- a great deal. We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of Chicago's Best Hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: The Allegro Hotel is one of my favorite hotels in Chicago. Iâ€™ve stayed at other hotels in the city, but I wanted to stay at a Kimpton Hotel this time, and the complimentary wine hour surely helped with the decision. The hotel is located a block from the L that goes to Oâ€™Hare Airport â€“ get off at the Clark stop and walk a couple of blocks south. The entrance is a bit confusing at first because the check in desk is actually on the second floor. But if you need help with your baggage, there are always proactive bellboys that are willing to help out. Check was pretty quick, and we were lucky there was a room available for early check in. When we went into our room, I was expecting a very tiny room. The size of the room was actually decent. The dÃ©cor is wonderful, the bed is very comfortable (I remember sinking into the bed and dozing off within five seconds), the television is pretty large, and the bathroom was a decent size. One good thing about this hotel is that you can hook up your iPod to the radio and play your music. I guess the walls are pretty thick because we had the music pretty loud while we were getting ready to go out and no one complained. In fact, we never heard people walking around the hallway at night. There are a lot of restaurants in the area, and State Street shopping, city hall (Daley Plaza), and Michigan Avenue are just a few blocks away. The location is great for the L because the Washington and Clark stops are just a few blocks away. Our favorite part of the hotel was the wine hour. The first night there werenâ€™t a lot of people in the lobby, so they had flatbread pizza to go with the wine. They also had chestnuts and warm apple cider. The second night, there were a lot more people, so they only put out a variety of cheeses. The people serving the wine are very friendly and attentive, and they remembered the type of wines we were drinking â€“ even if there was only one type of red and white. Check out took a while since everyone was checking out at the same time. We left our bags with the bellboy since we werenâ€™t ready to leave Chicago yet. Overall, this hotel is wonderful. I would definitely stay here again because of the price, location, and wine hour.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great hotel and stay...with a few trivial items to note”
Reviews.Author: kaufma22
Reviews.Content: For the most part, my husband and I were thrilled with our stay at the Hotel Allegro. The bellman and the evening concierge were TOP-NOTCH. And the complimentary wine hour.....fabulous! After reading reviews ahead of time about how small the rooms were, I was a little nervous, considering we were bringing our 65-lb. dog with us and worried we'd not have enough room. But the room was great! Plenty of room for our stuff, not to mention our dog, her pillow, food/drink and her toys! I had two great nights of sleep in that bed! The bathroom was a tad small, but the shower was heavenly. Now onto the things we didn't care for: The woman who checked us in didn't explain the amenities (the wine hour, if there was a breakfast or free coffee in the lobby, etc.) I had to ask about all of this. And I knew we were supposed to get a doggie goody bag when we checked in. On the way up to our room after check-in, I remembered this and mentioned it in front of the bellman. He offered to go back down and get it, but my husband ended up going back for it. Also, it makes sense, from a liability standpoint, to not have housekeeping clean a room when there's a dog (or other animal) in it without the owners present. However, we were not informed of this and came back from an afternoon of shopping with our room still uncleaned. I had to call and make a request for our room to be cleaned and we had to leave the room, with our dog, for another few hours. I also requested turn-down service and when we returned to our room, it had not been done. We got a call about 20 minutes later to tell us they couldn't do it with the dog in the room. So we just canceled it. Again, not a huge deal in the scheme of things, but if would've been nice to know this when I made the initial request. The hotel promotes a "grassy knoll" four blocks from the hotel as someplace you can take your pet to do its duty. When we arrived there, my husband and I started laughing. It was barely a grassy anything! After that we started taking her to Grant Park which was 6 blocks away and while it was December (and freezing), it was a much better place to take your dog. I'm not sure the hotel can do much about creating a place for its furry hotel guests to do their thing, but it could be something to think about! Again, we were 98.99% happy with our stay and we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DWeso
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a two night stay at the Hotel Allegro Chicago. We found the Hotel Allegro through Tripadvisor, and took a chance based on the reviews. It was our first stay and we could not be happier. I booked rooms for 3 other couples. Our group of eight all had high regard for the Hotel Allegro, and could not think of any negatives. Check In was quick, friendly and professional. Our rooms were just as described. Not huge but warm and cozy. Plenty of room to relax after a day of shopping, and a large, very comfortable bed. Modern amenities in the room. A large flat screen TV and a clock radio with an ipod dock. A GREAT shower. Every staff member I met from the desk clerk, bellman, housekeeping and front door men had a smile on their face and a kind greeting. The attached restaurant, 312, had an excellent Sunday breakfast. I wish they would have had two more waiters as service was a bit slow. But the waiters on duty were hustling as best they could. Hotel Allegro-Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “A South Loop Favorite”
Reviews.Author: CincyMom
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyed a return visit to Allegro. Great staff, super-comfy beds and truly hi-speed internet access. Loved the Wii in the lobby. Only disappointment was that attached fine restaurant (which I enjoyed previously) was closed on Monday night. Used yelp.com to find nearby steakhouse, N9NE, just over Chicago River -- short walk. Loved the convenience of walking to the train back to O'Hare. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & great experience”
Reviews.Author: Woojin K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Allegro Chicago for 3 days during thanksgiving break. I booked the hotel through priceline very cheaply and was worried about the quality of the hotel because of it. Well, the worries disappeared as soon as I walked into the hotel. As we had a larger room for my family, it was spacious, clean, and modern looking. All hotel employees were very friendly and housekeeping ladies did a great job everyday!! I was very impressed by how they control the quality of the hotel with lower rates. I recommend this place for you who travel with family, a significant others, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: kconley
Reviews.Content: The only minus for this hotel is they do not provide the free morning coffee at all the other Kimpton hotels. It was a great place to stay for the theater but our rate did say morning coffee. The robes were not in the room and it took a long time (hours) but other than that a great place. The concierge was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A different side of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: biggfoot18
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try a little different hotel from the mega hotels on Wacker and Michigan Avenue area, so via travelzoo, we found an excellent deal on a huge room at the Hotel Allegro. Super location in the Theatre district, the hotel is a boutique hotel and has an upscale "neo" urban feel. Funky decorations in the lobby, loud (too loud really) new techno-type music, fast paced feel and good service greet you at the door. The only reason I dinged the service at all was Restaurant 312 on the corner and connected to the hotel had bad service one day, but otherwise the bellmen, desk people, housekeepers and security were all great. Very trendy look in the lobby and seating areas, there is a complimentary wine service in the early evening and complimentary continental breakfast in the morning. The hotel also has a lot of older/historic charm and has recently undergone a large scare upgrade. Our room was the best however. A suite, great seating area with 60's style couches and light fixtures, an inroom bar, flat panel HD tv (didn't work great) and a table for sitting and one for office work. The bedroom was large with a Kind sized bed (very very comfy), high end pillows, sheets and mattresses, huge armoire and HD TV. Bedroom views were just of other buildings, so nothing special, but they did have great "blackout" blinds. The bath was awesome with a giant, two person whirlpool tub. All high end fixtures, funky flooring and decorating. Very different feel for sure. We had a great time with friends and would say this has fit in our top 5 Chicago hotels for sure. The only thing I would tell management is---turn down the crazy euro-tech muszak...I exepected to see Hans and Franz working out in the lobby or at least some skinny white guy dancing.

Reviews.Title: “NIce stay at the Hotel Allegro”
Reviews.Author: Schmengi9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Allegro over a long weekend a couple weeks back and thought overall that the hotel was very nice and worthy of its class and the reviews we had seen. We booked through PL and although the Allegro was not our first choice, we were very pleased. The hotel is right next to the Palace Theater and Chicago City Hall and has a number of services nearby and is just a short walk from State Street. It was very conveniently accessed from both the Kennedy Expressway and the L, which was two blocks away at Clark/Lake. Self-parking is about $35 a day in the ramps nearby ($49 valet), but you can save yourself a few bucks parking at Grant Park ($29) and walking the six blocks. The lobby and registration are upstairs one floor from the street, with plenty of valet and bell help at street level. Once checked in, we headed up to our room on the 8th floor, only to find out it was a double. After deciding against being Ozzie & Harriet for the weekend, we went back down and were quickly changed to a king without any fuss. As other posts have mentioned, the rooms are a bit on the small side and a little more like what you might find in Europe. We thought our room was clean and that good use was made of what space was available so that we didn't feel cramped. We had two small closets to hang clothes and a three-drawer dresser. The bed was also very comfortable. Our room was on the northwestern corner of the building, which sits at the corner of Wells and Randolph. The western leg of the Loop L runs on Wells, but we really didn't have too much trouble with noise from that or the street below. My only possible complaint with the room was with the mini-bar refrigerator, which cycled almost constantly, after which there was a audible "pop" of the condenser. We didn't avail ourselves of any of the hotel amenities during this stay. The hotel bar looked like what you'd expect from a hotel bar, while the restaurant looked like it might possibly attract a non-hotel guest clientele. Overall, we were please with our stay and would stay at the Hotel Allegro again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: greatbeyond
Reviews.Content: Hotel Allegro was super nice. Every bit of it was clean. The lobby area was open and inviting. The staff was really friendly. I loved that they had their favorite movies on their name tags. The concierge helped us with booking a comedy show at Second City and explaining to us how to get there. There was also a wine reception at 5pm in the lobby with cheese and Wii. And I guess it's a pet friendly hotel cause there were bowls everywhere and pictures of dogs everywhere. The room was a good size, also really clean. Interesting wallpaper and nice carpets. iPod dock by the bed for an iPod. Bathroom was on the smaller side but still decent. Free Wifi in the room always a plus. Fitness center was a good size too and clean. 3 treadmills and some elipticals. Some weights too. TVs in the room as well. Location was good too. Close to transportation and also within walking distance from a lot. I would definitely recommend the hotel. The only problem we had was with the printer in the business center. We were only trying to print boarding passes but it wasn't working. I know they had known about the printer with the Mac but we were using the PC and it didn't work. I'm sure they'll fix it. And the restaurant hooked to the hotel never seemed to be open either but there are plenty of dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and plan on going back”
Reviews.Author: Strike_a_Pose
Reviews.Content: Everyone there was so helpful and nice. It was my absolute first time ever in Chicago and everyone there showed me where to go and how to get there. They told me where to stay away from. They let me know to eat and what to see. The room itself was a bit smaller than i expected but whatever, i only used it to sleep. The room was clean, the bathroom was fancy. The only thing i didn't like was that there was a wedding while i was staying and tons of people running around everywhere but no biggie. I plan on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyfett28
Reviews.Content: If I ever return to Chicago, then the Hotel Allegro is the Place I would like to stay. Very friendly & efficent staff. Not a single complaint over the 10 nights of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and funky-look hotel”
Reviews.Author: onomatopee
Reviews.Content: The Allegro hotel is nicely located in the Theater District and you can easily walk to many attractions nearby. The service was friendly, the room was very clean, the beds were very comfy and since we had a suite, we could enjoy the jacuzzi in the bathroom. The decor is quite modern, it reminded me a bit of the W hotels. The only two things that I wish they had was a coffee/tea maker and a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Gat0rTravelers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was great and the price was reasonable as well. Very easy access from the airport by train (do not pay $40 on a cab, take the train for $2.25). The staff at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. We arrived at 11:30 am and were able to check in (that never happens!). The concierge staff was awesome, so helpful and knowledgeable. Then there is the free wine and cheese happy hour every night from 5-6. A great way to rest from a long day of sight seeing and get ready for a fun night on the town. The rooms and bathrooms are very small but how much time do you really spend in there anyway. I also loved the Art Deco dÃ©cor of the hotel. We loved Chicago and this hotel was part of the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Apointed, Tiny Rooms, High Price”
Reviews.Author: LucyBrownlee
Reviews.Content: Re-done in very Mod decore, which was not to my taste, but really doesn't matter in the overall reasons for liking a hotel. The beds and bedding were very comfortable, though we had doubles and the bed was so small my husbands feet hung over the end, and he had to sleep diagonal on it, which was funny. The rooms are TINY, the bathroom was TINY, if you are a large person, you won't like it. Had a really nice big TV. Stocked wet bar that was not as over-priced as some I've seen. No complimentary coffee in the morning. Free wine and beer in the Lobby at 5, which is different. Staff was exceptional, 5 star all the way. Good for business I suppose. Our rooms were comped, and I would not pay the going rate for this hotel. You can park across the street for $36 for 24 hours, or at the hotel for $44 or $50 if you valet.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated the modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: I was actually pleasantly surprised by this hotel. One of my traveling companions is a real Kimpton 'afficionado" and insisted that during our stay in Chicago we stay at Kimpton Hotels. His favorite, the Hotel Monaco was prohibitively expensive for the first leg of our trip so we decided on the Allegro which was new to all of us. I arrived a day ahead of my traveling friends and checked into a room that was more spacious than I expected after reading these reviews. I mean it wasn't the Taj Mahal, but it was easy to move around for the most part, and the furniture was well placed. The check in clerk kindly let me know that there were two closets and the one with the hangers in it was behind a door that looked like a connecting room. With that advice, no closet problems. The bathroom is indeed pintsized, but that is mitigated by nice Aveda products, a good shower fixture with good pressure, and a cute little modern sink area. The bed was comfortable. My clock radio was an IPod dock which I really appreciate when traveling to recharge mine, and the desk provided a good and needed work space as I brought some office work to get done while waiting for my friends to arrive. The desk also had an outlet carousel which I appreciated for my laptop and phone charging. I joined the Kimpton "In Touch" loyalty program to gain free wireless internet access. Even the application process is kind of fun as you answer questions about your preferences and priorities when traveling. I didn't have much of a view-being surrounded on all sides by other tall office buildings, but it wasn't unpleasant. The decor was nice and modern. It was a comfortable place to sleep, work and relax between excursions. Even the minibar had a good wine to enjoy before bed. The hotel bar was very nice, the food and drinks good, reasonably priced and served by friendly professionals. Employees were courteous and helpful. Although it isn't in the center of the touristy part of the city, we found restaurants, bars, a breakfast cafe, shops and Starbucks within a few blocks' walk. They also have a wine hour in the late afternoon which is a nice touch. It is the opposite of the "old money" feel of the established, larger hotels such as the Intercontinental, Fairmont, etc, nor is it a cookie cutter business traveler's hotel. It seems designed for a younger clientele. I'm no spring chicken, but I felt very comfortable there. All my needs were met, and so for the price, it was a good choice for me. Although I didn't bring a pet along, I saw some pretty cute little doggie guests in the elevators. I'd recommend this hotel to my younger friends in particular.

Reviews.Title: “No place to hang your clothes!”
Reviews.Author: cat7104
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Kimpton hotels and this one, like others, has great style. This isn't one of their best, though. This is the first hotel room I've ever been in that didn't have anyplace to hang up my clothes - no closet, no wardrobe, no nothing. Which was definitely a bit of an issue as I was in town on business and had jackets and pants that needed a hanger. For that reason alone, I probably wouldn't stay here again on business. I would definitely recommend their Encore bar, though - great atmosphere and really good bar food!

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic with Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: chibiutena
Reviews.Content: The website for this hotel was so gorgeous that my friends came expecting to be awed...instead what I got was probably the worst room in the entire hotel. It was the size of my college dorm room, the bathroom can be more or less described as an 'efficiency' and my view (way up high on the 10th floor)...brace yourself...was of a parking lot across the street. What made it worse was that it was 2 steps from the elevator so all I heard during the night were the dings of people going up and down. Which brings me up to my next point...I had 2 friends over to watch tv for a few hours before going out and management called my room 4 times to complain about the 'noise level'. At one point they said 'we are going to have to ask you to leave if this keeps up' ...not a great thing to say to a guest? especially when that guest has to listen to the elevator all night. In summary, this hotel should not be considered a 4 star. I've stayed at holiday inns that were much more quiet, considerate and BIGGER. Maybe they just like to yank my chain because I bought it off of priceline and maybe therefore DESERVED the worst possible room at this hotel but it wasn't even that cheap! at this price point, I would've been better off putting up an extra 50 to be pampered, not insulted.

Reviews.Title: “Good ol' Bismarck Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ghalm00
Reviews.Content: A true American Classic. Stayed here when it was the Bismarck (now the Hotel Allegro) a couple times back in the early-to-mid 1990's. It was like a travel back into time...1920's decor and rooms that made one feel like you were stepping out of a Fitzgerald novel. I love this place...wish it still had it's old name and vibe...oh! Capone was known to take up the Penthouse and hole himself up in there for many days at a stretch. :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you know Chicago fairly well or if you're going to a show”
Reviews.Author: Native_Chicagoan11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine if you can get a deal for the room. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown right by the theater district. There's not much going on this part of town at night, so it's not the best place to be if you're not familiar with the city. If you want to do more tourist stuff - stay near the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “funky!”
Reviews.Author: sjw492
Reviews.Content: Old charm of an antique/boutique hotel, with funky modern decor and updates. Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Allegro: nice location, not ideal business hotel though”
Reviews.Author: Beck777
Reviews.Content: Pros: location, nice lobby set-up; wine tasting (did not participate though); comfortable beds; good television; nice fitness center. Cons: Bathroom size; sink set-up is awful for people who wash their hair in the sink; no coffee; no paper; alarm clock comes with no instructions and is complex--or just didn't work properly; thin walls; room service never got it right.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the best city with the best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: libbeadage
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago and we had no idea where the best location was to stay, whether it was better to be up by the gold coast, in the mag mile or downtown in the loop and there were so many hotels to choose from...but we think we found the best hotel in the best location! We stayed in Chicago for ten nights and the Hotel Allegro is perfectly positioned, everything is walkable - the magnificent mile, navy pier, gold coast beach & the "bean" are all a short walk away. The hotel has a modern boutique feel to it, from the moment of check-in the staff are very helpful and nice, we never waited more than a few seconds for a lift to our room and the rooms though a little small are perfectly fine for a couple sharing (Chicago has so much to offer you won't be in your room that much anyway!) The decour of the room is very trendy and the huge flat screen TV is a definite plus! A special mention has to be given to the conceirge, Mark can help you with anything and constantly provided us with great places to eat & drink that suited our taste's and interests - he certainly improved what was already a great holiday. We loved Chicago & Hotel Allegro - if we ever come back to Chicago again, we will make sure to stay at the Allegro again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Allegro-tops in service!”
Reviews.Author: greenwayplanner
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of Kimpton Hotels, however I have never experienced top service as I did at the Hotel Allegro. Even before my visit, concierge Mark Kraemer advised us on things to see, and booked tickets in advance to Second City. We were welcomed warmly on arrival, and the bellman checked up on us as we came and went from the hotel. All the staff have a personal interest in making your stay a great experience. The hotel is next to City Hall, where I had some business. We had a large quiet room, and used room service-the meal came quickly, and included a a bonus fruit cup. Enjoyed the pasta night (20 dollars for a three course meal) at the 312 restaurant-the starter and the dessert were wonderful, the main pasta a bit too salty. And that is the only complaint I can make-from start to finish, if you want attentive service, this is the place to be. Thank you, Hotel Allegro, for a great stay. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, but comfortable. trendy look”
Reviews.Author: ennekube
Reviews.Content: I traveled into Chicago with a colleague for a conference. We stayed five nights. The hotel has a very trendy look. The room was small (especially compared to other hotels I've stayed at in downtown Chicago) but very comfortable. No free continental breakfast (there were pastries and coffee available downstairs for a fee, or for those with vouchers). There was free wi-fi access and an enormous flat-screen TV. The fitness center was small and quickly became packed, especially in the early AM. It was fairly noisy at night on the weekends, but better on the weekdays. I would recommend this for those traveling to sightsee, but not as much for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fun, nice change of pace”
Reviews.Author: peterclone
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with my spouse mid-week. $100/night off Internet special. Typical small downtown hotel room, it had been recently remodeled and was higher tech than most rooms I stay in. WiFi was solid, desk has a dozen plugs for charging everything, etc. We walked or took the train everywhere- it was great not having to worry about traffic of parking. Easy access to both Cubs and White Sox via the Red line. Yes, the decorating is offbeat, but if you want a generic Marriott stay in the suburbs. Kimpton Hotels are not for everyone. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What was everybody complaining about??”
Reviews.Author: Calially
Reviews.Content: I am a tripadvisor voyeur and rarely post but felt the need this time. I just returned today from Hotel Allegro and wanted to share the following tips. 1.The hotel is old and has been nicely remodeled, the walls are thin (you hear everything) and yes the bathroom is small, but if you get the room for $83 dollars a night, so what?? We spent maybe 8 hrs a day in the room. I stayed in 1403, and my room was large, the bed was adequate, and the flat screen was large. I got the great rate from Travelzoo.com. 2. The parking is horrible, no really it is.. They wanted $49 for valet and $45 for self parking. The city of Chicago has privatized all the parking structures and meters so don't waste time looking for a cheaper parking garage. My relative who lives in the city told me to park at Union Station, which was $10 for 24hrs on the weekend, and $20 other times. The first night we took a cab to the hotel and it was $6, and the other nights we walked, it's really not far, maybe 5 blocks. So, either, way it's way cheaper and was worth it for me to not pay more for parking then for the room. 3. Basically, a good value for the price and the location is great.
